ftbquests.chapter.data.title: The Decursio Project: Expert
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.title: 奥秘蜕变 - 1
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.0.subt: 与恶魔为伍。 左键点击获取更多信息。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.0.desc: 为了取得进一步的进展，您必须与一名女巫分享秘仪教典(这是你在开始时收到的阿卡什宝典中包含的书籍之一)。她将帮你绘制邪恶符文，这是成魔之路上必不可少的一环。
任务：把秘仪教典丢给女巫。
注意：这个任务是为了标记你需要做的事情。完成任务实际上并不意味着你完成了这件事。
上图是一个女巫正在秘仪教典上绘制邪恶符文。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.0.task: 将秘仪教典交给一名女巫。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.1.subt: 白镴锭可以用铅和铁在匠魂冶炼炉中合金获得。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.2.subt: 坩埚供应水和特定的热源的时候， 可以用来合成物品。 左键点击获取更多信息。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.2.desc: 首先，你即将使用的坩埚并非幻梦模组中的坩埚，这个坩埚和那个有功能上的不同。来看看该如何使用。
用坩埚合成物品， 你必须倒上水，并在下方提供热源.。这有两种热源可用，对你制作物品来说非常重要。
你可以使用普通的营火，或者灵魂营火。部分配方要求使用普通营火，而另一部分要求使用灵魂营火。如果提供了错误的热源，那么坩埚中的所有物品都将被清除。
现在，该如何合成物品呢？很简单。将水倒入坩埚，扔进材料，最后扔进该配方的催化剂。如果投放的材料无误，屏幕上会显示对应配方的产物和催化剂。
“如果我朝坩埚里扔了错误的物品该怎么办？”
我们只能建议你使用坩埚时一定要小心谨慎。放入错误的物品会使放入的材料无法合成任何东西，又因为无法取出，所以这些物品就彻底离你而去了，如果扔入错误的催化剂也是同样的情况。
“好吧，如果我把坩埚搞得一团糟该如何重置呢？”
最后，使用JEI查看哪些配方使用普通营火，哪些配方使用灵魂营火。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.3.subt: 用于执行仪式。左键点击查看示例
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.3.desc: 上面这个例子是月光仪式，需要4个石之手，可以加快白天时间直至太阳落山。开始任何仪式均只需用打火石右键单击火盆。
请注意，许多物品是通过仪式获得的。虽然幻梦得到了JEI的支持，但这并不完善。所以在物品上按“R”查看配方，按“U”查看用途所显示的配方并不全面。我们会尝试通过任务描述来帮助你解决这个问题。
最后，请注意所有的火盆仪式都需要石之手与火盆处于同一个y轴。更高级的仪式物品容器也一样，如暗蚀焦点。切勿忽略。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.4.subt: 建造你的第一个祭坛，向黑暗领主祈祷
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.4.desc: 下图展示了基础祭坛的摆放方式。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.5.subt: 这个仪式用于获取灵魂碎片。查阅秘仪教典以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.6.subt: 你可以使用这种仪式召唤亡灵生物。这种仪式有不同的版本，取决于你要召唤的生物。注：可以用这个仪式召唤凋零骷髅
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.7.subt: 这种仪式正如其名，会吸引附近的友善生物来到仪式中央。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.8.subt: 这个仪式可以在一个很大的范围内将生物驱离
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.9.subt: 施展黑魔法恐吓村民。这个仪式可以让他们更快原谅你
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.10.sub: 你可以通过这个仪式跳过夜晚。虽然睡觉也可以度过夜晚，但这个仪式或许在有怪物不允许你睡觉的情况下有用
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.11.sub: 你可以用这个仪式进入夜晚。很有用
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.12.sub: 这仪式将治愈附近所有的僵尸村民。也能把僵尸疣猪兽和僵尸猪灵变回他们原来的样子。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.12.tas: 治愈， 现在更便宜了？
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.13.sub: 在你的坩埚中混合出小型灵魂宝石
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.14.sub: 在坩埚中将金锭、红石、灵魂碎片在混合一起
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.15.sub: This workbench has the ability to combine certain magical items into powerful tools. For some recipes, additional items will be required in the special Tool Slots of the Workbench
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.16.sub: You'll have to give The Dark Lord an offering. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.16.des: Made from Arcane Gold, the goblet will serve as the perfect vessel for your sacrifices's blood.
To perform a sacrifice, you'll have to kill an animal next to the goblet which will be placed on the Altar.
After the animal was killed, its blood will be placed in the goblet. Next, you'll have to perform the \"Sacrifice Animal\" chant to give the blood to The Dark Lord.
Ps: The Goblet will not act as a portable tank, you'll have to bring the animal to the goblet, not the other way around.
Task: Obtain the goblet and make your first sacrifice.
Note: Keep in mind that this quest is here to keep track of what you need to do. Finishing it, doesn't actually mean you did what you HAD TO.
Lastly, here's an example of an altar with a goblet filled with blood, placed on it:
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.17.sub: Close to H3!! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.17.des: Use The Touch of Darkness chant on a Pewter Inley to obtain a powerful, yet unholy artifact. The Unholy Symbol may be used to further impress The Dark Lord.
It will also give you the ability to make new powerful objects, which you might find useful.

This item will NOT be used in any Magic Workbench recipe (like a Bucket would not be used in a Cake recipe). Now, this item will be used in some other recipes, such as the Brazier Rituals from Eidolon.
Keep in mind that you'll have to throw the inlay on the ground and then, chant at it.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.18.sub: Crafting the scythe will allow you to open The Nether Portal. It will also allow you to harvest soul shards more easier. Once you have the Scythe, move towards the \"Nether\" tab in the \"Dimensional Explorer\" chapter group. To see the recipe for the Scythe, press \"U\" on the Unholy Symbol. The Scythe's recipe will use any Kama from Tinker's Construct. You'll also need a Necrotic Focus for the Ritual!
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.19.sub: Decapitation. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.19.des: As you progress further, you'll find out the The Dark Lord seems to ignore your prayers.
Maybe upgrading your altar will impress him.
There are multiple skulls which will add to the altar's power.
Example of how a skull should be placed on the altar:
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.19.tas: Ghather any of a wither skull/a skeleton skull/a zombie head
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.20.sub: Plants, we love 'em. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.20.des: Oh, herbs - fundamental in any magician's arsenal.
However, unlike other magicians, you'll need theese herbs for different purposes.
Similar to the skulls, the hearbs will augment your altar.
下图展示了如何在祭坛上摆放草药：
多个草药的效果不会叠加。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.20.tas: 采集一朵凋零玫瑰/绯红菌/诡异菌
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.21.sub: 恶魔召唤者。左键点击获取更多信息。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.21.des: 邪恶符文是第一种联系黑暗领主的方法，由女巫授予。或许咏唱这个符文将是你接下来几个晚上要做的第一件事，以便后续进展。
需要注意的是，和其他祈祷的方式一样，你必须多次尝试，并且每天只能祈祷一次。如果你听到火焰熄灭的声音，那么说明你的祈祷没有被黑暗领主听到。
目标：首次向黑暗领主祈祷
注意：这个任务是为了标记你需要做的事情。完成任务实际上并不意味着你完成了这件事。
祈祷时应咏唱的祈文如下：
进行咏唱，需要打开秘仪教典中的神秘符文标签，并选择咏唱所需的符文。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.22.sub: 双手沾满鲜血。左键点击获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.22.des: 血液符文是黑暗领主的恩赐。这个符文允许你进行牲祭，继续前进吧。
目标：多次祈祷以获得血液符文。
注意：这个任务是为了标记你需要做的事情。完成任务实际上并不意味着你完成了这件事。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.23.sub: 魂之赠礼。左键点击获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.23.des: 魂魄通常被认为是每个人内在的生命精髓。向黑暗领主展示你献上灵魂的决心，你需要一个特定符文来做祈祷。
目标：多次牲祭以获得魂魄符文。
注意：这个任务是为了标记你需要做的事情。完成任务实际上并不意味着你完成了这件事。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.24.sub: 光影交织，这种宝石似乎可以用于幻梦模组中的很多配方
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.25.sub: 这种紫色布料可以用来制作一套精良的护甲
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.26.sub: 第一纪元的奥秘蜕变将始于幻梦。进游戏时，你收到的阿卡什宝典中包含秘仪教典，它是幻梦发展中必不可少的一部分。如果丢失了阿卡什宝典，可以用一本书和一个腐肉来合成秘仪教典。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.27.sub: Advanced Rituals: The Nectrotic Focus will allow you to execute advanced Rituals, which usually, give you very powerful items. It has to be on the same Y level as the Brazier and the Stone Hands. Skeleton Skulls can be found throut the world in Dungeons. Good luck exploring! Left Click for an example
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.27.des: In the picture shown below, you can see an example of a JEI recipe which uses a Necrotic Focus. That tiny icon is the Necrotic Focus. Remember, JEI DOES NOT show you the output of a Ritual recipe, so don't get confused, the Necrotic Focus is the place where other ingredients will be placed:
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.28.sub: By combining Sulfur (Eidolon) and Bonemeal with Charcoal in a Crucible, you can obtain Gunpowder
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.29.sub: By combining Rotten Flesh with Enchanted Ash in a Crucible, you can obtain leather
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.30.sub: Ancient and powerful, aren't they? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.30.des: Using the Sword Chant, you might raise The Dark Lord's interest into you just high enough that they might reward you with The Unstable Elemental Core. With this relic you can make a powerful weapon out of 5 versions. While you can make all of them with enough Cores, for now, you'll just have one, so choose your blade wisely.
You can see these weapons in the 'Tools - 1' tab.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.31.sub: You might forget your flint and steel at a point. With the Chant of Flames you can light up camp fires, braziers and more. You'll have to give the Ars Ecclesia to a Cleric Vilagger to obtain the Sacred Sign required for this chant
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.33.sub: The second Altar will allow you to advance further in the eyes of The Dark Lord
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.34.sub: This chant will be needed in order to obtain the Mind Sign. Note that you won't be able to use this chant to progress until you unlock the \"Sacrifice Villager\" page in the \"Theurgy Chapter\" of the Ars Ecclesia. This can be done by performing the \"Sacrifice Animal\" chant at a Stone Tier Altar for a few nights. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.34.des: Now, that you've unlocked the knlowledge required for this Chant, let's learn how to use it. Note that this quest can be finished just by randomly killing a Villager. However, what you actually need to do in order to progress further, is to kill a villager next to an Altar which has a Goblet on it, and then, pray to the Dark Lord until you receive the Mind Sign.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.34.tas: Kill a Villager for a Sacrifice
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.35.sub: MasterMind. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.35.des: The Mind Sign is the final sign you'll get from The Dark Lord.
With it, you'll be able to focus all of your knowledge towards one object, thus enhancing its abilities.
Task - Obtain The Mind Sign by making multiple Villager Sacrifices at a Stone Tier Altar.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.36.sub: Hard Difficulty Required - The Mini-Boss fight. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.36.des: The Elemental of Flames is a mini boss added by Eidolon's Hexblades. It has 120 health points and it is quite powerful, so be prepared for it.
Defeating it has a chance of rewarding you with The Soul of an Elemental. While it may not drop this item, the quest will give it to you anyway.
PS: You can also obtain this soul by performing the Elemental Soul Creation chant on a Nether Star.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.37.sub: They can be upgraded. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.37.des: The Mind Sign will be required for this task. Focus your attention towards obtaining that.
After unlocking The Mind Sign you'll have to use your current Hexblade and defeat mobs until new knowledge will be grated to you.
To see your progress, you can use this command:
Ps: Lever 30 needs to be reached.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.38.sub: You can find its recipe in the Ars Ecclesia. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.38.des: Great, you've chanelled enough power into your weapon and now you can upgrade it.
To do so, you'll need a more powerful core then the previous one. Now, where could you get one..?
Luckly, you can make it yourself. Press \"U\" on some Nether Quartz to see the Brazier Recipe. You'll need a Shadow Gem, a Lava Bucket and some other things.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.39.sub: Hard Difficulty Required - Beware, the Fire Temple. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.39.des: Throughout the Nether, you might find some strange temples which have hieroglyphs on their walls resambling the Magmatic Core you obtained previously.
In the temple's main room, you'll find a pedestal. By placing the Magmatic Core on it and performing the Elemental Pedestal Activation Chant, which will summon a Fire Elemental.
Be aware. This will be a mini-boss fight. You might wanna prepare yourself before anything else.
Note: Keep in mind that this quest is here to keep track of what you need to do. Finishing it, doesn't actually mean you did what you HAD TO.
Picture of the Fire Elemental Tample:
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.39.tas: Use the Elemental Pedestals Activation chant on the Fire Pedestal
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.40.sub: Use Crying Obsidian to make the Vanilla Enchanting Table
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.41.sub: Crying Obsidian can either be found in the world, or crafted using a ritual. Tip, press \"U\" on an Onion to see the recipe which is made in a Brazier
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.42.sub: Engineering of dark magic at its best. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.42.des: Great! You found a way to get your hands on the power of that Sigil.
This fabric is two times stronger then that Wicked Weave you've learned about previously.
Using it, you should be able to come up with some sort of protecting costume.
IMPORTANT: This recipe has to be execute ONE BY ONE, at a time.
Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
You'll need a Sanguine Crystal which will not be consumed by the recipe.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.43.sub: The Shadow Infused Ingot is quite an impressive alloy. Made out of pewter, arcane gold and some other ingredients, it is able to provide great amounts of protection to its owner. However, the armor made out of this thing might not be that accesible at this point
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.44.sub: The End is not available to you yet, however, you can obtain this powder infused with small amounts of it. You might be able to find a use for it
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.45.sub: Children of The Dark Lord. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.45.des: You finally reached the point where you have the trust of The Dark Lord.

This Sigil represents the trust and faith that they have in you. At the same time, it holds very large amounts of power, too large for you, to be precise. But we believe that this will not stop you, now will it? We're sure you'll find a use for this thing. Meanwhile, how do you get it exactly?
Use the \"Blessing of Darkness\" on a Shadow Gem to obtain The Sigil of The Dark Lord.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.46.sub: All the blood I'll ever use. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.46.des: If you're reading this, it means you are ready to embrace the role of The Dark Lord's messanger.
Finishing this quest will grant access to a powerful set of armor.
We're congratulating you for reaching this point.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.47.sub: Similar to the Calx of End, the Refined Crimson is a fine powder, infused with the essence of The Nether
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.48.sub: Candles? Lamps? Give 'em to me! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.48.des: Again. similar to the skulls and the herbs, lighting can be used to upgrade the altar and attract The Dark Lord's attention faster.
Below, you can see an example of how lighting should be placed on the altar:
Multiple light sources, will NOT stack.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.48.tas: Make a candle/torch/lamp and place it on the altar
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.49.sub: Can stone be alive? Thats the question of the day. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.49.des: This smooth stone seems to have a strange linger to it, its like it is speaking to you.
Through the use of other mystical arts, you might be able to give it life in the future, but for now, it just looks awesome, so go ahead, build with it!
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.50.sub: Although you have no idea what this shard really is, or what it does, you might be able to get your hands on it if you manage to give a Gold Nugget to a Curbuncle. Additionally, you might find this Shard in some dungeons
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.51.sub: Lastly, here's the Sylph Shard. This one can be obtained by growing a Tree near a Sylph
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.52.sub: The way you cna obtain this Shard is unknown at the moment. However you might have some luck finding this shard in some dungeons
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.53.sub: Another Shard, same story. You have no idea what to do whit it, however, you should be able to obtain it by giving a Wilden Horn to a Drygmy. Later you might find a use for this item
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.54.sub: Using a Soul Campfire as a heat source for the Crucible, you can access new recipes
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.55.sub: Alchemy? Now? O..ok. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_1.quests.55.des: With The Nether being locked, you might feel the need for some potions.
Using an external heat source, as replacement for the blaze powder, and some Sprouting Fungus as replacement for the nether wart, you should be able to brew some potions.
This station has to be placed untop a heated Crucible filled with water.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.title: Arcane - 2
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.0.subt: And here you are. This is one of the first quests of the magic phase in the 2nd Age. Here you'll start with Botania. Left Click for ore info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.0.desc: Botania is a magic mod based around flowers. Throughout the world, you'll find 16 types of Mystical Flowers based on Minecraft's colors.

Each Mystical Flower has a tall version which can be harvested only with sheers. You can also obtain these, by placing Petals on Grass and using Bone Meal on them. This will allow you to multiply the amount of petals you have. Note that this process will not work in some biomes.
When placed in the crafting grid, the mystical flowers will give you colored petals. These petals can further be used in the Petal Apothecary to make functional floras.
The newly resulted flowers will have new and useful abilities. To find more about these flowers, look in the \"Useful Items\" tab.

Ok, new flowers, but how you use this apothecary? It's simple. Place the Apothecary in the world. After that, place some water into it. Next, you'll have to throw the items required for a recipe in the Apothecary. When a valid recipe was made, an overlay will appear on your screen. To finalize the recipe throw in the Apothery, the item requested on that overlay (usually, a seed).
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.1.subt: The Mana Battery. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.1.desc: The Mana Pool  is the primary block for Mana storage in the mod and can store an extremely large amount of Mana inside. Mana stored in the pool can be used to power other blocks in Botania that require Mana to function, such as functional flowers.

Mana can be inserted into the Mana Pool via a Mana Spreader, and any adjacent Mana Spreaders will pull Mana from it to fill their internal buffer. The amount of Mana in a pool can be displayed as a bar by right-clicking the Mana Pool with a Wand of the Forest. The amount of Mana displayed in the Pool can be updated with successive clicks.
Many resources can be thrown into the Mana Pool, infusing them into different forms. For example, an Steel Ingot can be thrown into the pool to transform into Manasteel Ingot.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.2.subt: Uses solid fuel to generate mana
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.3.subt: Create the Pure Daisy, one of the most beautiful flowers added by Botania. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.3.desc: The Pure Daisy is not just beautiful and pure as its name states, but it is also functional.

That means that it does something. When certain blocks are placed next to it, the Pure Daisy will start turning them into other blocks, efectively executing a transmutation cycle. This process will take 60 seconds.

You can see all the transmutations that can be performed using a Pure Daisy by pressing \"u\" on it. Meanwhile, the most important two transmutations we're gonna talk about, are the ones for the LivingWood and the LivingRock.
By placing the Pure Daisy on the ground and surrounding it with Infused Wood, you can obtain LivingWood which will be a key material for the recipes from Botania.
By placing the Pure Daisy on the ground and surrounding it with Smooth Stone Bricks, you can obtain LivingRock which will be a key material for the recipes from Botania.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.4.subt: Drop a Steel Ingot into a filled Mana Pool to create a Manasteel Ingot
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.5.subt: So bright, yet soo dull. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.5.desc: The Resonating Wand is a very useful tool for a starlight sorcerer. It has many uses, such as:
When its night time, when held, it will show the areas whereyou can find Rock Crystal ore.
Another use is for starting starlight crafting recipes by right-clicking on the starlight crafting tables.
Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
You'll need Marble and Treated Sticks.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.6.subt: The Starlight Pool. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.6.desc: A Lightwell, when given items such as Aquamarine or Rock Crystals, will create Liquid Starlight from them.
Liquid Starlight will have plenty of uses in the future.
Note that, by using magma/netherrack or packed ice/ice instead of the rockcrystal/aquamarine, you'll receive lava/water.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.7.subt: Shiny. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.7.desc: Rock Crystals can be used for lots of purposes. You might use them in tool recipes, magical constructs and others.
To find rock crystals, you can use a Resonating Wand when it's night time.
Example of how Rock Crystals will be shown in the world:
Later, you'll be able to grow your own Crystals.
Finally, another method of obtaining Rock Crystals will be through a Resourceful Bees Honeycomb Block conversion. Use JEI to see how you can obtain the Rock Crystal Ore.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.8.subt: Starlight Crafting Mark II - obtain the Starlight Crafting Altar by crafting it above Y 120, during night time. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.8.desc: The Starlight Crafting Altar, in comparison to its previous version, this will one will require a structure in order to work.
By Shift Right Clicking with the Resonating Wand on the Altar, you'll see a preview of its structure.

A Relay structure and an area with a decent starlight amount + plus a high Y position, will be enough for you to make the 3rd Altar tier, so don't worry about the Fosic Resonator for now. But know that you'll probably relocate your Altar once you get the Resonator.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.9.subt: Starlight Crafting Mark III. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.9.desc: The Celestial Altar is the third tier of crafting altar and is used throughout the Constellation chapter of the Astral Tome.

The Altar works similarly to its predecessor the Starlight Crafting Altar, and can make all recipes that the latter can. However, it has 8 extra input slots that can be used for more crafting recipes. It can gather Starlight much more efficiently, and requires a larger structure to be built in order to support it.
Remember you can also shift right-click the Starlight Crafting Altar with a Resonating want to see a preview of its required structure.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.10.sub: Starlight Crafting Mark IV. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.10.des: The Iridescent Altar is the fourth and last tier of crafting altar and is used throughout the Radiance chapter of the Astral Tome. It can contain more Starlight and adds 4 more slots for crafting.
Right-clicking on it will open up its GUI, which will display a slot on the left-hand side, where you can place constellation-attuned Rock Crystals or Celestial Crystals for certain recipes.

Many of the Iridescent Altar's recipes require secondary items to be placed around on Spectral Relays surrounding the Altar. When crafting is in progress a translucent image of the required item will appear on a Relay, at which point the player must right-click on the Relay with the designated item.
Lastly, this altar's structure is an upgraded verion of the one used previously with the Celestial Altar. The Astral Tome will show you how to place the last bricks for this one.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.11.sub: A Runic Altar can be given mana to create a variety of magical runes
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.12.sub: Terrasteel is potent for the usage of tools, armor, and arcane implements as a consequence of the immense amounts of Mana channeled through it. One mana pool will be required to obtain one Terrasteel ingot. Required to unlock the 3rd Age
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.13.sub: Resonating Gems, created at a Starlight Infuser, are an important ingredient in powerful magical artifacts
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.14.sub: Mana Diamonds hold large amounts of Mana, making them a potent crafting ingredient
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.15.sub: Iron, but it's linked to the stars. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.15.des: By linking the Starlight from a Collector Crystal, or another source, to some Iron ore, you can obtain Starmetal ore, which can be further melted into Starmetal Ingots.
Ignore the recipe shown by JEI. The Starmetal Ore can be obtained with any type of Iron Ore.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.16.sub: The Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate is used to create Terrasteel from Manasteel, Mana Diamonds, and Mana Pearls. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.16.des: The Terrestial Agglomeration Plate is the core element of the structure required to make Terrasteel. The structure can be seen in the Lexica Botania and it requires 5 LivingRock and 4 Lapis Lazuli blocks.
When a single Manasteel Ingot, Mana Diamond and Mana Pearl are dropped on the center of the structure, the crafting process will begin and the plate block will start accepting Mana.
While Mana can be provided with Mana Spreaders, the Lexica Botania recommends using Sparks for much higher transfer rates. And yeah, we also recommend this, of course ♥
If any item is dropped on, picked up, or despawns from the Plate while crafting is ongoing, all progress will be lost and consumed Mana will not be recovered.
Once the Plate receives 1,000,000 Mana the three items will be turned into a single Terrasteel Ingot.
Lastly, the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate can be used to obtain other alloys such as Ebony and Ivory.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.17.sub: Twinkle, twinkle, little star, now I wonder what you are! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.17.des: The Attunement Altar is used to attune Rock Crystals, Celestial Crystals, and (when attuning to a bright constellation) players for further crafting, rituals, or perks.
After completing the structure required by this altar to work, you'll have to place Spectral Relays on the Sooty Marble to attune the Altar to a specific constellation.

The placement of these Relays can be displayed when the constellation is in the sky and the player is holding its Constellation Paper in either hand; the blocks to place the Relays on will emit dark blue particles. When all the Relays are in place, beams of light will connect them and lift the small ornaments around the Altar up. It is accompanied by a constant humming sound effect.

When the Attunement Altar is fully set up, Rock Crystals and Celestial Crystals can be thrown onto the Altar to attune them. When set to a bright constellation unattuned players may step onto the Altar to receive that constellation's perks; attuned players must use a Shifting Star to remove their attunement to their preexisting constellation before being able to become attuned to another constellation. If you've never been attuned to a constellation, you don't have to worry about using a Shifting Star.

After you've been attuned to a constellation, you'll unlock a perk tree tab in the Astral Tome. Similar to other games, you'll level up and gather points to spend in this skill tree. Eventually you'll become very powerful.
The maximum level for the 2nd Age, will be 20. The absolute maximum amount is 40. You'll unlock higher levels in the next Ages.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.18.sub: A Botanical Brewery can use Mana to create powerful and reusable potions. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.18.des: The Botanical Brewery can brew a variety of potions that can be held in both Managlass Vials and Alfglass Flasks, which holds 4 and 6 doses of the potion brewed respectively. It requires Mana bursts supplied by a Mana Spreader to function.

Brewing with the Botanical Brewery requires three elements. Items are added to the Brewery by either right clicking on it, or dropping the items directly onto it.To start brewing, the Managlass Vial, or Alfglass Flask is added. Then, if a valid combination of reagents are added to the Brewery, any bound Mana Spreader will start supplying Mana to the Brewery automatically. Once the brew is done, it will drop the potion on the ground.
Depending on what container you're using, you'll get more potion. Managlass Vials can hold 4 potions at once, while an Alfglass Flask can hold 6 potions at once.
Alfglass Flasks will not be available for now, so feel free to use the Managlass Vial for now.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.19.sub: The Mana Fluxfield can convert Mana into electricity. Any more tech-savvy mage may find a use in this. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.19.des: The Mana Fluxfield converts Mana into Redstone Flux (RF).

The Mana Fluxfield can be sent Mana via a Mana Spreader with an internal buffer of up to 12800 Mana. Mana can then be converted to RF to be transmitted to other batteries, machines, wires, etc. at a conversion rate of 10 RF per Mana. Therefore, one mana burst from a regular mana spreader with no lens will produce 1,600 RF. Also, 1 Mana Pool will be equal to 10M RF.

However, the energy output rate of a Mana Fluxfield is limited to 64 RF/t, shared among all sides. If more mana is fed into the Mana Fluxfield than it has capacity left, any additional mana will be lost. This is particularly noticeable when using mana bursts with high capacities, such as from a Gaia Mana Spreader or a Mana Lens: Potency, and especially when only small amounts of energy are drained from the Mana Fluxfield.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.20.sub: The Long Range Teleporter. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.20.des: The Celestial Gateway is used to teleport players to other Celestial Gateways.

When the structure is built correctly, approaching the Gateway will cause the area around the player to darken into a panoramic night sky. Celestial Gateways that can be teleported to are depicted with larger yellow stars among the starry backdrop. Sneaking or holding right-click while looking at one will teleport the player to that Gateway after a few seconds. While sneaking, a preview of the Gateway will be shown.
It can be renamed in Anvils which will create a small caption appearing on the star while looking at it.
Also, Gateways require view of the sky in dimensions without a roof, such as the Overworld.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.21.sub: Hehe, we've lied, of course. You can think of us as a group of mean individuals, but here's the thing: We don't really care. Or do we? *Cough cough* getting back to the subject, let's talk about the Mana Pearl. This thing gathers mana from a Mana Pool to transfer it to powerful objects, such as the Runic Altar. Make sure you make lots of these, as you'll need them a lot later
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.22.sub: Liquid? Light? Who cares?! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.22.des: The Starlight Infuser is used to infuse various items with Starlight to transform them (such as turning Aquamarines into Resonating Gems) and turning Crystal tools into their infused counterparts.
In order for an infusion to occur, the pits around the Infuser must be filled with Liquid Starlight source blocks.
When an infusion occurs there is a chance for one or more Liquid Starlight blocks to be consumed. When infusing a Crystal tool all Liquid Starlight blocks will be consumed.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.23.sub: Psimetal is GORGEOUS!!! Left click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.23.des: The Spell Inscriber is the place where you'll be able to make your custom spells. Even tho Psi allows you to make pretty much, any spell you can imagine, it is highly recommanded that you get your spells from the internet, Reddit, to be more precise. Why? Easy. It saves you lots of time and pretty much, you can find spells that you didn't even knew were possible to create. To get spells online, you'll just have to copy them, like you would with any kind of text. To get spells into your game, just press the \"Import from Clipboard\" button in a Spell Inscriber.
The first spell you're gonna make, is the Infusion spell. This one will allow you to turn gold ingots into psimetal ingots, and get stronger wands.

Open the iscriber and search for the \"Infusion\" spell. Click on it. After that, just right-click the instriber with a Spell Node and your spell will be transfered to it. Further, you'll have to place your wand in a Rod Constructor and add the node to it. Finally, just drop some gold on the ground and right-click on it with your wand. If you make a mistake in the Inscriber, while your're making your spell, just hit the \"Delete\" key on your keyboard to remove the wrong element/elements.
Example of the basic infusion spell:
More information about all the other elements present in the Spell Inscriber can be found in the Encyclopaedia Psionica.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.24.sub: Must have some power to cast spells. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.24.des: Great, you have Psidust. Now you'll have to upgrade your wand to be able to cast more serious spells. There are a couple of things you'll need.

First, place the previously made, Focusing Rod, in your crafting grid to get back your Iron Rod Frame. After that, you'll have to construct your new wand. Place the components required to finish this quest in the Rod Constructor, to obtain your new wand.
Example of how the new wand will be built:
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.25.sub: Pink and shiny. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.25.des: Psidust is one of Psi's most basic materials. To obtain it, you'll need the most basic wand you can make.
To build your wand, you'll need an Iron Rod Frame. Just place this rod in the Rod Constructor and you're done.
To obtain Psidust, just drop some redstone on the ground and right-click on it with your wand to turn it into Psidust.
Example of making a basic wand:
One more thing. You can have only ONE wand in your inventory at a time. Multiple wands will keep you from castig spells.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.26.sub: Mana Wireless CABLE. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.26.des: The Mana Spreader is used to transport Mana in Botania.

The direction of the Mana bursts can be manipulated by shift-right clicking on it with the Wand of the Forest. There is an alternative method of orientating the Mana Spreader, and that is to bind it to another block. To do so, shift right-click on the Mana Spreader then shift right-click on another block to automatically orient the Mana Spreader to direct its Mana bursts to that block. Mana Spreaders fire Mana in discrete bursts rather than in a continuous stream.

While holding the Wand of the Forest, the player will see the Mana Spreader emit small pulses in the direction it is oriented. These show how far Mana bursts will travel before some of the Mana is lost. The Mana Spreader's bursts, like the Pulse Mana Spreader's, can only travel a distance of 12 blocks before beginning to suffer some Mana loss. Mana bursts can be seen regardless of whether or not the player is holding the Wand of the Forest.

The actual burst of Mana are different from the pointing laser. Once the spreader is aimed at an item that can accept Mana, it will shoot a large pulse which is longer and thicker than the aiming laser. It will not fire another burst before the last one reaches its destination.
The Mana Spreader can be turned on and off with a redstone signal, while the Pulse Mana Spreader just sends one burst per redstone pulse.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.27.sub: Generates mana by consuming water source blocks
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.28.sub: Similar to The Hydroangeas, however it'll consume lava source blocks to generate mana. Keep in mind that it has a cooldown
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.30.sub: By consuming leaves, this flower will produce mana
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.31.sub: TNT, as an unconventional source of power, it might prove to be a powerful ally in the mana generating department
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.32.sub: Hungrier than Garfield himself, the Gourmaryllis should generate tons of mana by consuming food
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.33.sub: As I like to call it, 'the slime press', the Narslimmus will consume slimes of different sizes to generate mana
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.34.sub: Botania's essence. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.34.des: Botania, at base, a magic mod, requires Mana generated by Flowers to power its unique contraptions.
There is a variety of generating flora you can choose from, maybe perfect to suit your needs.
Also, through your Mana generation journey, you'll quickly find out that Mana is very similar to RF. Maybe there'll be a way of converting it into electricity later.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.35.sub: Used to transport Mana like the standard Mana Spreader, except it will only emit Mana when a redstone signal is present. Furthermore, the Pulse Mana Spreader emits mana once per redstone pulse, which is useful for sending Mana to objects like Drums
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.39.sub: Fury, in the land of the BLOCKHEADS
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.40.sub: The mini-beacon. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.40.des: The Incense Stick is used to infuse brews created from the Botanical Brewery, although not all brews can be infused as an Incense Stick. The infused Incense Stick is placed on an Incense Plate where it can be ignited to release the effects of the brew in a 30 block radius, much like an activated Beacon.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.41.sub: Permanent potion effects. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.41.des: The Tainted Blood Pendant is a curio added by Botania. When worn in the Curio Amulet slot, it will give the potion effect infused into the pendant for the duration of 4 seconds (14 seconds for Night Vision) every 4 seconds, given that the wearer has a mana source in he's/her's inventory.
A version of this pandant which has regeneration is highly recommended, as health regen can be quite a problem in this pack.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.42.sub: Starlight Crafting Mark I. Make sure you READ the \"Altar Boosting 101!\" quest on this quests page. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.42.des: The Luminous Crafting Table will be the most basic form of Astral Sorcery crafting.
To obtain it, you'll need two things:
Throughout the world you can find another type of shrine, which is bigger then the others. Here you can find a collector crystal.

To obtain the Luminous Crafting Table, you'll have to place the vanilla crafting table, under the Collector Crystal. The Crystall will require clear view of the sky. After the clear view is provided, just place the vanilla crafting table under the crystal and it should turn into the Luminous Crafting Table.

After you have the table, you'll have to place it in the world. A gauge will be visible in the mid bottom of its interface. That indicates the amount of starlight that the table has in that moment. Some recipes will require large amounts of starlight. Make sure you read the \"&aAltar Boosting 101!&r\" quest for more info on starlight amounts.
Keep in mind that, during the day, no starlight will be collected by your table. The highest value of starlight available to you, will usually be at midnight.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.43.sub: Starlight, in its liquid form is useful in many ways. One of them is upgrading your rock crystals. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.43.des: If you're a Minecraft veteran, you're aware of the existance of cobblestone generators.
Well, what if we told you that it is possible to make a Packed Ice and Sand generator?
By making a cobblestone generator using Liquid Starlight instead of water, you can obtain Sand.
By making a cobblestone generator using Liquid Starlight, instead of Lava, you can obtain Packed Ice.
Another use for the Liquid Starlight is for combining Rock Crystals. Just toss two of them in pond of Liquid Starlight and some of their atributes will be combined.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.44.sub: To obtain Infused Wood, throw Wood Logs in Liquid Starlight. The Starlight can be placed down just like any other liquid. You might wanna automate this process as soon as you can
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.45.sub: Crystals obay their master. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.45.des: The Linking Tool is used to direct Starlight from a Collector Crystal, Celestial Collector Crystal, Lens, or PrismLens to a block.

Right-clicking on one of the aforementioned blocks with the Linking Tool will display a \"Selected <block>!\" message in the chat. Right-clicking blocks will direct a ray of starlight to the selected blocks with the text \"Linked <block> to a block!\" Shift right-clicking on the starlight-producing blocks will erase all existing starlight rays and display the message \"Unlinked all links!\" in the chat. Switching to another item will display \"Stopped linking!\" in the chat, and finishing the linking process.
Redirecting the Starlight to some blocks may have interesting results.
One may be able to transform Iron ore into Starmetal ore.
Additionally, Starlight redirected to Light Wells, can make them work faster.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.46.sub: Ok. The 2nd Age. You're on fire! This is one of the first quests in the magic phase of the 2nd Age. Here you'll start working on Astral Sorcery. Note that this mod has a research system which will NOT allow you to make all the recipes shown by JEI until you unlock the required chapters in the Astral Tome
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.47.sub: Nocturnal Powder can be used to cover certain areas in complete darkness, thus allowing lots of mobs to spawn in that area. This effect is not permanent
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.48.sub: Illumination Powder can be used to light areas at a distance
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.49.sub: The Cave Illuminator will, when placed somewhere, randomly spawn light sources in the nearby caves
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.50.sub: Throw a Rock Crystal and a piece of Stardust in a pool of Liquid Starlight and get your first Celestial Crystal. Note that you'll have to wait for the Crystal to grow before you can harvest it. If you grow your crystals on a Starmetal Ore, their growth process will be faster, however, over time, the Starmetal Ore will turn back to Vanilla Iron (linking a collector crystal to the Starmetal Ore, will allow you to get the Ore back, once it turns to Iron)
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.51.sub: Last tier of Rod Frames. Will give you the possiblity of making more powerful spells
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.52.sub: These Component can be used to make a better wand
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.53.sub: Next gen upgrade to your wand
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.54.sub: Diamonds were never prettyer <3 Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.54.des: To make Psigems will need a new, stronger wand. Other then that, the process is besically the same.
Just select the \"Greater Infusion\" trick in the Inscriber, use a new Spell Node to place your spell in the wand, and cast it to a dropped Diamond.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.55.sub: Strife's main weapons: These alloys can be obtained by infusing Terrasteel with either Bitumen or Refined Radiance. These can be used to further upgrade your Psi gear. One mana pool will be required to obtain these
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.56.sub: The Alchemy Catalyst is used to provide certain items with a secondary transformation when tossed into a Mana Pool at the cost of some Mana stored in the pool. It must be placed directly underneath a Mana Pool. You can use JEI to see a full list of available transformations
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.57.sub: Generates mana from rain/thunderstorms. It has to be placed on vivid grass or encahnted soil to work properly
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.58.sub: Generates mana from Netherstars. One star will generate 2 mana pools, however, you'll have to make a contraption which will pick up the star from time to time, so that your star doesn't DESPAWN!
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.59.sub: Stardust can be used in lots of Astral Constructs, such as: tools, altars and other stations
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.60.sub: Souls provide POWER!!! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.60.des: We, at Decuriso Entertainment Inc., understand that, using a vanilla Enchanting Table, can get quite boring and time consuming. That's why we're giving you the opportunity to obtain better enchantments, faster. We're happy to present to you The Soul Enchanter.
Unlike its vanilla counterpart, The Soul Enchanter will use Soul Shards instead of lapis.
Other differences from the vanilla Enchanting Table will be the following:
- enchants start at a lame, level 1 strength
- items can be enchanted indefinitely, until they receive their maximum number of enchantments with their maximum level, thus going from a lame enchantment, to an epic one
Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
You'll need Vibrant Infused Wood and Manyullyn Blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.61.sub: Livinwood will be used within many Botania crafting recipes. Use JEI to see some of them
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.62.sub: Livingrock will be used within many Botania crafting recipes. Use JEI to see some of them
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.63.sub: Dude, what happened to the Grindstone? 0_o Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.63.des: The Starmetal Cutting Tool can be used to make Star Dust. You'll have to drop Starmetal Ingots on the ground and then, Left-Click them with the Cutting Tool.
Additionally, you can split Rock Crystals to separate their atributes. Note that, by splitting the crystals, there's a chance to loose some of the attributes.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.64.sub: Celestial Papers. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.64.des: There are five base constellations in Astral Sorcery. To start tinkering with them, you'll need to five their respective constellation paper. These can be found throughout the world in astral shrines.

The first five papers you'll aquire will reveal the base constellations. The rest of them will be listed as \"There is nothing here.\". It would be a great idea to keep them, as they might come useful later.
In the astral shines, you can find chests with loot. If you're lucky, maybe you can find even Diamonds. Here's an example of an astral shrine:
One more thing. Even tho you can find constellation papers in these shrines, you can also craft them!

Oh, almost forgot! In this pack, astral constellations have been changed to their IRL counterpart. Not really. They're basically the same constellations as usual, but their name and shape was altered. For example, Evorsio is now, Aries. You can look into the \"Astrological Sorcery\" mod to find out more about the changes.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.65.sub: Crafting the glass will allow you to enter The Twilight Forest. Once you have the Glass, move towards the \"Twilight Forest\" tab in the \"Dimensional Explorer\" chapter group. It will also allow you to study the sky to find constellations. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.65.des: With this handy telescope, you'll be able to spy the night sky and look for constellations. Through the Looking Glass, you'll be able to see all the stars on the sky, however, only a few of them will make a Constellation, the brighter and the larger ones, to be more precise. Also, these stars will have a more noticeble linger to them, and will appear as an overlay, so it will be quite hard to not notice them. Also, keep in mind that there might be nights when there will be no Constellations on the sky, so just wait for the next night.
Example of how the stars of a Constellation look:
The Constellation shown in the above example is Capricornus.

When you find a constellation, you'll have to hold down the Shift key. After that, your cursor will appear on the screen and you'll have to trace the constellation. After you've traced the shape, the constellation will be available to you. Astral Sorcery makes it so that every constellation you discover, will be visible on the sky, but in this pack, this will not happen. To see the discovered constelations on the sky, you'll have to close the game and follow this path in the pack's folder: <packfolder>/config/astralsorcery-client.toml. Here you'll have to fill the \"skyRenderingEnabled\" entry, with this, including the quotation marks: \"minecraft:overworld\". After that, save the changes and start the game.
One last thing. If you haven't discovered a constellation through a Constellation Paper, you won't ba able to unlock it, even if you've traced it correctly.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.66.sub: Crafting the Scarab will allow you open the Portal towards Atum. Once you have it, move towards the \"Atum\" tab in the \"Dimensional Explorer\" chapter group
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.67.sub: Mana Pearls will be required further in Botania. Since there's no way you can just infuse a regular Ender Pearl with mana, you'll need something more.. let's say unique. Here's the deal. Make a powerful, yet unstable version of the regular Ender Pearl, and we'll make sure that your life will be easier from now on. Tip: To see the recipe for this item, press \"u\" on Illumination Powder. It's an Eidolon Brazier recipe
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.68.sub: Ultimate Enchanting Contraption. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.68.des: The Stellar Refraction Table is used to engrave glass to create potions and enchant items or books.

The table has two slots - the first one accepts Parchment, Water Bottles, Books and enchantable items, the second accepts Infused Glass and Engraved Glass. Right clicking the table with them will insert the item, shift-right clicking with an empty hand will remove items instead.

Right clicking the table will open the GUI. The left and right sides of the GUI contain constellations currently up in the sky known to the player. The top shows the inserted items. When parchment and an unengraved Infused Glass is inserted, dragging constellation images from the slots on the side will attempt to draw them on the parchment. The chance to draw the constellation depends on time of night (highest at midnight) and the amount of constellations already drawn on the parchment (decreases with more drawings). If drawing fails, all drawings will be removed and one parchment will be consumed. Once 3 constellations are drawn, the glass will be engraved.

The levels of enchantments or potion effects applied by the engraved glass depends on the overlap of the drawn constellations. For best result, around 25% of the drawings should be overlapping. If a single constellation is multiple times, the strength of its effect is the average of all of its drawing's effects.

Putting a water bottle in the table with an engraved glass will convert it into \"Stardew\" - a potion with the glass's engraved constellations' effects. The duration of each of the effects is a random number between 4,800 ticks (4 minutes) and 7,200 ticks (6 minutes). There's a 1 in 30 chance the resulting potion will have the Phoenix-Fire potion effect added. Making potions on the table has a 1 in 3 chance to damage the glass.

Putting a book or an unenchanted enchantable item in the table with an engraved glass will enchant it with the glass's engraved constellations' enchantments. Enchantments are added in the order of the constellations listed on the glass's tooltip. If any enchantments are conflicting (i.e. Fortune and Silk Touch), only the first will be added unless the following ones ignore conflicts. Enchanting on the table always damages the glass.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.69.sub: Sagittarius (Offensive) is a bright constellation associated with violence and attacking. Attuning yourself to Sagittarius unlocks a root node with 10% more projectile/melee damage, and allows to gain perk experience by dealing damage
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.70.sub: Capricornus (Defence) is a bright constellation associated with increasing defensive power or repulsion. Attuning yourself to Capricornus unlocks a root node with 20% more armor, and allows to gain perk experience by taking damage
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.71.sub: Gemini (Travel) is a bright constellation associated with distance and speed. Attuning yourself to Gemini unlocks a root node with 10% increased movement speed, and allows to gain perk experience by moving around
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.72.sub: Virgo (Creation) is a bright constellation associated with growth and life. Attuning yourself to Virgo unlocks a root node with +2 added maximum life, and allows to gain perk experience by placing blocks
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.73.sub: Aries (Destruction) is a bright constellation associated with breaking the environment. Attuning yourself to Aries unlocks a root node with +1 added reach, and allows to gain perk experience by breaking blocks
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.74.sub: Libra (Light) is a dim constellation associated with light and banishment. You cannot attune yourself to dim constellations. While included in a ritual, this constellation will prevent any hostile mobs from spawning near the Ritual Pedestal and the surrounding area
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.75.sub: Taurus (Mineral) is a dim constellation associated with ores and stone. You cannot attune yourself to dim constellations. While included in a ritual, this constellation will cause nearby Stone blocks to turn into a random ore block
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.76.sub: Scorpius (Time) is a dim constellation associated with the passage of time and relativity. Unlike other constellations, it will only appear the night after a solar eclipse which occurs every 36 days. You cannot attune yourself to dim constellations. While included in a ritual, this constellation increases the ticking speed of machines
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.77.sub: Pisces (Fishing) is a dim constellation associated with water and fishing. You cannot attune yourself to dim constellations. While included in a ritual, this constellation makes it easier to fish in Water blocks near the Pedestal
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.78.sub: Aquarius (Herding) is a dim constellation associated with animals and serenity. You cannot attune yourself to dim contellations. While included in a ritual, this constellation causes nearby animals to age and shed items as if they were slain
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.79.sub: Leo (Heat) is a dim constellation associated with fire and heat. You cannot attune yourself to dim constellations. While included in a ritual, this constellation will smelt or melt nearby blocks (e.g., Sand into Glass) around the Pedestal
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.80.sub: Cancer (Convocation) is a dim constellation associated with conjuration and regeneration. Unlike other constellations, it will only appear during full and new moons. You cannot attune yourself to dim constellations. While included in a ritual, this constellation increases the spawn rate of all entities, including hostile ones
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.81.sub: Corona Borealis (Ice) is a faint constellation associated with ice and frigidity. While included in a ritual, this constellation is used to augment other constellations, increasing their range while lowering their potency
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.82.sub: Scutum (Beyond) is a faint constellation associated with endurance and tenacity. While included in a ritual, this constellation is used to augment other constellations, increasing their potency while lowering their range
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.83.sub: Lyra (Alteration) is a faint constellation associated with corruption and resonance. While included in a ritual, this constellation is used to augment other constellations, corrupting the effect of the original ritual as well as increasing the crystal's fracture rate. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.83.des: Virgo - Nearby living entities receive Weakness IV, Mining Fatigue III, Hunger III, and Bleeding IIIHas a chance to destroy crops.
Capricornus - Hostile mobs and projectiles are buffed in speed and attack strength.
Sagittarius - Hostile mobs near the Pedestal receive Resistance IIIDamages playersNearby animals receive Inner Wealth.
Aries - Places random solid blocks in a 33x33x33 cube around the Pedestal.
Gemini - Entities near the Pedestal receive Fatigue and Slowness.
Aquarius - Kills animals instantly while also granting them Inner Wealth.
Leo - Places Ice near the pedestal.
Scorpius - Freezes both mobs and machines.
Libra - Makes the night last longer in the world it's in.
Taurus - Creates 3x3 stone platforms underneath entities when there is space beneath them. These platforms may contain ores.
Pisces - Places water near the pedestal.
Cancer - Skeletons within range are turned to Wither Skeletons and given Inner Wealth IV.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.84.sub: Opiuchus (Hunger) is a faint constellation associated with anger and ferocity. While included in a ritual, this constellation is used to augment other constellations, increasing their range and potency as well as the crystal's fracture rate
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.85.sub: The Fosic Resonator will be required later - for now you won't need it to get the Starlight Crafting Altar. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.85.des: While it's night time, you can find areas highly concentrated with starlight if you're holding the Fosic Resonator in one of your hands.
Example of how the area looks:
Exploring at a slow phase is adviced, as it takes some time for these blue patches to appear.

Now, it's important to understand that usually this items is optional. Here however, it will be mandatory for the higher Altar tiers (Celestial and Iridescent). This pack is configured in a way which will require every single drop of Starlight that you can get your hands on.

If this is the first time you're reading this, most probably, you'll not be able to make this item. That's fine. Just note that, sooner or later, more Starlight will be required for your recipes. When that happens, you'll need this gadget. You'll most probably have to relocate your Altar to an area highly concentrated in Starlight.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.86.sub: Starlight + Mana + Hard Materials = <3. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.86.des: The Heart of Diamond is the main ingredient in the process of obtaining Mana Diamonds. In the 2nd Age you'll have to craft it.

In the 3rd Age, you'll be able to farm the Heart of Diamond using a Drygmy farm from Ars Nouveau. You'll need the Stoneling mob. The only way to obtain a Stoneling is by Right Clicking with the Heart of Diamond on a Stone block.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.87.sub: All the Starlight you'll go. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.87.des: Using a Celestial Collector Crystal which is attuned to a Constellation, you can build a structure which can be used to boost the amount of Starlight that an altar has access to.

When placed in the world, the Celestial Collector Crystal generates Starlight which can be used to power other blocks from the mod through the use of the Linking Tool. It can be crafted from a Celestial Crystal that is attuned to any of the twelve bright or dim Constellations.
If it is placed within 16 blocks of another Celestial Collector Crystal or Collector Crystal, the amount of Starlight generated will be significantly reduced.

If the proper multiblock structure is built for it, the Crystal will give more Starlight to an Altar when the Crystal's Constellation is NOT in the Sky, rather then the ususal behaviour, where the Crystal will give a maximum amount of Starlight when its Constellation IS in the Sky.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.88.sub: Thaumcraft is not here yet. However, if you're a veteran you'll remember The Everfull Urn. The Urn of Endless Waters is similar to it. It will provide water only to Cauldrons and Petal Apothecaries. Try it out!
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.89.sub: Wanna boost your Altar? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_2.quests.89.des: Since 1.12.2 Astral Sorcery changed some things regarding the Altar boosting and the starlight in general.
Now the starlight amount available will be determined by the fosic field. This field is present in the entire world with a power level ranging from 0.0-1.0.
While holding a Fosic Resonator in your hand, you'll be able to see the areas with a power of 0.4 or higher.
This means that, overall, in the world, there will be areas with a very low amount of starlight available and areas with more starlight available.

Until you get your hands on the Fosic Resonator, if you find yourself in a situation where you can't craft an item because you don't have enough starlight, your best bet would be to relocate your altar to another spot, maybe with 0.2, or 0.3 power.

Now let's talk about the changes to the boosting methods. Now you won't be able to stack multiple instances of the same boosting method, as they'll get inefficient. For example, using more the one Collector Crystal will make both of them weaker. You basically have to combine multiple boosting methods.
- Y level: the higher, the better
- Collector Crystal: the stats of the crystal will affect the amount of starlight added to your altar
- Relays Structure: the following structure will boost the amount of starlight available in your altar
The structure will require a Glass Lens on the Relay.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.title: Arcane - 3
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.0.subt: Let's continue channeling that magic intrinsic, shall we? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.0.desc: Oook, the 3rd Age. We're starting to think that you might actually enjoy this pack after all.
So. You're here. What's next? Well, more Botania. That's next. To keep progressing through this mod, you'll have to obtain two Natura Pylons.
Unlike the Mana Pylons, these ones will not help you with any kind of enchantment or whatever, but will allow you to open a portal.
Yeah, a portal. Don't get too excited as you won't be able to use it to teleport anywhere, but you'll use it for trading.
\"Trading? A portal? Ok guys, at this point I'm 99% sure you're crazy.\"

Well, yeah, we kinda are, but what can you do? Jokes aside, you're really going to do trades with a portal, or better said, with the people behind that portal. You'll find out who are we talking about quite soon.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.1.subt: Wait.. mythology? YEAH. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.1.desc: In Norse cosmology, Álfheim, also called \"Ljósálfheimr\" is home of the Light Elves. And yeah, not only they're real here, but you're going to work with them if you want to progress further.
In order to comunicate with them, you'll have to build the Portal to Alfheim. This is a multiblock structure that allows you to exchange certain blocks and items.

Unlike most portals, the Portal to Alfheim cannot be travelled through, and if you were to stand in it, well.. nothing will happen. At least not yet. Let's not move away from the subject. How do you build this thing?

To build the portal you'll need a frame with a size of 5x5 (no corners required). The interior must be a 3x3 hollow space. The frame must contain one Elven Gateway Core, three Glimmering LivingWood blocks and regular LivingWood blocks placed like this:

To light up the portal you'll need, in an 11x11x11 area centered on the Gateway Core, at least two Mana Pools which have a Natura Pylon above them. Also, the Pools have to be filled with mana. When lighting the portal, a total amount of 200.000 Mana (split between all pools) will be consumed.
When all's ready, just right click the Elven Gateway Core with a Wand of the Forest.
Now, what to do with this thing? Well, you use it to trade with the Elves on the other side. Just use JEI to see the available recipes.

And by all means, DO NOT try to trade any item unless you know you'll receive something for it. Items that are not exchangable will be lost when thrown into the portal, with the exception of Diamonds, Iron Ingots and Ender Pearls which will be returned.
Also, DO NOT. We repeat. DO NOT throw bread in this thing.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.2.subt: Prepare your weapons, your potions, trinkets and most importantly, your socks! The Gaia Guardian is next. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.2.desc: The Guardian of Gaia is a boss mob added by Botania. Upon death, it will drops Gaia Spirits, used to craft several powerful items. It will take the appearance of the player's skin, but much darker.

To summon the Guardian, you'll need a multiblock structure made of an active Beacon and 4 Gaya Pylons. Just shift right-click the Beacon with a Terrasteel ingot to start the boss fight. Here's how the structure should look:

When summoned, the Guardian appears 3 blocks above the beacon, filling its health bar up for 8 seconds, then falling onto the beacon. The arena is a sphere with a radius of 12 blocks around the beacon. If no players are inside the arena, the Guardian will despawn. If a player tries to leave the arena, they will be knocked back inside. Jumping too high might leave the player stuck floating above the arena in a multiplayer fight, or ending it in singleplayer. Players inside the arena cannot fly using any methods granting creative flight, such as the Flügel Tiara.
The Guardian is immune to fire damage, and cannot take more than 25 damage in a single hit. It has multiple phases:

1. The Guardian of Gaia teleports to a random place inside the arena every 3 seconds, or whenever it takes damage. When it teleports, it spawns a hostile Pixie that deals 8 damage, and creates 6 Gaia Traps (which are essencialy, some magic land mines). If a player is standing between the Guardian's positions before and after teleporting, they will take 6 damage.

2. After the Guardian loses 80% of its health, it will float up, become invulnerable, and start spawning monsters.Every 4 seconds, a wave of 4 monsters per player will fall from the area around the Guardian. Spawned monsters that aren't immune to fire have Fire Resistance applied to them.After spawning 10 waves of monsters, the Guardian descends and can take damage again.

3. This phase is mostly identical to the first phase, however the Guardian teleports around at a faster pace - every 2 seconds.Killing the Guardian will drop loot at the feet of all nearby players who damaged the boss.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.3.subt: Hihihi. Elementium is not only more powerful than Mana Steel, but it is also more prettier <3
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.4.subt: It's been a long day, but you've finally managed to obtain the Beacon. While you can use it just like you would in the vanilla game, here you'll find a new purpose to it. The Beacon is the core component of the Ritual of Summoning Gaia
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.5.subt: Terrasteel just got cheaper. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.5.desc: The Mana-Infuser is an upgraded version of the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate that is also capable of creating other artifacts and alloys.

Like the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate, this one also requires a platform below. However, unlike a regular MythicBotany experiance, here, the platform will be made with Runed Marble and Elementium Blocks, instead of Shimmerrock and Gold Blocks. Ignore what's shown in the Lexica Botania. The Mana-Infuser also requires a Spark above it to receive mana, however this Spark requires a Dominant Augment to be able to pull the mana from the nearby sources.

Now let's see what are the benefits of upgrading to this Plate. First, it will allow you to make Terrasteel cheaper, using only half a mana pool instead of a full mana pool. Second, it will allow you to obtain Alfsteel which is a more powerful version of the Terrasteel. More features of this alloy will eventually be revealed. Lastly, the Mana-Infuser can be used to obtain other alloys and some artifacts. These also will be reveiled when their time comes.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.6.subt: Pixie Dust will play an important role in the future, so make sure you have enough of it
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.7.subt: Guess what? Mana Diamonds are needed in Alfheim. If you give them some of those, the Elves might give you something nice in return
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.8.subt: Alfsteel is the ultimate alloy. Containing extreme amounts of mana, this metal can withstand large amounts of magic, allowing you to make more powerful Pylons, tools, armor and more
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.9.subt: From this point on, things will get interesting. The Gaia Pylons have one use, and just one use only. That'll be the summoning of the Gaia Guardian which is a very powerful boss. More will be revealed about it soon, but for now, get ot work and get 4 of these Pylons
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.10.sub: Behold the latest feat of the Alfheim technology - The Alfsteel Pylon. This glowing apparatus will be used to make Gaia Pylons. Additionally you can use it to repair Alfsteel Tools and Tools enchanted with Mending through some mana. Just throw your tools untop of the Pylon to repair them. The Pylon will use less amounts of mana then a Mana Band would use in your inventory
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.11.sub: After a very long jorney, you've finally reached the point where you can get into Ars Nouveau and work on some amazing spells
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.12.sub: Arcane Stone and Gilded Arcane Stone will be required to build constructs capable of handling and channeling the magic of the universe
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.13.tit: Storage for a different type of mana
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.13.sub: Source Jars will be used to store up Source. What's that? You'll find out soon. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.13.des: Source can be considered, to a point, another type of mana. While it hasn't anything to do with Botania's mana, it has a similar functionality, meaning that it is used to power certain contraptions and make some unique items.

And again, similar to Botania, Source is produced by consuming certain resources in a generator-like block. Now, unlike Botania, Ars Nouveau doesn't use flowers to produce Source, but it uses Sourcelinks.
In this pack there are only 3 Sourcelinks available and we'll go over what they'll consume in a moment.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.14.sub: Crafting Everything. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.14.des: The Enchanting Apparetus is a new and advanced form of Crafting introduced by Ars Nouveau.
The Apparatus will take items and Source from a nearby Source Jar, and it will assemble them into new, more powerful items.

The Apparatus is buot by placing down an Arcane Core. Above the Core, place the Enchanting Apparatus. After that, surrond the core with Arcane Pedestals. Finally, place a Source Jar nearby. The Apparatus will consume Source from this jar, in order to craft new items.
Recipes are made by placing the ingredients on the Pedestals. The Middle Item shown by JEI, has to be Right-Clicked on the Enchanting Apparatus Block - this action will start the crafting process.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.15.sub: A mystical plant that will produce very strong fibers which you'll use in your advantage
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.16.sub: One of the most unstable and powerful ingots known to mankind. Handle it with great care
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.17.sub: Are you guys insane?! 0_o Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.17.des: Before getting into this task, you should prepare yourself adequately. You're about to face an upgraded version of the Gaia Guardian. The fight will be challanging, but also, very rewarding. Let's get into some details.
When the Ritual of Gaia is performed with a Gaia Spirit Ingot, the harder version of the Guardian of Gaia is spawned.

The Guardian gains 15 armor points. It teleports every 2.25 seconds in phase 1, and 1.75 seconds in phase 3. Every 0.75 seconds, 4 magic missiles (similiar to ones spawned by Rod of the Unstable Reservoir, but not homing) dealing 12 damage are launched by the Guardian. In phase 3, 7 Gaia Traps are created instead of 6. Witches have a much higher chance to spawn (17% chance), while zombies have a reduced chance (33% chance). Spawned wither skeletons wield Elementium Swords instead of their standard Stone Swords.

In addition to the standard drops, the Gaia Guardian's Head has a 7.7% chance to be dropped when killed with an Elementium Axe (and additional 7.7% per Fortune level). Also a Dite of Fate can be dropped and, if water from the Well of Mimir was previously consumed by the player, a Rune Table of Fimbultyr will be dropped. Each of these drops have special quests for them where you can get more info about what they are and what they do.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.18.sub: After defeating the 2nd Guardian of Gaia, assuming that you consumed some water from the Well of Mimir, you'll receive a Rune Tablet of Fymbultyr which is essencially the base for every ritual added by Mythic Botany
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.19.sub: Feed this brench with mana. After that, toss the Gjallarhorn in it with right click and the horn will be filled with water
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.20.sub: Required to unlock the 4th Age. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.20.des: The Rituals added by Mythic Botany are a key element which will be used from this point. They can get quite complex, so we'll tell you the basics about them.

Each Ritual requires one Master Rune Holder which will be placed in the middle of the Ritual. Around it, there will be regular Rune Holders. How many of them, and their position will be dictated by the Ritual you want to perform.

Each Ritual will require a set of items to be dropped right next to the Master Rune Holder. Additionally, different amounts of Mana will be consumed by each Ritual. The amount of Mana consumed, depends on the Ritual you want to perform. The Mana required by the Ritual will be drawn from Mana Tablets, or Mana Bands located in your inventory.
There will be some rituals that might require a living sacrifice. In that case, the living entity required by the Ritual has to be near the Master Rune Holder when the Ritual is started.
Rituals can be started by right-clicking the Master Rune Holder with a Wand of the Forest.
Lastly know that some Rituals will consume the runes places on the Rune Holders, some won't. Also, some Rituals will consume the Master Rune Holder, while some of them, won't.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.21.sub: By drinking this water, you'll gain the knowlage required in order to perform rituals
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.22.sub: The Cursed Rind of Andwari is an ancient relic which can be found in Andwari Caves around Alfheim. These Caves can be found in the Golden Fields Biomes and they're quite rare, so good luck finding them. After obtaining the Ring, you have to cleanse it of its curses through a Ritual
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.23.sub: By combining the blood of Kvasir with some honey, you'll be able to learn the languages of all the realms, thus allowing you to go to other realms, such as Alfheim
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.24.sub: Lexica Botania can be \"upgraded\" with Elven knowledge. Just throw the book in the portal
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.25.sub: When all the 9 realms get together. Try to obtain all of these runes. You'll need each one of them at least once
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.26.sub: The Agronomical Sourcelink will produce Source from crops and trees growth. Certain plants, such as MageBlooms, Source Berry Bushes or Archwood trees will produce more Source per growing stage. After Source is produced, it will be automatically placed in any Sources Jars present in a 5x5 radius. Bonemealing crops/trees will not give any Source
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.27.sub: The Vitalic Sourcelink will generate healthy amounts of Source by consuming burnable items. Archwood logs will generate more Source, with Blazing Archwood logs generating the most amount of Source. Ocasionally, the Volcanic Sourcelink will turn Stone Blocks located underneath it in a 3x3 area into Magma Blocks, and the Magma Blocks, into Lava. It can also spawn Lava Lilys untop Lava. Lava Lilys are decorative blocks
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.28.sub: The Vitalic Sourcelink will generate Source when mobs are killed near it. It will also generate Source when nearby animals breed. Source will also be generated passively vrom the nearby baby animals. Lastly, the Vitalic Sourcelink will accelerate the growth of the neaby baby animals
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.29.sub: When used in its regular state, the Ritual of Summoning Wilden will spawn one of the 3 Wilden Mobs added by Ars Nouveau (Wilden Hunter, Wilden Stalker, Wilden Defender). However, when it is augmented with a Wilden Spike, a Wilden Horn and a Wilden Wing, the Ritual will summon the Wilden Chimera which is a challenging and destructive boss. When summoning the Chimera, this ritual will destroy some blocks around the Brazier
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.30.sub: Fighting the abomination. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.30.des: The Chimera is a powerful and destructive mid-level boss. It can ressist to cold damage and a variety of Spells.

Unlike other bosses, the Chimera is special meaning that it has multiple phases dictated by its health bar. Each time you depleate its health bar, it will move to the next phase and will change its attack patterns.
Phase 1 - In this phase it will attack you using melee damage. It can also summon wolves to assist it in combat.

Phase 2 - In this phase, it will grow wilden spikes. It can launch them at you dealing massive amounts of damage and, also, giving you Slowness and Weakness. While launching spikes at you, it is immune to damage. It will also retain all the abilities present in the previous phase.

Phase 3 - In this pahse, it will grow wielding wings. These will allow it to fly into the air and launge itself at you, creating an explosion in the process. It wil also start to summon Wielden Stalkers to assist it in combat. All the abilities present in the previous phases will remain.
