Phase 4 - In this phase, it will grow wilden horns. It will also become more agressive, will start to summon Wilden Defenders and Hunters to assist it in combat. It will also be able to cast certain negative effects on you, including Gravity which will not allow you to fly.
In each phase, it has 225 health points. This means that it has a total amount of 900 health points. Upon defeating it, you'll receive a Wilden Tribute.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.31.sub: Let's make things easier. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.31.des: The Ritual Brazier has mainly two uses. One of them is purely decorative, while the other is highly functional.
First, you can use the Brazier as a fancy light source. Just use a light spell on the Brazier. The color of the light will depends on the color of the spell.

Second, the Brazier can be used to perform rituals. Each ritual requires a unique Tablet. To start a ritual, place your Tablet on the Brazier. Flames will burst. In this state, the ritual can be augmented. To augment the ritual just throw items into the Brazier. Information will be given in the top left side of your screen. More info about the possible augments will be given in the quest corespondent to each Tablet. Start the ritual by right-clicking the Brazier with an empty hand.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.33.sub: Welcome to the path of pride. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.33.des: The Rod of the Bifrost is a powerful tool which can be used to summon a very small portion of the Bifrost. If you're not familiar to the concept of the Bifrost, listen here.
In the Norse Mythology, the Bifrost is a burning rainbow bridge that reaches between Midgard and Asgard, the realm of the Gods.

Now, comming back to our Rod. You might be dissapointed to hear that it cannot sustain the full powers of the Bifrost and, at its best, it can create a rainbow bridge between your position and the block you're looking at. Mana will be required for it to work properly.

Now, its main use in your journey will be to obtain Bifrost Blocks. These blocks are not only beautiful, but are also extremely good at chanelling light. Given this information, you might be able to use them to build a Beacon.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.34.sub: Use the Bifrost blocks to contain the unstable energies produced by a Nether Star and obtain a Beacon. And yeah, this is just a fancy way of saying \"Use this to craft a Beacon\"
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.35.sub: Generates mana by consuming Cake. Every 4 seconds, the flower attempts to consume one slice of Cake in an 11×11×11 area around itself, producing 1,800 Mana per slice, resulting in 12,600 per Cake
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.36.sub: Generates mana by consuming Wool of specific colors. A Spectrolus consumes blocks of Wool dropped within 1 block of it. It will consume any and all wool dropped, but it will not generate Mana from all of them. It will only generate Mana if the correct color of wool is dropped. The colors of wool it accepts follow the standard metadata order: White, Orange, Magenta, Light Blue, Yellow, Lime, Pink, Grey, Light Grey, Cyan, Purple, Blue, Brown, Green, Red, Black. Each correct block of Wool consumed generates 1200 Mana. The next color in the order can be checked by looking at the Spectrolus while holding a Wand of the Forest
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.37.sub: The Games of Mana. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.37.des: The Dandelifeon is a generating flower that produces Mana by simulating Conway's Game of Life in a 25×25 area around it.
When a redstone signal is applied to it, it will advance one generation every 10 ticks.
Each square in the 25x25 area is referred to as a Cell. Cells can have two possible states - Live: the cell has a Cellular Block above it - Dead: the cell does not have a Cellular Block above it.
The state of a cell will change depending on the states of its Neighbours, which are the 8 squares surrounding the cell:
1. Live → Dead: The live cell has fewer than two or more than three live neighbours.
2. Live → Live: The live cell has exactly two or three live neighbours.
3. Dead → Live: The dead cell has exactly three live neighbours.
Botania has some additional rules over the original Game of Life.

Age: each live cell will have an age value attached to it. For each generation the cell will have its age increased by 1. When a dead cell becomes a live cell, its new age is Anew cell = NEIGHBOURoldest + 1.

Mana conversion: the 3x3 area centered on the Dandelifeon is uninhabitable by cells. Any cells that grow into that area will be converted into Mana, and all other cells in the Dandelifeon's range will die. The age of a cell is directly proportional to the Mana it produces. Age 0 cells will not generate Mana, age 101 and older cells will generate as much Mana as age 100 cells.
Multiple Dandelifeons: a cell that is in the functional range of at least 2 Dandelifeons will die and cannot be turned into a live one.
Means of transport: Cellular blocks that are moved by other means than the Dandelifeon will break and cannot be recovered.
Cell occupation: Cellular blocks will not generate on cells that are already occupied by non-air blocks.
Whenever any live cells are absorbed by the 3x3 zone in the center, all other cells in the board die.
A Dandelifeon can store 50,000 Mana internally, and can be bound to a Mana Spreader within 6 blocks to output Mana.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.38.sub: Generates mana by consuming other Botania flowers. Every two seconds, a Rafflowsia will check the 11×11×11 area around for any craftable Botania flowers. If it finds one, it will attempt to consume it and generate 2100 Mana. However, if it consumes the same flower multiple times in a row, it will produce less and less Mana
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.39.sub: Generates mana out of Shulkers fighting other monsters. If a shulker inflicts Levitation on a monster it targets, both the shulker and the hit entity are in the flower's range, and the flower has no mana stored in its buffer, it will kill both entities, suppress their drops, and completely fill its buffer. As shulkers do not spawn naturally and don't attack other monsters on their own, a Cocoon of Caprice can be used to spawn them, and a Heisei Dream to cause them to target monsters
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.40.sub: This star concentrated alloy will be used to forge a powerful Asgardian Weapon. It can also be used with any item in the Smithing Table, to make it indestructible
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.41.sub: Source Berries are very useful. They can be used to obtain dye, make food items that will assist you in your journey as a mage, and can also be used to make Source Farms
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.42.sub: The Arcane Frame will serve as a base for all magic contraptions you're going to craft next
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.43.sub: A simple block which will allow you to access a Void Dimension. You'll be spawned on a 7x7 platform. From there, you can start building a new base. This can be useful to avoid having a laggy base in Overworld. This block does not need any frame in order to work properly. Just Right-Click it to enter and get back from the Dimension. On multiplayer, there will be just ONE Void dimension for everyone
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.44.sub: The Magic Clay will be used as a base for Tier 1 Spell Glyphs
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.45.sub: Actually learning spells. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.45.des: The Glyph Press will be used to make Glyphs which you can add to a SpellBook where you can use them to make whatever spells you want.

The Glyph Press will require one of 3 types of Magical Clay, a Reagent and some Source. To start the crafting process, press some Clay intro the Press, then the Reagent and finally, some Source near the Press. The crafting process will start, resulting in a Glyph.
The Glyph crafting process can be automated. Clay can be pushed in from the sides and the Reagent can be pushed in from the top.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.46.sub: The Mythical Clay will be used as a base for Tier 3 Spell Glyphs
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.47.sub: The Marvelous Clay will be used as a base for Tier 2 Spell Glyphs
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_3.quests.48.sub: This Altar will allow you to summon the Wandering Trader (Starmetal Block recipe), or the Red Merchant from Supplementaries (because this thing couldn't have been 100% useless - now it is 90% useless). The Altar needs a multiblock structure in order for it to work properly (same structure for every operation). Use JEI to see the structure in-world
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.title: 奥秘蜕变 - 4
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.0.subt: 传说是真的。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.0.desc: 贤者之石，正如传说所言，是一个神秘的炼金术物质，能够将一些基础的金属，例如水银，转化为金或者银。
它也被叫做长生不老药，对永葆青春和获得永生来说很有用。
虽然前面提到的性质都来自一段传说，但在这里，它们是真实存在的。在某种程度上，贤者之石就是如此。
贤者之石有把铁锭转化为金锭，金锭转化为钻石，诸如此类的物品变化能力。同样也有在不同方块间进行等价交换的能力，可以使用 JEI 查看可用的转化，并使用右键点击和 Shift 右键点击进行所有的转化。贤者之石也可以通过充能来获取更大的作用面积。通过按下充能键给它充能（在控制中进行键位绑定）。
最后，它也可以打开一个工作台界面（同样需要在控制中绑定键位）。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.1.subt: 物品工厂 I。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.1.desc: 能量凝聚器是等价交换中一个像箱子一样的机器。它可以消耗具有EMC值的物品复制另外的具有EMC值的物品。左上角的栏位放入需要复制的物品，然后，如果有足够的EMC，放在其他91个栏位的任何物品都将被转化为目标物品。
凝聚器也可以使用相邻的反物质继电器或能量收集器中产生的EMC值。如果目标栏位中没有物品，能量凝聚器将停止转换。
如果有足够的EMC储量，能量凝聚器可以瞬间将其它物品转化为目标物品。它也可将物品20个/秒，或者1个/tick的速度转化为EMC值。
能量凝聚器的EMC存储上限是10,000,000EMC，所以你无法复制EMC值大于此的任何物品。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.2.subt: 能量凝聚器2型是一种升级版的能量凝聚器，除了能更快地转化外，2型还拥有一个单独的物品栏用于输出，这个单独的物品栏可以用漏斗将产物从凝聚器中导出。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.3.subt: 初步EMC存储。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.3.desc: 二级卡莱恩能量之星是等价交换中的一种EMC存储物品。它有200,000EMC容量，并能用于合成三级卡莱恩能量之星。
可以将它放置于转化桌中，使用物品给其充能，或者放置于能量收集器、反物质继电器的输出栏位中。当放置于反物质继电器的输入栏位时，卡莱恩能量之星中的EMC将会转移至反物质继电器中。如果一个存有EMC的卡莱恩能量之星被放置于转化桌的“火焰”栏位中，卡莱恩能量之星将会被销毁并转化为EMC值，存储的EMC将消失。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.4.subt: EMC存储基础：三级卡莱恩能量之星拥有800,000EMC容量，能用于合成四级卡莱恩能量之星
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.5.subt: 进阶EMC存储：拥有3,200,000EMC容量的四级卡莱恩能量之星，能用于合成五级卡莱恩能量之星
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.6.subt: 精英EMC存储。进一步EMC存储：五级卡莱恩能量之星拥有12,800,000EMC容量，能用于合成六级卡莱恩能量之星
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.7.subt: 终极EMC存储。六级卡莱恩能量之星拥有51,200,000EMC容量
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.8.subt: EMC收集装置1型。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.8.desc: 能量收集器1型是等价交换中的一级EMC被动收集装置。
它拥有10,000EMC容量，最高被动产生4EMC/秒，速度取决于当前的光照强度。当与能量凝聚器、反物质继电器相邻时，能量收集器将会将EMC转移到这些机器中。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.9.subt: EMC收集装置2型。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.9.desc: 能量收集器2型是等价交换中的二级EMC被动收集装置。
它拥有30,000EMC容量，最高被动产生12EMC/秒，速度取决于当前的光照强度。当与能量凝聚器、反物质继电器相邻时，能量收集器将会将EMC转移到这些机器中。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.10.sub: EMC收集装置3型。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.10.des: 能量收集器3型是等价交换中的三级EMC被动收集装置。
在强光下，或者放置在地狱中，它能每秒被动产生40EMC，拥有60,000EMC容量。当与能量凝聚器、反物质继电器相邻时，能量收集器将会将EMC转移到这些机器中。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.11.sub: EMC转移装置1型。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.11.des: 反物质继电器1型是等价交换中的EMC转移装置。
这台机器有两种功能：第一，放入物品栏的任何物品都会被转化为EMC；第二，它能将EMC从能量收集器转移至能量凝聚器，转移速度最高可达64EMC/秒，并拥有100,000EMC的缓存。在转移过程中，相邻于能量收集器的一面会拥有1EMC的额外奖励。它也可以用EMC充能卡莱恩能量之星。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.12.sub: 暗物质是整个宇宙中最致密的几种物质之一，唯一比它更加致密的物质是红物质。它是一种合成材料，可以用于制作强大的物品，包括工具和护甲。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.13.sub: 实话说，我不知道为什么你拿着这个却没死。但无论怎么说，红物质都是整个宇宙中最致密的物质。就像它的弟弟，暗物质，红物质也可以制作极其强大的物品，比如工具和盔甲。需要解锁游戏终局。
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.14.sub: EMC转移装置2型：最高转移192EMC/秒。最高存储1,000,000EMC
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.15.sub: EMC转移装置3型：最高转移640EMC/秒。最高存储10,000,000EMC
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.16.sub: 通过结合反物质继电器和能量收集器，可以产生大量EMC。左键点击以获取更多信息
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.16.des: 力量之花是一种将能量收集器（任意大小）和反物质继电器（任意形状）组合的安排，能够为核心的能量凝聚器提供无限的EMC，用于转化为材料。这种放置方式看起来像花，所以被称为“力量之花”。
大概有几千种不同的放置力量之花的方式，这些方式各有各的长处和用途，每种方式都需要一个教程，我们会尝试告诉你相对典型的几种：
花瓣形力量之花：花瓣形力量之花是一种大型的，可堆叠的EMC收集结构。根据你的EMC需求，它们可以堆叠得相当大，并且很容易埋在地下。
“花瓣形力量之花”是一种众所周知的力量之花放置方式，很适合大规模、可堆叠的EMC生产。它包括花瓣部分的EMC收集结构，这一结构附着在中心的“柄”或者转移EMC的目标上。如果需要，你可以增加更多的“花瓣”来提高产出。
这是个模块化的结构，如果你想的话，可以加入许多模块。一个模块需要：
第1步：花上的模块由以上的材料组成，大概占据5x5x3的空间，这取决于你想呈现的效果。如果你想要在你的力量之花上放非常多的“花瓣”，那么建议你将力量之花埋在基岩层附近，然后向上堆叠。
第2步：第一层——模块的第一层由1个能量凝聚器、4个反物质继电器、8个能量收集器组成。当你放置了能量收集器，记得检查需要复制的目标物品是否放置正确。
第3步：第二层——在能量凝聚器的顶部放置一个物流管道（或者任何能运输物品的管道），然后将另外的能量收集器放置在反物质继电器暴露出的顶部。使用管道配置工具确保物流管道不与任何一个反物质继电器或能量收集器连接。
第4步：第三层——要完成这个力量之花的模块，你只需要把物流管道接入一个外部容器，比如箱子。你也可以将荧石放在能量收集器上来最大化其效率。然后只需要增加更多反物质继电器重复这个模块即可。
进一步，你可以通过增加模块来尽可能最大化提高物品复制效率。你也可以使用能量收集器和反物质继电器的任意组合方式。除了工作的效率，装置的等级不会产生任何影响。

Orb Power Flower: The Orb Power Flower configuration is a smaller configuration ideally suited for a \"working\" environment in which you need quick access to a Power Flower but don't need the massive EMC generation of a larger, petaled version.

The Orb Power Flower is a configuration of the Power Flower that favors easy access, ease of production change and lower space requirements over the amount of  EMC produced. It is often the most common starter power flower configuration as it is cheaper and easier to use than the more advanced Petaled Power Flower.

It requires 1 main condenser, 5 relays and 17 collectors.  The central condensor can also be replaced with another collector and used to power a Klein star instead of creating items. This actually generates slightly more EMC/sec than with a condenser.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.17.sub: Base material for Mystical Agriculture. It is obtained by energizing Terminite and Draconium
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.18.sub: Grow the Pink Slime seeds to produce Pink Slimeballs and advance towards infinity
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.19.sub: Growing totally legal plants. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.19.des: Like the most majority of the mods available, Mystical Agriculture also has its own crafting system and it's called The Infusion Altar.
It is made out of two parts: The Altar and the Pedestals. After placing the Altar down, the Pedestal placement locations will be shown.
To craft something, place your items on the Altar and Pedestals by Right-Clicking with them, or by using item pipes, and then, provide a redstone signal to start the crafting process.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.20.sub: Base for Mystical Agriculture's 1st Tier. Will allow you to grow Ice, Wood, and more types of Crops. It is also the only type of Essence which can be turned into a crop which can be grown
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.21.sub: Base for Mystical Agriculture's 2nd Tier. Will allow you to grow Uraninite, Aluminum, and more types of Crops
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.22.sub: Base for Mystical Agriculture's 3rd Tier. Will allow you to grow Crops for the most majority of the ores/minerals available
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.23.sub: Base for Mystical Agriculture's 4th Tier. Will allow you to access rare metal Crops
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.24.sub: Base for Mystical Agriculture's 5th Tier. Will allow you to obtain Diamond and Netherite Crops. It will also give you access to a very powerful set of Armor and Tools which are Modular and can accept Augments
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.25.sub: The Base for Mystical Agriculture's last Tier. Will give you access to Nether Star and Dragon Egg Crops. It will also allow you to enter in the ProjectE
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.26.sub: Planting essential resources. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.26.des: Mystical Agriculture is a mod that allows you grow crops for resources as an alternative to quarries.
In our pack, these crops are mostly used to obtain resources such as metals and minerals. Feel free to look through JEI to see what crops you have available.
Now, let's talk about tiers and how to start with this mod. There are 6 tiers, represented by Essences. Each tier will be more and more expensive to obtain, but it will also be more powerful.

Each plant added by this mod is bound to a different tier, as a result of their output. For example, Wood Crops will be made with Inferium Essence (which is the 1st Tier), and the Iron Crops will be made with Tertium Essence (which is the 3rd Tier).
To obtain the 1st Tier of Essence (Inferium), you'll need Luminessence. By dropping this glowing powder in a Mana Pool with an Alchemy Catalyst under it, you can obtain the Inferium Essence.
For the Luminessence, we recommend using a Resonant Integral Component with Flux Linkage Amplifiers for each Fluid Encapsulator you're going to use.
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.27.sub: The Prosperity Seeds are the base for each special crop added by Mystical Agriculture. Make sure you've got lots of these
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.28.sub: Make the Uraninite Seeds and start growing your way towards massive amounts of Powah!
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.29.sub: Three colors in my world. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.29.des: The Covalance Dusts are used in high end recipes to obtain powerful machines and overpowered items.
Covalence dust comes in 3 tiers. This includes Low (Green), Medium (Light Blue), High (Dark Blue).
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.30.sub: Equivalent to 4 regular Coals. However, it has the potential to be create even more powerful fuels
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.31.sub: Equivalent to 16 regular Coals. However, it has the potential to be create even more powerful fuels
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.32.sub: Equivalent to 64 regular Coals. However, it has the potential to be create even more powerful fuels and strage objects
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.33.sub: Will be used as a base material in Mystical Agriculture. Is obtained by Energizing Souce Gems
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.34.sub: Plant them, give them a Crux, give them the best soil and some Growth Accelerators and watch them as they give you infinite Nether Stars
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.35.sub: Plant them, give them a Crux, give them the best soil and some Growth Accelerators and watch them as they give you infinite Dragon Eggs
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.36.sub: Some plants can't just grow on dirt and need additional support. When growing Nether Star and Dragon Egg Seeds, Cruxes will be required. These have to be placed underneath the dirt block that has a plant growing untop of it. And of course, each plant requires its own unique Crux
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.37.sub: This is a modification station capable of adding Augments to different modular items from Mystical Agriculture. Although it has 6 slots available, all the modular items will use just one of these, so yeah. Consider this table to have only one slot. The modular items consist in all the Supremium Tools and the Supremium Armor set
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.38.sub: Inferium is the only Essence from Mystical Agriculture which can be grown. Make the Inferium Seeds to start making the greatest Garden seen by mankind
ftbquests.chapter.arcane_4.quests.39.sub: Biofuel is a fluid added by Industrial Foregoing. Biofuel is created in a Magma Crucible with Insanium Essence. This liquid will be used by different Industrial Foregoing gadgets. It also has some other uses. It will inflict Speed and Haste status effects if it is consumed with a Straw. Entities will be inflicted with Haste while touching Biofuel
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.title: Atum
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.0.title: Desert Adept
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.0.subtit: Ok, so you wanna go to Atum? You'll need a Scarab to light up the Portal. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.0.descri: Since you're here, it must mean that you're ready to enter Atum. If you're not, we have no idea why you're here. Go play with Create or something :/

Now, considering that you're ready, let's see how you make the portal for this dimension. Things are not too complicated. Just 49 piesces of Sandstone and a pool of Water will be required for this task.
Below, you can see how the portal frame should look like:
Fill it with water, then throw the Scarab in it. The Portal will light up and this quest will allow you to enter Atum. Isn't that great? ☻
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.1.title: Atum
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.2.subtit: Can be used to obtain Godshards that can be further used in multiple ways. Just place an Artifact in, add some fuel in the form of Lava, and you shall obtain your precious GodShards which can be crafted into Godforged Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.3.title: You'll probably need more then just one
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.3.subtit: Nebu Torches will be required to open a Pyramid's entrance and, also, to wake up a Pharaoh
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.4.title: Pyramid
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.4.subtit: The place where you can find a Pharaoh
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.5.title: Desert Master
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.5.subtit: Mastering Atum. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.5.descri: The Pharaoh is boss added by Atum 2. He comes with 13 variants and you can find him in a Pyramid structure, inside the boss room.
To spawn him you must go to the boss room and place 4 Nebu Torches around the sarcophagus on the Carved Limestone.
Pharaoh is temporary spawning Mummys and regenerating his life. Each variant of Pharaoh has different attacks, textures and loot.
You may also specify which Pharaoh you wish to summon through special pharaoh torches that can be crafted with the associated Godshard.
To obtain Godshards you need to smelt the relics dropped by Pharaohs upon their death, in a GodForge.
Assuming that you've defeated a Pharaoh after the Twilight Ghast, we'll see you in the next Age.
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.6.title: Ra Armor
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.6.subtit: Ra's Radiance: The Armor of Ra is one of the Godforged Armor sets. It is based on one of Atum's deities, Ra. Each piece of armor individually grants the same bonuses, but when worn as a full set grants an additional bonus particular to Atem; You're immune to fire and lava damage
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.7.title: Atem Armor
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.7.subtit: Atem's Divinity: The Armor of Atem is one of the Godforged Armor sets. It is based on one of Atum's deities, Atem. Each piece of armor individually grants the same bonuses, but when worn as a full set grants an additional bonus particular to Atem; You gain protection against Death once per day
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.8.subtit: 2x2 smelting. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.8.descri: The Kiln can smelt 4 items at a time.
This smelting contraption will require a multiblock to work. Block list:
Below you can see an example of how the Kiln should look like:
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.9.subtit: The Limestone Furnace will be very similar to the Vanilla Furnace, however, it will be much cheaper to craft
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.10.subti: The Spinning Wheel is a nice station which can be used to obtain String related Items, such as the Linen Thread. It can also be used to recycle some items back into String. To use it, Right-Click the top of the block until the middle of it is filled with your material. Simply Right-Click the middle of the block to take out the output
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.11.title: Deity Torches
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.11.subti: Deity Torches are used to summon a specific Pharaoh from their sargophagus. Just place 4 of these special torches next to their sarcophagus, on the marked spots and the chance of them being summoned, will be increased
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.12.title: Godforged Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.12.subti: Godforged Blocks are used to obtain Artifacts from a certain Deity added by Atum. Just place them down and break them with a Nebu Hammer to obtain an Artifact. You can also craft Godforged Blocks specific to a Deity to increase the chances of obtaining a certain Artifact
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.13.subti: The Nebu Ore is a mystical metal which can be found only in the Atum Dimension
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.14.subti: Used to obtain GodShards from Godforged blocks
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.15.title: Obtaining Artifacts
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.15.subti: Atum Artifacts are rare items which have unique abilities. They can be obtained as rare items in loot chests, as drops from Pharaohs, or as drops from breaking Godforged Blocks with a Nebu Hammer
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.16.title: Wanderer Outfit
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.16.subti: These clothes can be used to upgrade your vanilla sets of Armor. By combining it with Iron, Gold, or Diamond Armor Pieaces, you can obtain versions of the regular sets of Armor, but with higher durability
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.17.subti: Approximately +20 durability points for each Armor Piece
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.18.subti: Approximately +17 durability points for each Armor Piece
ftbquests.chapter.atum_2.quests.19.subti: Approximately +50 durability points for each Armor Piece
ftbquests.chapter.cooking.title: Cooking!
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.title: Doggy Talents
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.0: Each training process has a start
Level up! Left Click for more info
Ok, so we've talked about levels, skill points and how you spent them, but we haven't talked about how you get more points. Well, this is it.

Training Treats can be given to your dog to raise their level. There are multiple tiers of treats and each tier will raise your dog's level to a falt amount. The current tier, will make your dog go to a maximum level of 20.
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.4: By shift right-clicking the bed while your dog is nearby, you'll make your dog claim the bed. If your dog dies, you'll be able to respawn them at their bed. Just right click the bed <3
Obtain a DogBed out of 32523523 versions xD
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.5: If your dog is in Wandering mode, this bowl will keep feeding them, of course, if you place some food in it. If your dog is sitting, its hunger will not drop
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.6: \"Hey Guugle! Where's Penny?!\" Left Click for more info
By now you might've observed that you dogs don't have a collar. Well, that's because you can place them custom collars.
This one right here, will allow you to track your dog's position, so it is easier to find it.
You'll need a radar to see where your dog is.
To get a collar down, you'll need a set of Collar Shears.
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.7: Starting the adventure as a Doggy Trainer!
Welcome to Doggy Talents! Left Click for more info

Doggy Talents is a mod that turns the vanilla Wolves into trained dogs and adds new talents and training systems. Keep in mind that this mod, will NOT replace the vanilla wolves. These ones still spawn and you'll have to turn them into Doggy Talents dogs.

In The Decursio Project, there are two ways to get a puppy from Doggy Talents. The first one is to finish this quest and obtain the Doggy Charm. It will act like a spawn egg which will give you a dog from Doggy Talents. The second way is to tame a regular Wolf using bones, and then, feed it with a Training Treat. This will turn it into a dog from this mod.
Now that you've got a smarted dog, let's see what's so special about it. If you right-click it with a stick (yes, a stick), you'll open the training interface.
Example of the Training Interface:
There are multiple thing right here which we need to talk about:

Pink - Here you can type a name for your Dog. After a name was selected, it will be displayed above your dog's head alongside other information. Bellow the name box, you can see your dog's current level and dire level.
Orange - Here you can see some general information about your dog, including its current speed, curretn owner, age and more.

Red - With every level, your dog will receive upgrade points which can be applied on the left side of the interface, for different skills. These skills can be mastered when they reach level 5. By default, you'll receive 15 points to spend, but be careful with how you spend them, as you won't be able to remove any upgrades. We'll talk more about how you can raise your dog's level and get more upgrade points, later.
Yellow - There are multiple skill pages.

Green - Usually, you'd be able to select if friendly fire is turned on/off, but in our pack, friend fire is always set to false, so don't worry about hitting your puppy by accident. Here you can also select the texture you want you dog to have, and if it should obey other players or not.
Light Blue - Here, you'll be able to select the mode in which you want your dog to be. The modes available are:
* Docile: The dog will follow you, not attacking anything, just follow. It will wait for you to throw the bone.

* Wandering: The dog will wander around the area, staying close to its food bowl until you command it to do something. You have to be sure that your dog is \"set\" to the food bowl by bringing it within one block of the bowl.
* Aggressive: The dog will follow you and attack anything that you attack, or anything that you get hurt by, any mob. Good for farming sheep and stuff.
* Berserker: The dog will follow you, but will immediately attack any mob that gets too close.
* Tactical: The dog will follow you, but only attack a mob when you use the command emblem on it.
* Patrol: The dog will patrol certain areas you mark with the command whistle and attack any sort of entity.
Lastly, let's talk about the information presented above your dog's head after you gave it a name. Here's an example:

The first bracket (red) will show the mode in which your dog is currently in. The second bracket (orange), will show your dog's current hunger level. Dogs need food just like players do. However, if your dog sits down, its hunger won't drop. The final backet shows the dog's gender.

One thing you should keep in mind is that, if your dog doesn't receive any food and its hunger drops too low, the first bracket (red) will state as \"I\" which comes from \"Incapacitated\". In this mode, your dog won't be able to help you with anything and you'll have to take care of it until it recovers. Just give them planty of food and, of course, love, through a cake, and they should be back on track without any problems.
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.8: Let's learn some things about commands. Left Click for more info
The Whistle can be used to give your dog, commands, from a distance. The commands are the following:
Stand - Will make your dog stand and will change its current mode to Docile.
Heel - Will teleport your dog to your right side.
Stay - Will make your dog sit down.
Okey - Will make you dog stand retaining its mode.

Shepard - This mode will work only of the Shepard Dog skill has points into it. This mode will make your dog, given it is in Docile mode, rustle up some nearby livestock, so that you can transport them more easier on long distances.
Tactical - This mode will shoot a snowball which will act as a beam for you dog. If that snowball hits a mob, your dog will attack it.
Roaring - This mode will work only if the Roaring Gale skill has some points spent into it. It will make your dog howl to stun the nearby enemies for a few seconds.
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.9: With the Throw Bone and Throw Stick, you can play with your dog. Things are pretty straight forward. Just throw one of them and your dog will rush to bring them back to you. They might be a little droolly, so just wipe them using right-click
ftbquests.chapter.doggy_talents.quests.1: This bone can be used to..well.. breed your dogs. 101 puppies INCOMMIIIIIING, YEAAAAH!!!!
This set of sheers can be used to get collars and jackets off of dogs
More or less, the vanilla collar. Can be dyed however you like. Note that you'll need lots of dyes to make it saturated
ChewSticks will give your dog a huge speed boost for a very short amount of time. Finishing this quest, will reward you with a Treat Bag which can be used to store foods for your puppy!
Big Smoke/Tiny Smoke: These bones can be used to either increase, or decrease your dog's size. Ever wanted a large puppy in minecraft? Well, now that's possible!
It's Bond. Dog Bond: This suit can be placed on your dog to make it look like a secred agent from the movies
Squares on a Cubic Dog, Great!: Can be placed on your dog to give it a warm look and feel
Eveery color in your Heart: This cape, can be dyed with any color you like. Just make sure to match your dog's beautiful eyes <3
GTD - The Lost and the barked: This jacket will have your dog prepared for a ride with the bikers
ftbquests.chapter.final_objectives.title: Final Objectives
ftbquests.chapter.final_objectives.quest: The Creative Motor can supply a customizable amount of Rotational Force, requiring no energy input. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.
Not even NASA has such servers. The Creative ME Storage Cell will provide infinite storage. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.
The Everlasting Guilty Pool will provide its user with infinite amouts of mana. This is useful for lazy people, of course. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

Feeding Blazes with a cake might prove to be unnecessary at times. The Creative Blaze Cake will make a blaze burner run forever, at any required temperature. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

Farming for rare liquids its not for you? Then, you might wanna get your hands on this puppy. The Creative tank will give you infinite amounts of any liquid. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.
The Ultimate Auto-Crafting Table is a station which unlocks 9x9 crafting. It is used to make Creative Items. This is the key to the end of the Decursio Project.

Galactic Omniscense: The Infinity Armor is the strongest piece of equipment known to mankind. While wearing it, it will literally be impossible to die. It also has Creative Flight capabilities. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

100% drop chance from a loot bag: The Sword of the Cosmos has inifinite amounts of damage. It also has two abilities. Right-Click will kill all the agressive mobs nearby. Shift Right-Clicking will kill all the mobs nearby. Oh, and of course. It can destroy Chaos Crystals with one hit. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

Might be able to mine Bedrock: The World Breaker can mine through almost anything with a very high level of the Fortune enchantment. The Pickaxe has a secondary mode which can be activated using Shift Righ-Click. In this mode, it will be able to mine very large areas of stone. All of the mined blocks, will be added to your inventory in the form of a Matter Cluster. All the items can be retrived by Right-Clicking the Cluster. Also, in this mode it will allow you to pick up Bedrock using Right-Click. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

This will not save any forest: If you attempt to mine with it while holding the Shift key, you'll instantly chop down the entire tree. However, if you Shift Right-Click with the Axe in the air, all the trees in fron of you, will be instantly erased and they'll be added to your inventory in the form of a Matter Cluster. All the items can be retrived by Right-Clicking the Cluster. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

Removing all the dirt in the world?: The Planet Eater, similar to the other tools, will have two operating modes. In the main one, you'll have a regular, very fast, shovel. However, in the secondary one (activated with Shift Right-Click), you'll have a massive excavator. It will harvest all the blocks in a huge area and it will add them to your inventory in the form of a Matter Cluster. The items can be retrived from the Cluster using Right-Click. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

Shooting your shot, was never easier: The Longbow of the Heavens is basically, the Ultimate Bow. It does not require any vanilla Arrows in order to shoot. It will also deal huge amounts of damage and you can launch arrows at very high speeds, without charging the Bow completely. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

Summoning the rain of arrows: This Arrow is meant to be used in combination with the Infinity Bow. While holding this Arrow in your inventory, each shot dealt by the Infinity Bow, will summon a Rain of Arrows. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

This is a very large and, at the same time, very nice looking chest. While it is quite expensive, it will provide a total amount of 243 slots. It is, indeed, smaller then a Draconium Chest, but in some situations, this one might be easier to obtain ☺. One of the quests which represent the END of The Decursio Project.

Crossing an infinity line: The Crossbow of the Inferno will allow you to shoot infinite arrows. It has a small charging period. If you have arrows in your inventory, the Crossbow will launch 3 projectiles at the price of 1. If you have an infinity arrow in your inventory, you'll shoot around 20 projectiles at once
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.title: Gear - 1
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.0.title: Starting Tools
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.0.subtit: Make your first tools and conquer the World with them. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.0.descri: Unlike a regular Minecraft experiance, here you'll have to use Flint to make your first set of Tools. These will require Flint and Straw. Straw can be obtained by breaking Grass with the Flint Knife.
Now, the Flint set of Tools will be quite similar to the Stone one, which you're most probably used to. However, there are some key differences between these Flint tools and the Vanilla ones.

They'll have less durability and the Pickaxe will allow you to mine only Copper, Tin, Zinc, Lapis Lazuli and Lead. Coal, Iron and other resources cannot be harvested by this pick and you'll have to progress further in order to obtain a pick strong enough to break the other Ores.

Finishing this quest will give you a Chopping Block which can be used to obtain 4 Planks out of a variety of Logs. Just place a Log on the Chopping Block and Right-Click it with an Axe until you get your Planks.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.1.title: Getting into some real Tools!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.1.subtit: Using Tinkers Construct, make your first Pickaxe. Left Click for more info. PS: Vanilla tools have modified recipes and are not available at this stage
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.1.descri: Since you can't use Bronze Tools forever, we'd say it is time for an upgrade, or actually, a downgrade.

Tinker's Construct will eventually allow you to access Tools better then the Bronze ones, but for now you'll have to downgrade to something like Stone (metals can't be used yet, as they have to be casted). Don't worry, you'll be able to upgrade even these new Stone Tools.

For now, through the Part Builder, you'll be able to access only Tier I Materials. Note that each Material available (even Tier I), usually has some special abilities. For example, Tools which contain a Stone Part will mine faster when they have low durability, but will do less Damage. To see more about these Materials and their properties, consult the 'Encyclopedia of Tinkering'.
Make any tool from Tinkers Construct
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.2.subtit: Build a vanilla Furnace and get out of the primitive stage of the game
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.3.title: The Coke Oven - Mk I
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.3.subtit: Craft Coke Bricks. Left click for information on creating a Coke Oven
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.3.descri: Right click a 3x3x3 cube of Coke Bricks with an Engineer's Hammer to make a Coke Oven.
The Coke Oven will fill up with Creosote Oil and eventually stop working, so try to automate draining this as soon as possible.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.4.title: Blast Furnace
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.4.subtit: Craft Blast Bricks. Left click for information on creating a Blast Furnace
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.4.descri: Right click a 3x3x3 cube of Blast Bricks with an Engineer's Hammer to make a Blast Furnace.
A Blast Furnace will accept Coal Coke produced in a Coke Oven and Iron Ingots to slowly produce Steel.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.5.title: Forging Ahead!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.5.subtit: Obtain Steel from a Blast Furnace which uses Coal Coke, or Charcoal as Fuel. 1 Coal Coke will be required per Steel Ingot. 4 Charcoal pieces will be required per Steel Ingot. Required to unlock the 2nd Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.6.title: Crafting Table MkIII
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.6.subtit: Unlike the Crafting Station from Tinker's Construct, the Metal Crafting Table has an internal inventory for storing items you might use store items for recipes. It also has a feature which will allow you to make the previous recipes with ease. Just hit the arrows located on the right hand side
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.7.title: Crafting Table MkI
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.7.subtit: Getting Started. Left click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.7.descri: Well, nothing too special here, just the vanilla Crafting Table. Don't worry, you'll spend a lot of time making lots and lots of modded things.

For now, just make a Crafting Table to receive a nice starting kit. This kit will include the Nature's Compass which will allow you to find all the biomes you need. Right Click with it and its interface will open. Here, you'll be able to search for any biome in the game throught multiple filters.
This quest will be the start of the 1st Age's tech phase and at this point, you can consider yourself to be some sort of Advanced Cavemen. Call yourself Homo Sapiens Sapiens Sapiens.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.8.title: The Camp Fire
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.8.subtit: The Camp Fire will act as an early option for Cooking. It can heat up most of the average food items and it can even be used to obtain Torches early, since you don't have access to regular Coal yet. Just place Sticks on the Campfire and wait
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.9.title: Starting Agriculture - Animal
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.9.subtit: Delicious even in MidGard. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.9.descri: Part of agriculture are animals, too. Start a basic animal farm to keep yourself well fed.
We'd suggest getting Cows early on, as they'll provide both Leather and Milk which will be used a lot in the beginning.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.10.subti: Better then your regular coal. This beauty can smelt up to 16 items at a time, instead of 8 which can be smelted with the Vanilla Coal
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.11.title: Starting Agriculture - Vegetal
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.11.subti: Go do som' foreging! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.11.descr: Highly recommended at the beginning of you jorney, is to start foreging for food. Starting a Farm is also recommended early on to produce certain resources. Use Glass blocks untop of your crops to make them grow YEAR ROUND!
Note that: The crops you'll find in OverWorld will be generated by Pam's Harvestraft 2.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.12.title: Da Vinci's Storage
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.12.descr: The Vanilla Chest, is now crafted with treated wood. By combining the chest with a log, you can obtain that type of chest.
*vanilla logs, for their respective type of chest, not supported - example: spruce chest dont exist*
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.13.title: Basic Tinker Setup
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.13.subti: These two stations are added by Tinker's Construct and will be used to make your first set of tools. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.13.descr: Tinker's Construct allows players like you to create modular Tools which are, in many ways, better then the Vanilla Tool. These two Stations are a part of the mod and they're used to build Tool Part and assemble them into great Tools. Let's see how these work.
First, if you haven't played with TC since 1.12, you should know that the Stencil Table was removed and now, it is integrated into the Part Builder. You'll only need blank Patterns.

Now, if you haven't touched Tinker's Construct in your life, you should know that the Part Builder is used to turn materials into tool parts. A blank Pattern is placed in the left-hand side of the GUI. The material to be used is then place next to the pattern. This will show you a list of possible Tool Parts to craft. Choose one and then, take it out of the GUI.

Now, you might find yourself in a situation where you select a Tool Part and nothing happens. That's most probably due to the fact that you don't have enough Material to make that Part. Yeah, that's right. Some Tool Parts, such as a Hammer Head, will require, for example, 8 pieces of Cobblestone. So make sure you have enough materials before starting to make your Tool.
Example of the Part Builder GUI:

Notice how we're trying to make a Pickaxe Head with only 1 piece of Cobblestone. That's not gonna happen, as also stated by the information given on the right-hand side, we need 1 more piece of Cobblestone for a Pickaxe head. You can also see that, more information about the material we're using, is shown on the right-hand side. That information is related to all the possible parts we can make with that Material.

Now, let's cover the Tinker Station. This is where you will assemble your Tool. Upon opening the GUI, you'll be greeted by a very nice interface. It might look a bit confusing in the beginning, but don't worry, we'll cover its main aspects.

On the left-hand side, you'll be able to see a series of buttons. The first one is the upgrade tab, where you can place already existing Tools from Tinker's Construct, and upgrade them. All the other buttons represent tabs where you can assemble Tools. Unfortunately, the Tinker Station will NOT allow you to assemble all the Tools available in the mod, so, for now, you'll have to wait until the 2nd Age for more advanced Tools.

Selecting one of the Tools, will show you, on the right-hand side, all of the Parts required to assemble it, along with a general description of the Tool and what it does. Place your Parts in their respective slots, and your Tool will be ready for work.
Example of the Tinker Station GUI:
Notice how we're trying to make a Stone Pickage. The Pickaxe tab has selected on the left-hand side and information about the Pickaxe we're about to assemble is shown on the right-hand side.

Now, a small addition to our pack is the Tinker's Construct Planner Mod. It adds a small Blueprint button in the Tinker Station (highlighted in green in the exemple shown previously). Upon clicking on it, a planning menu will be opened. Here you can play around with certain Tools, Materials, Upgrades and Abilities to create the ultimate Tool. You can also bookmark it and have it saved, so you can build it later.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.14.title: Glass
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.14.subti: Glass will be used to make a smeltery setup. That's it. Juust that. What? You're looking for something else?
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.15.title: Making Grout
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.15.subti: I am Groot! Grout will be used to obtaine Seared Stone in general. This will be a main ingredient in the process of obtaining Tinkers Construct contraptions
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.16.subti: Basic smelting. Note that, in this pack, none of the tinker's smelting options will provide more ingots/ore. Ore doubling will come later, and will be provided, as a start, by Create. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.16.descr: Well, what do you know? Part of the journey is Tinkers Construct and so is the smelting system provided by it.

The Melter will be your first and most basic smelting setup. If you're a veteran, then you'll wander what happened to the smeltery? That'll come later, don't worry. For now, you're stuck with this setup.
The melter can hold 9 ingots of any metal/material and has only 3 input slots. It can either accept solid fuel through a Heater, or liquid fuel (lava) through a Seared Tank.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.17.title: Basic Casting
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.17.subti: Casting can be done with basic sand casts which hold only one use
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.18.title: Flowing Seared Stone
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.18.subti: Molten Seared Stone will be required to obtain Coke Bricks
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.18.tasks: Finish this quest DOES NOT mean you did what you had to!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.19.title: Mighty Smeltery
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.19.subti: The Smeltery will allow you to make some alloys and also, to smelt more materials at once. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.19.descr: The Smeltery is a multi-block structure used in the creation of higher-tier weapons and tools using metal and alloys. It is used to smelt ores, ingots or blocks of almost any metal as well as Obsidian.
Begin construction by placing a 3x3 base of Seared Bricks. Typical Smeltery construction has the base laid into the ground rather than on top of the ground.

Add walls one layer above the Smeltery base in a 5x5 perimeter. The corners are not necessary for the functioning of the smeltery and may be left out. Any blocks placed in these corners will not count as a component of the Smeltery.

To complete the Smeltery, replace two of the wall blocks with a Seared Tank and a Smeltery Controller. The Smeltery Controller should begin glowing, indicating successful Smeltery construction. Right-clicking the Smeltery Controller will allow you to access the Smeltery GUI. Note that you can only have one Smeltery Controller in a smeltery.

You can continue to add layers to your Smeltery walls. Every layer that you add will give you an additional 9 processing slots (9 slots for each 3x3 space inside the smeltery). The smeltery walls can be constructed out of any variety of Seared Brick, Seared Glass, or Seared Windows.

You will also need to add Smeltery Drains and Faucets to your Smeltery. When you place a Smeltery Drain, it does not matter which side the hole faces. If your Smeltery is a 5x5 with no corners, you cannot place the drain in the empty corners; it must be placed in one of the walls. You can place the drains at any level up and down the Smeltery; however, keep in mind that they will require a Casting Basin or Casting Table placed directly underneath the faucet to work.

To use the Smeltery, you must first add some lava to the Seared Tank, Seared Window, or Seared Glass (Either manually by right-clicking with a bucket of Lava. This will heat up the interior of the Smeltery to allow you to process materials. Once your Smeltery has some lava powering it, right-click on the Smeltery Controller to bring up its GUI.
The left side of the GUI shows your processing slots, with 9 slots added for every layer of empty space inside your smeltery.

The middle of the GUI is the storage tank where the liquid metals are stored. This allows you to see how much liquid metal is inside the Smeltery, what kinds of metal, and in what order they will be drained (starting from the bottom). You CAN CHANGE the order by clicking on the desired liquid.
The bar along the right side of the GUI is how much lava the Smeltery currently has left. Having less lava means the ores heat up slower. No lava prevents any smelting from occurring.

To use the liquid metal, you must drain the liquid into a Casting Basin or a Casting Table. Place a Seared Faucet onto the small hole on a Smeltery Drain, and place a Casting Basin or Casting Table underneath the drain. To activate the Faucet, right-click on it. A Casting Basin will allow you to create blocks. Metal blocks require 9 ingots, but other smeltable materials, like Obsidian or Glass and Sand, require the same amount of material that was placed into the smeltery. The Casting Table will allow you to create casts out of Gold to create other metal items using the casts you have previously made.
Example of a basic Smeltery setup:
Oh, one more thing. As long as you don't break the Smeltery's controller, you can modify the structure without loosing the molten liquids inside of it.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.20.title: Fantastic Foundry
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.20.subti: Smelting, now on another level. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.20.descr: The Foundry is a multiblock structure which can be used to smelt large quantities of metals and materials.
It will NOT allow the materials inside of it to form alloys, so some of you might find this to be useful.
It will extract byproducts from each ore. For example, smelting ore, will give you some gold.
Can smelt items/blocks in their original materials, for example, it can smelt upgrades to get back all the materials that went in their production.
Has a larger capacity then the Smeltery.
The Foundry must be made out of Scorched tier blocks. Its floor cannot be made of glass. It cannot be made in an \"L\" shape and must have edges and corners in order to function correctly.
Its maximum size can be 16x16x65 external, and 14x14x64 internal.
Example of a simple Foundry setup:
The Foundry's GUI is the same as the Smeltery's.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.21.title: Flowing Scorched Stone
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.21.subti: Molten Scorched Stone will be required to obtain Blast Bricks
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.21.tasks: Finish this quest DOES NOT mean you did what you had to!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.22.title: Making Nether Grout
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.22.subti: I am Groot! But from The Nether. This is the Nether version of the Grout. It will be used to obtain Scoarched Stone in general. This material will be used to make advanced Tinkers Construct machines and it can be obtained by reaching the Nether, gathering Blaze Powder, and making Magma Cream. See all the dependencies of this quest, to see how you can reach the Nether
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.23.title: Raising the temperature!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.23.subti: Upgraded fuels. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.23.descr: While solid fuels are easy to use, they will quickly prove to be ineficient when it comes to the temperature they produce.
Higher temperatures are required for smelting certain metals/materials for creating advanced alloys.
Keep in mind that this quest is here just to keep track of what you need to do, finishing it doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.24.title: Alloyer!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.24.subti: Alloys, now in a different way. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.24.descr: The Alloyer came as a solution for the Foundy's lack of alloying capabilities.
The Alloyer can accept 4 Ingot Tanks on its sides. These tanks can be filled with molten metal/material to be proccessed into powerful alloys.

The Alloyer also need some type of liquid fuel, either Lava or Blazing Blood. This fuel needs to be placed a Fuel Tank, under the Alloyer. The type of fuel used, will affect the alloys you can make. Blazing Blood will allow you to obtain stronger alloys, but unfortunately, you don't have access to it at the moment, so you'll have to use Lava and weaker alloys.
Example of an Alloyer setup with three Smelteries:
Keep in mind that you might want to make multiple Alloyers for all the alloys you plan on mass producing, as you might find it difficult to produce two or more alloys in the same Alloyer.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.25.title: Molten Obsidian
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.25.subti: Obtain Molten Obsidian to make the Alloyer and the Foundry!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.25.tasks: Finishing this quest, does not mean you did what you had to!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.26.title: Advanced Casting
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.26.subti: Gold Cast are upgraded versions of the regular Sand Casts. Unlike their Sand sounterparts, these ones will last forever
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.27.title: Crafting Table MkII
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.27.subti: Crafting is now upgraded. The Crafting Station can hold items, rather then returning them to your inventory
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.28.title: Rats can bring good things too
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.28.descr: Ok, you've got the cheese, now what? Well, now comes the rat taming part.
\"But hey! Crazy Decursio Guys, why on Earth would I tame a rat? Aren't they dangerous?\"

Well, some of them, yeah, but some can be quite useful. Rats can spawn in the world like any hostile mobs, and some of them carry a deadly pleague, but some DON'T. You want those which do not have the plague. Why? Here comes the funny part.

After dropping cheese (yes, drop, not right click) to a rat, and taming it, you should have access to its inventory by Right-Clicking it. Here, you'll be able to set it into different modes. Now, before actually starting to use your Rats to automate things, know that there's one more thing you'll have to do. The newly tamed Rats, will need a small amount of Blood in order to perform all of their actions. To get that small amount of Blood, set them in the `Hunt Animals` mode and allow them to hit a Mob once. After that, they'll be able to perform all of the actions you'll set them to perform. Make sure you head over to `The Staffs of RAT POWER!` quest, in the `Useful Items - 1` tab, to learn more about how you can control your Rats.
Plagued rats cannot be tamed and will give you the plague effect which will not allow you to regenerate in any way/shape/form. Be careful while dealing with them, you've been warned.
Ps: Tamed rats can sit on your head which makes them even cuter then they already are. Just shift right-click them. To get them down, shift left-click the air.
Ps2: If you're having issues finding any rats, check the \"Trash can\" quest in the \"Overworld\" tab.

Ps3: Note that, there might be some instances where your Rats might look like they're not doing anything. In that case, you might wanna check and see if there's something that might interfere with your Rat. For example, you might set them in the `Harvest` mode, and see them stading still and not doing anything. That might happen because they might be targeting a pieace of Grass, or a Flower that's out of their reach.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.28.tasks: Tame a rat by dropping cheese to it
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.29.title: Copper and Tin
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.29.subti: Obtain these two basic metals to get out of the Stone Age. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.29.descr: In The Decurio Project, ore gen is provided by Emendatus Enigmatica.
This means that the most majority of the ores in the game, will be from this mod. This also includes the vanilla ores.

A major difference between the usual ores and the ones added by this mod is that, when you break them, you'll receive a chunk istead of the ore itself. However, don't worry, the chunks will act similarly to the ore, and if that doesn't cut it for you, then you can always turn the chunks back to their ore version. Just place a chunk in the crafting grid.
Example of how Emendatus Enigmatica ores can look:
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.30.title: Ready for the cheese? Guess not.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.30.subti: Obtain milk from a cow to start making cheese. Its uses will later be revealed to you
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.31.subti: Creamy? Neh, more like stinky. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.31.descr: Ok, if you're reading this, it means that you're still with us, which is great. Let's jump to the subject here, the cheese.
Cheese will be important for several reasons, the most important being, rats.
Theese tiny creatures like the smell and taste of this milky byproduct and can be tamed using it.
To make Cheese, you'll have to place 1 bucket of Vinegar into a Fermentation Barrel filled with Milk. After 2 MC days, you'll obtain 16 Cheese pieces.
Special thanks to Jen_Jenn for suggesting Rats for this pack.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.32.title: Training was never easier
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.32.subti: Give upgrades to a rat to make it do awesome things! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.32.descr: Each rat has only three upgrade slots in which you can place upgrades. Each upgrade will enhance or give the rat, new abilities. Rats can perform auto-crafting, crop harvesting, item transportation, fishing and much more.
This is the base upgrade. It will not apply any bonuses to your rat, but is the main ingredient in every upgrade recipe.
To learn more about different upgrades, check the \"Useful Items Tab\".
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.33.title: Remy's less gastronomical relative
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.33.subti: Cut, polish and repeat! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.33.descr: This upgrade will allow a rat to refine coal into some tiny squishy balls. These might come in handy later.
Note that, you Rat CANNOT be in 'Stay Here' mode to produce the Squash Balls.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.34.title: The Squishy Reagent
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.34.subti: These rat-made balls will act as a perfect reagent for mixing Nether Grout
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.35.subti: The Scoarched Bricks will be used to obtain The Foundry
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.36.subti: The Scoarched Stone will be used to obtain The Alloyer
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.37.title: Strange Alien Artifacts
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.37.subti: These might have a use later. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.37.descr: Throughout your journey you might find some strange meteors throughout the world.

While they might not look like something very important, you should know that, inside of them, usually, you can find a Skystone Chest. Inside it, you'll find some strange artifacts. While you have no idea how to use them, or what to do with them yet, know that you'll need them at a point, so it might be a good idea to go hunting for them now.
After finding a Meteor in the world, know that you'll need a Diamond-level pick to break through the Skystone.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.38.title: Clay Tools 101
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.38.subti: \"It's Clay Tech; You like it?\" Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.38.descr: Considering the fact that you're basically just a Cavemen, the most advanced form of technology available to you at the moment, will be, well.. clay. Vessels, buckets, shears, and even armor can be made from this.
Let's breafly cover each one of them.
The Clay Vessel has mainly two uses. It can either be cooked to obtain a solid Container, or it can be used to smelt soft ores, such as Lead and Gold. It can even be used to make Bronze.
The Clay Bucket can be cooked to obtain a Terracotta version of it, which will allow you to carry liquids.
And finally, the Clay Shears Parts can be also be cooked to make Ceramic Shears Parts which can be crafted into some neat Ceramic Shears.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.39.title: Ceramic Tools 107
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.39.subti: Initial utilities for every Cavemen. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.39.descr: Let's cover some very basic, yet very useful items.
Since you don't have access to advanced storage options, or to iron, you might be interested in these items. Or not, you do you.

Until you are able to get chests, you'll have to rely on other storage options. Here you have your first one. The Ceramic Vessel has 9 storage slots, perfect for storing initial items. It can also act as a backpack, since it will keep its contents when is picked up.

If you're interested in transporting liquids in the beginning, then you might wanna get your hands on the Clay Bucket. This thing is mostly a vanilla Bucket, but with the added disadvantage of not being able to carry hot liquids properly. You can, tho, use it to carry hot liquids once, before it breaks.
Lastly, let's talk about the Ceramic Shears. These will be just like a regular set of Shears, but they'll have less durability overall.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.40.subti: Clay is a very versatile resource, which can be molded into lots of things. Make sure you obtain a fair amount of it
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.41.title: Welcome to The Bronze Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.41.subti: Since stones don't last forever, greater materials will be required to advance. Combine 3 Copper Chunks with 1 Tin Chunk in a Clay Vessel to obtain Bronze and enter into The Bronze Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.42.title: Welcome to the Stone Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.42.subti: Sticks, stones, dirt, gravel and clay. Every individual has to learn how to use these before any other complex form of technology is available. For now, search for some Gravel and break it to obtain Flint
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.43.title: The Iron Age is Real!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.43.subti: Welcome to the Iron Age where you can finally understand how this strong metal works and how you can manipulate it to your advantage
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.43.tasks: Break the finished Bloom with a Pickaxe
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.43.rewar: Learn how to use Iron and Furnaces!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.44.title: Bronze Tools
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.44.subti: Not only are more durable, but they'll also allow you to obtain Iron Chunks, Silver, Gold and Redstone! Unfortunately, Coal will still NOT be available, but you'll manage. Make the Bronze Tools to advance further
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.45.subti: In this form, it won't be very helpful. The Iron Chunk have to be crushed into Iron Dust using a Mill Stone. The Dust will eventually be processed in a Bloomery to obtain Iron Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.46.title: The Bloomery
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.46.subti: Getting into some serious matters. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.46.descr: A Bloomery is a type of metallurgical furnace once used widely for smelting Iron from its oxides. The Bloomery was the earliest form of smelter capable of smelting Iron.

To build the Bloomery, just make a 1 or 2 block tall chimney out of Sandy Bricks with a Tuyere block on the bottom layer and two Bellows pointing into it. The block at the very bottom of the structure has to be a Bloomery Block.

To start producing Iron Ingots using the Bloomery, you'll need to obtain Iron Dust from Iron Chunks. Shift Right-Clicking the Bloomery Block at the bottom with an Iron Dust, will start making an Iron Pyle. Just Right-Click the Iron Pyle to add more Dust. When no more Dust can be added, start adding Charcoal. When Charcoal cannot be added anymore, return to adding Iron Dust. Finally, using a Fire Starter, light up the Iron Pyle in the Bloomery.

Once you light it, pump the Bellows to stoke the fire. You don't need to pump them the entire time. Pumping them in tandem, will fill the buffer faster. Once it's done, in about 4 MC hours, work the bloom (break it with a pickaxe multiple times) with a Pickaxe until it drops 8 Iron Ingots. If you let it cool, or don't pump the Bellows enough, it will fail and you will have to start over. Don't worry about loosing your resources if the smelting process fails. You'll get a Failed/Cooled Bloom which can later be smelted back into 8 Iron Ingots in a Blast Furnace.
Important 1: You'll need 8 Iron Dusts to actually start producing Iron Ingots with this structure!

Important 2: Ignore what the OneProbe says about the fire being fully GROWN. That information is there because of how the Bloomery was codded. Just keep pumping that Bellows until the fire disappears and you get a Magma-like block in the Bloomery.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.47.title: Boosting the Flames
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.47.subti: The Bellows will be a part of the Bloomery structure which will be used to obtain Iron Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.48.title: Pristine Leather ♥
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.48.subti: By leaving 1 Wet Tanned Hide on a Drying Rack for a quarter of an MC Day, you can get regular, vanilla Leather
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.49.title: The Charcoal Pit
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.49.subti: Can't get Coal? Charcoal is better anyways. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.49.descr: Certain processes such as the smelting of soft Ores, such as Copper, or Harder Ores, such as Iron, will require a more stronger Fuel. Since Wood won't cut it, the best bet will be regular Coal, right? Wrong. At this point, you don't really have access to regular Coal, so what options do you have?
Well, you can explore the World and hope to find some regular Coal, or you can start producing Charcoal.
While, regularly you would just place some Logs in a Furnace and obtain Charcoal, things will be more complicated here. You'll have to build a Charcoal Pit. Don't worry, it will not be very hard.

Charcoal Pits are kind of modular. This means that you can make them as large, or as small as you want. To actually build the Pit, you'll need Log Piles. You can have as many as you want. Dig a hole in the ground and place your Log Piles in it. After that, just cover the Piles with dirt, but let one of them, exposed. Now use a Fire Starter on the exposed Log Pile and light it up. After the Pile is ignited, cover it with Dirt. Smoke particles should come from the Pit, indicating that the process of making Charcoal has started.

After 18 MC hours, the smoke particles will dissappear, indicating that you Charcoal is ready. Remove the Dirt from the top of the Pit and dig your Charcoal with a Shovel. You'll also receive Ash as a byproduct. It can be used to make Bone Meal.
Example of Charcoal Pit ready to be fired:
Example of a Charcoal Pit running:
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.50.title: Cavemen Stations
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.50.subti: Build a Basin, a Mill and a Rack to progress further. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.50.descr: Nothing too complicated regarding the crafting process of these working stations. Something we want to clarify would be the fact that you should search for Andesite/Granite/Diorite, or any other type of Stone, instead of trying to cook your own, to make these things.
Also, you'll have to start a farm of Industrial Hemp in order to obtain the Canvas Required for the Drying Rack.
Now, let's talk about each one of these quickly.

The MillStone will allow you to grind some items into basic initial resources required to progress further. Just Right-Click to place the inputs in, Right-Click again on the handle to start grinding. The output will be dropped on the ground. Shift Right-Click will remove the items present in its inventory.

The Wooden Basin will be used to mix up items with a liquids to combine them properly. It will be used to produce Leather. It can also be used to make Bread and more. It can accept 4 items. Liquids can be inserted with Clay Channels for automation. Outputs will be dropped on the ground.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.51.title: The Pit/Ore Kiln
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.51.subti: Primitive Cooking is a thing. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.51.descr: The Pit Kiln is a primitive form of firing pottery. Since you don't have access to any type of advanced heating methods (camp fires don't count and even if you manage to find a Furnace in the world, you won't be able to use it), you'll have to make a Pit Kiln to progress further.
Pit Kilns can cook lots of clay items. By pressing \"U\" on a piece of Straw from the Charcoal Pit mod, you can see all the possible recipes.
Let's see how to build one of these things:

First, dig a 1x1x1 hole in the ground and Shift Right-Click the bottom on the hole with some Clay items. Usually you can place up to 8 Clay items, but some of them will be limited to 1. This includes the Clay Vessel.
Second, take 6 pieces of Straw and Right-Click with them on the Clay item located at the buttom. After that, do the same with 3 Logs.
Finally, Right-Click the block created with a Fire Starter to to light it up.
After 8 MC hours, your Clay item will be ready to be picked up with some Ash as a byproduct. The Ash can be used to make Fertilizer.
Example of a Pit ready to be set on fire:
Example of a Pit which is done cooking and ready to be harvested:

Lastly, we want to let you know that, by using the Pit Kiln, you can also process some ores. Just Right-Click a Clay Vessel to open its GUI. Here you'll have to place Ore Chunks and Fuel, in the form of Charcoal. Coal can also be used, but you can obtain it only from Loot Chests for now, so better stick to using Charcoal. Wait, you can't get Charcoal? Wrong. Check 'The Charcoal Pit' quest.

After filling the Vessel, you can place your curson on it to see the tooltip which will tell you what you'll receive and the amount of Fuel present/required in the Vessel. If not enough Fuel is present, you won't be able to place it down, to fire it.
You can also combine the Ore Chunks in the Vessel to obtain alloys. Do not try to fire a Vessel with invalid metal ratios, as it will result in a total loss of all of your resources.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.52.subti: By combining 1 Cow Hide with 1 Salt and 1000 mb of Water in a Wooden Basin, you can obtain the Salted Hide, which will represent the first stage of the Leather making process
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.53.subti: Dried Hide is obtained by leaving 1 Salted Hide on a Drying Rack for a half of an MC Day. This will represent the second stage of the Leather making process
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.54.title: Wet Tanned Hide
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.54.subti: The Wet Tanned Hide will be the third stage of the Leather making process. To obtain it, you'll have to make Bark Resin which is obtained by crushing 10 pieces of Bark in a Stone Mill. The Resin will be combined with Water and Dried Hide in a Wooden Basin, resulting into the Wet Tanned Hide
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.55.subti: Make 5 Pattern to enter in Tinker's Construct and become a true Tinkerer
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.56.title: Time is the Key
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.56.subti: A Fermentation Barrel will allow you to obtain Alcohol and Vinegar, two essential ingredients in the process of making Cheese. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.56.descr: In this pack, Cheese will be an important item. Through your journey, you'll discover better ways of producing it, but for now, you'll use the Fermentation Barrel.

This thing will take water and a some fruits/grains and turn them into Alcohol. 16 Water buckets and one stack of Fruits will be turned into 16 buckets of Alcohol. This can either be consumed with a glass bottle for some unique effects, or can be turned into Vinegar.
Vinegar can be obtained by placing Fruits into an Alcohol filled Fermentation Barrel. So. Water + 2 stacks of Fruits will get you Vinegar.
One Bucket of Vinegar can turn 16 buckets of Milk into 16 Cheese pieces.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.57.title: Fruit => Alcohol => Vinegar
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.57.subti: The next step in the Human Evolution will be Alcohol. Use JEI to see the uses of a Fermentation Barrel and figure out, what tipes of Alcohol you can make. After that, you'll have to use one stack of Fruits to turn 16 Alcohol buckets into 16 Vinegar buckets. This whole process will take about 4 MC days, so start working on it. Note: ONLY the Vinegar recipe shown by JEI is inaccurate! Also, by typing \"$fruits\" in JEI, you should see all the items that will turn alcohol into Vinegar
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.58.subti: This paste can be used to build Brick Blocks. It can also be used by certain Building Gadgets to create visual replacements for certain blocks. This feature will be available starting with the 3rd Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.59.title: Sandy Bricks for HEAT
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.59.subti: The Sandy Bricks are capable of withstanding large amounts of heat. Due to this property, they're perfect for processing Iron into Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.60.subti: A very imporant material you're gonna need in your journey, will be Leather. However, unlike a vanilla experiance, this will not be easy to obtain. Leather has to be processed out of Cow Hide which can be obtained only from.. well.. Cows (not really). So yeah, good luck starting a Farm
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.61.title: Canvas
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.61.subti: The Canvas will be required to build a Drying Rack which will help you progress further. It also has some other uses, including storage options. Make it with some Straw and some Hemp Fibers which can be harvested from Industrial Hemps. Break some Grass to obtain Hemp seeds
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.62.subti: The Dense Construction Block will be used to obtain Construction Paste. It is made by placing a Construction Block Powder in water and waiting a few seconds for it convert. The conversion is not instantaneous like it is with the vanilla Concrete. It can also be made in a Wooden Basin
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.63.subti: Made out of Sand, Clay and Lapis Dust, the Construction Block Powder, can be turned into a very dense block, perfect for producing Construction Paste
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.64.title: Initial Dynamics
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.64.subti: Liquids will be a valuable resource even in the beginning, so you should be able to work with them properly. A Cistern will allow you to store liquids. A Channel will allow you to transport liquids and, finally, a Faucet will allow you to extract liquids
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.65.title: Ceramics provide Liquid Manipulation
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.65.subti: Let's put these babies to good use! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.65.descr: These three items will allow you to access liquid manipulation early in the game, so let's cover each one of them.

The Ceramic Cistern can be used as a Liquid Tank, but only for Cool Liquids, such as Water, Milk, Vinegar, etc. It can also store Hot Liquids, such as Lava, but it will take constant damage over time, until it breaks and all of its contents will be placed in world. It is also not portable and it will loose all of its contents when picked up. Cracked Cisterns can also be picked up. They'll be damaged and fixed in your Crafting Grid with some Clay.

A Cistern can hold 4 Buckets of liquid. It can also be vertically extended with more Cirsterns. This works only with Cisterns of the same color, so, for example, an Orange Cistern CANNOT extend a Green Cistern. You can use this behavior in your advantage.

Now, let's talk about Faucets. These can be used to extract liquids from Cisterns and other Drains, for example, those present in Tinker's Construct. When it's connected to a Cistern, it can extract the liquid present in it by simply right-clicking it. It can also receive a Redstone Signal to output fluids automatically.
