Faucets can be placed anywhere on a Cistern. The amount of fluid present, won't interfere with the position of the Faucet.

Finally, let's talk about Channels. If you're familiar with Tinker's Construct, these are exactly like the Seared, or the Scorched Channels present there, with the exception of not being able to transport hot fluids without taking damage.

However, if you're not familiar with Tinker's Construct, know that these things are used to transport liquids around. They can also insert liquids into other Cisterns, or other 'machines' or working stations, but they CANNOT be used to extract from them. In this case, they have to be used in combination with a Faucet.

Channels are a bit tricky to handle as they'll often not allow liquids to flow properly and you'll have no idea why is that happening. The answear is quite simple. You can adjust their flowing direction by Right-Clicking, or Shift Right-Clicking, depending on which side you wish to configure. Their texture will help you figure out in which way they'll allow liquids to pass, as they have some little 'arrows' drawn on them.
Example of two Channels flowing in opposite directions:
In the example shown above, the Channel on the right side will allow liquids to go back, while the Channel on the left side will allow liquids to go forward.
With Right-Click you can even disconnect them from pretty much anything, including themselves.

Liquids can even be transported downwards. By placing Channels over each other, you can configure them (by Right-Clicking from bellow) to transfer their contents from the one located above, to the one located below.
Example of two Channels ready to flow into each other:
Notice how the Channel present above has a small opening which will allow liquids to flow down.
Finally, we want to show you a small setup which will take water from a Cistern and place it in a Wooden Basin:
Notice how all the tiny 'arrows' on the Channels are pointing towards the Wooden Basin.
Channels can also make turns to right or left, but unfortunately, they cannot go upwards.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.66.title: Tinker's Upgrades
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.66.subti: Making that Pick, worthy. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.66.descr: Tinker's Construct is a mod focused around modularity. This means that most of your gear can be upgraded/augmented/modified to suit your needs.
Now, we'd suggest checking the 'Encyclopedia of Tinkering' to fully understand Tinker's Construct and all of it's features, but we'll also try to briefly explain some of the upgrade mechanics.

Tinkers Construct has mainly 2 types of modifications. These include Upgrades and Abilities. Upgrades are modifications which usually boost the stats already present on a Tool. Abilities are modifiers which provide unique traits to your Tools; think of them as Enchantments. These can allow you to Dual Wield Weapons, Breath Underwater and more.

Each Tool/Piece of Equipment added by this mod has a limited total number of Upgrade and Ability slots. The number of available Upgrades and Abilities can be increased through certain ways. These include &aDragon Heads, Music Disks, Skulls, End Crystals, Book and Quill&r and they have to be applied to your Tool/Armor at a Tinker's Station, or a Tinker's Anvil.
The Upgrades and Abilities previously mentioned, are further organized in more categories:

- General: These are Upgrades/Abilities which are effective on multiple types of tools, including Melee Weapons, Harvest Tools, along with Armor. There are also some Upgrades/Abilities which are only available to Melee Weapons and Havest Tools, so make sure to check JEI and the Encyclopedia of Tinkering to find out more.

- Weapon: These are Upgrades/Abilities that are most effective on Melee Weapons, whether it is a Sword, or a repurposed Harvest Tool. Many of these upgrades can also be applied to Chestplates, but there's a catch. That Chestplate needs the 'Unarmed' Ability.
- Harvest: These are Upgrades/Abilities that are effective mostly on Harvest Tools, such as Pickaxes, Axes and more.

- Armor: These are Upgrades/Abilities which are typically effective on a single type of Armor or are desinged to run on counter attacks. These mainly include things like Aqua Affinity, Double Jump, Zoom and more.

Finally, we've covered the Upgrades and the Abilities. Now, let's cover the Defense Upgrades. These are special Upgrades dedicated to Armor Pieces. They include things such as Dedicated Protection, for example, Blast Protection, Knockback Resistance, Gold for walking past Piglins, and more. Note that more Defense Slots CANNOT be added, so you'll have to change the type of Armor you want to use, as each set of Armor added by Tinker's Construct has different amounts of slots.
Oh, and one more word of advice. If you're interested in upgrading your Armor with general Protection, then you have to use a Diamond which, luckly, is considered to be a General Upgrade.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.67.subti: Obtain your first Iron Ingots and start building powerful and useful machines/gadgets/contraptions
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.68.title: Getting Treated Wood!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.68.subti: Oh, you want your precious chests.. I see..oh, and the tools too, yeah.. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.68.descr: In The Decursio Project the recipes for chests and tools have been altered. To obtain these precious vanilla items, you'll need treated wood.
Finishing this quest will allow you to place and use basic storage options.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_1.quests.68.rewar: Learn to make and use advanced storage and regular tools! Discover Colonies!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.title: Gear - 2
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.0.subtit: Great, you're still with us. Congrats for reaching the 2nd Age. Just four more to go. This Age's tech phase will start with the Andeside Alloy, which will be used throughout the Create mod to make amazing contraptions
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.1.title: WaterPower
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.1.subtit: A Water Wheel can provide a maximum amount of 144 SU. That amount can be used when SoulSand is used to make the Water flow faster on the Wheel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.2.title: Fire-Power..?
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.2.subtit: An Encased Fan placed above a heat source such as a camp fire, can provide 64 SU. Use that wisely
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.3.title: Working with Rotational Force
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.3.subtit: These items are used to transfer and manipulate Rotational Force for powering contraptions. Ps: You'll need lots of gearboxes
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.4.subtit: A Mechanical Mixer placed 2 blocks above a Basin allows for blending a variety of items together. Some recipes may require heat
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.5.title: Depots are useful too!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.5.subtit: Depots can be used for general automation. For example, it can be used for automating processes like crafting Polished Rose Quartz
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.6.subtit: A Blaze Burner can act as a perfect heat source for a Basin. It has 2 modes: Heated and Super-Heated. When it is fed with Coal or any other regular fuel, it will become Heated and will allow a Basin to smelt Ores and perform other processes. In the Super-Heated state, which can be achieved by feeding the Blaze Burner with a Blaze Cake, you'll be able to make more advanced recipes, such as the one for the Chromatic Compound
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.7.title: The Golden Alloy
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.7.subtit: Brass is an essential alloy in any adventurer's journey. Initially, you'll have to make it in a basin using copper, zinc and the heat of a Blaze Burner, but you'll have faster ways of obtaining it later down the road
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.8.subtit: A Rolling Mill can be used to create metal rods and wires using Rotational Force
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.9.subtit: The fun begins here. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.9.descri: Besides their usege for autocrafting, an array of Mechanical Crafters will allow for crafting recipes that are not available in a standard 3x3 grid.
Until starting to use Mechanical Crafters, you should know two things:

First: If there are empty Crafters in your Array, the recipe won't be created. You'll have to provide a redstone pulse to the array. If providing a pulse is impossible, you can use Crafter Slot Covers for the empty slots, instead.

Second: For the array to operate, the crafter's paths will have to meet in one point. You can change the orentation of your crafters, using a wrench from Create. You can see an example of this below. The cyan square represents the crafter which will output the recipe's result:
If the information provided here is not clear, you can always hold \"W\" on a Mechanical Crafter in JEI to learn more.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.10.title: The Alternating Dynamo
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.10.subti: This is a major milestone! You've discovered a way to convert Rotational Energy into electricity! However, the Alternating Dynamo is a pretty primitive way of obtaining electricity, so it might be necessary to make more then one of these to power your machines, as it has a maximum output of 128 RF/tick and that will be achieved by constantly consuming 4,096 SU
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.11.title: Multiplying Ores - Part 2
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.11.subti: Crushing Wheels can be used to crush ores, allowing for a even larger output
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.12.title: Alloying!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.12.subti: Mechanical Alloys. Left Click for more Info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.12.descr: While the Smeltery, the Alloyer and a Heated Basin are not capable of producing alloys such as Invar or Electrum, the Kiln is.
Create it by right clicking a 2x2x2 cube of Kiln Bricks with an Engineer's Hammer.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.13.title: Capacitors
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.13.subti: Energy currently generates far too slowly to just be wasted. A Capacitor will allow you to store excess energy. These capacitors can hold 100k, 1M and 4M RF and are entirely made in a Crafting Table. Additionally, they're kinda cheaper
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.14.title: Manipulating Electricity
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.14.subti: Electricity needs a way to be transferred. These should get the job done. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.14.descr: If you're reading this, then, CONGRATS! You're about to start working with electricity.
In the future, there will be more ways to transfer power between your machines, but for now, you'll be using Immersive's power transfer system.
This system has, mainly, three items:
Connectors are placed either on a machine's imput/output and they're used to insert/extract power. Connectors CANNOT be used to connect multiple cables.

Relays are used to connect multiple wires. Let's say you want to connect multiple power sources to one concentrated point. You'll have to use Connectors to extract your power, connect them to a relay and only after that, use another Connector to power a machine. Relays are useful for concentrating power into some form of storage, such as a Capacitor. Keep in mind that a Relay CANNOT insert/extract power, tho.
Wires are used to connect relays and connectors. They'll basically transfer your power.
Now, that we've talked about Immersive power systems basics, let's talk about some advanced mechanics. This power system has three power tiers:
This quest requires the elements for the LV tier. This tier's Connectors can input only 256 RF/tick and its wires can transfter only 512 RF/tick. Higher tiers will output more power.

However, making more power will come at a cost, tho. You'll have to convert your power, so that you don't burn your wires. A HV Transformer will be required to convert the HV tier into a MV tier. Further, you can use a regular Transformer to convert the MV tier into an LV one.
Lastly, note that wires can be isolated. A wire without isolation, will give you damage based on its tier, so be careful.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.15.subti: While electricity is good and all, sometimes you need Rotational Force. This Electric Motor acts as a way to convery FE to Rotational Force
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.16.subti: Precision Mechanisms are a common ingredient in the creation of more powerful electronics and computing devices. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.16.descr: The Precision Mechanism is a component added by Create. It is used in lots of recipes and it is important to obtain a fair number of them, so let's see how you can get it.
This thing is made through Create's Sequenced Assembly which is a very complex, interesting and fun crafting process.
You'll basically have to build a production line with Mechanical Belts and the machines requested by JEI. In the case of the Precision Mecanism, you'll need 3 Deployers.

To start the Sequenced Assembly, you'll have to place the Deployers along side the Mechanical Belt, they can be placed pretty much anywhere as long as they can interract with the Mechanical Belt. Drop a Gold Plate on the Belt and make sure that the Deployers have the requested items ready. After the plate passes through all the Deployers, you can pick it up and place it back to the start of the line, for 5 times, until you get the Precision Mechanism. You can also build your system in a way which would allow for total automation.
Here's a lame example of a Sequenced Assembly Line:
Notice that the example shown above is soo lame that it is not capable of producing Precision Mechanisms fully automatically.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.17.subti: Computers can be programmed to suit your needs. While an explanation is outside the scope of this book, try doing some research on \"ComputerCraft\"
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.18.title: Becoming a Basic Engineer
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.18.subti: The Engineering Blocks you've just obtained, will allow you to build massive multiblock machines which are capable of executing complex tasks at the cost of some RF
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.19.title: When tech meets magic!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.19.subti: Unlocking PSI. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.19.descr: Psi is a mod focused on spells and how you're gonna cast them.
Psi allows you to make your own spells and the limits are represented only by your imagination and, of course, ingenuity.
Firstly, keep in mind that this pack uses Magical Psi to make this mod look and feel a little more mystically, rather then technically.

The Rod Constructor will be the place where you can assemble your wands. Wands are able to cast spells based on their components. A wand with powerful parts will be able to cast, pretty much, any spell, but a wand with weak parts, will be limited in terms of what spells it can cast.
To start making spells, check the \"Spell Casting: Part 1\" quest in the \"Arcane - 2\" tab.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.20.title: Hello, Bitumen!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.20.subti: Bitumen can be obtained by feeding Crude Oil (obtainted from a Pumpjack) into a Distillation Tower
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.21.title: The Lightning Rod
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.21.subti: A Lightning Rod will, during a thunderstorm, produce large amounts of FE. However, it is inconsistent, so make sure you have a large array of Capacitors for it to feed into
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.22.title: Multiplying Ores - Part 3
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.22.subti: Crushing, now with RF. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.22.descr: The Crusher can turn ores into a fine powder, better than a pair of Crushing Wheels can, of course, at the cost of some RF. This can be a valuable ingredient in later recipes.
To build this structure, use the guide provided in the Engineer's Manual. You can also use a projector to see the structure in the world.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.23.title: Heavy Engineering Block
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.23.subti: Heavy Engineering Blocks are used to construct even larger machines
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.24.subti: A Harvester can be attached to a contraption to automatically harvest crops as it runs over them. A good start would be attaching these to blocks rotated around a Radial Chassis
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.25.title: Understanding Create a bit
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.25.subti: Create is, truly, an amazing mod. Let's tell you a thing, or two about it. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.25.descr: Create can be praised for a lot of reasons, starting from its beautiful animations and  its overall unique vibe and premise, but one of the best features it has it's the way it teaches you how to use it.

Unlike other mods which are trying to give you an explanation of how to use them through a book (there's nothing wrong with this, of course), Create tries to make things more simpler, fun and easier to understand through an animated in-game guide.
Almost every element/machine added by the Create mod has an animated guide which can be accessed by hovering over an item with your cursor and holding the \"w\" key.
Given the fact that this feature is present here, we'll try to spend less time explaining what the mod can do. So yeah, have fun playing with, and discovering, Create.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.26.subti: The Machanical Saw can be used for automatization in wood farms, processing factories and mob farms (for items)
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.27.subti: The Plough can be used to harvest blocks which don't have a solid collision hitbox (block which you can go through, such as the torch). It will create farmland. It is also great for launching entities without damaging them!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.28.subti: The Mechanical Drill will break blocks placed infront of them. Maybe combining them with some deployers and a minecart might serve as a great mining rig
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.29.subti: The Deployer will be required in the process of Sequenced Assembly, which will give you the precision mechanism
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.30.title: Multiplying Ores - Part 1
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.30.subti: The millstone can be used to crush ores in order to increase their output
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.31.subti: The Charging Station can be used to transfer power to your precious items. You may use it to power the Railgun
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.32.subti: Belts can be used to transport items and transfer rotational force
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.33.title: Fluid Transportation
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.33.subti: Pipes can be used to transport liquids. However, to force output a liquid, you'll need a pump
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.34.subti: Hot and tasty: The Blaze Cake can be fed to a Blaze Burner to make it Super-Heated
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.35.subti: You can almost see The Big Bang in it. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.35.descr: A Refined Radiance can be obtained by exposing the Chromatic Compound to large amounts of light. There are multiple ways to do this.
One is by throwing the compound into the beam of a Beacon. However, this is not possible right now, so we're moving on to the next way.

So. The next way involves light source blocks (torches, lanters, glowstone, jack o' lanters and so on). Throw the Compound on the ground and then, place a light source next to it. The Compound will start to absorb the light and eventually, it will break the light source. Picking up the Compound before it was transformed, will NOT interrupt the transmutation process.
You'll need a lot of Torches or Glowstone.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.36.subti: Trains in Minecraft? Never! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.36.descr: The Cart Assambler can be used to make contraptions with a minecart. For example, you can attach to a minecart a mechanical saw, a deployer and a chest, to make a contraption for an automated wood farm.

This Assembler will allow you to attach structures to passign minecarts. The Assembler has to be placed on a rails and has to be powered with redstone to work properly. When a minecart passes throw it, any structure you've built above the assembler will be connected to the minecart. If the cart passes through the Assembler again, but no redstone signal is provided, the structure will be dettached from the minecart.
Keep in mind that The Cart Assembler will NOT allow you to move spawners.
Finally, after building a minecart contraption, you can use a wrench from Create to move the contraption without any problems.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.37.subti: A Mechanical Press placed 2 blocks above a Depot allows you to turn Ingots into Plates. You'll use them in lots of things
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.38.title: Basins are useful!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.38.subti: A Basin can either be used for crafting blocks or for mixing alloys such as Brass
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.39.title: Blazing Blood
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.39.subti: Blazing Blood can be made by smelting, either a blaze mesh or a blaze head. You'll need this hot fuel to further upgrade your tinker tools
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.39.descr: Special thanks to Reiki133 for suggesting this idea for the pack.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.40.title: The Coker
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.40.subti: Great, you've got Bitumen, now you have to process it further. To do so, you'll have to make The Coker. A projector is adviced for building this structure. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.40.descr: The Coker is a HUGE multiblock structure which is used to process Bitumen, further into PetCoke.
The Coker will have to be provided with RF. Water and Bitumen must be inserted into the tower. PetCoke will be made after the cracking temperature for Bitumen, has been reached.
Water can be automatically inserted through the back of the structure. Same goes with the Bitumen. The Petcoke will have its output in the structure's middle chutes.
1024 RF/tick will need to be provided to the tower through the three back slots.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.41.title: Welcome, Petcoke!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.41.subti: Petcoke can be obtained by refining Bitumen in a Coker. Required to unlock the 3rd Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.42.title: May Valve Have Mercy On You!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.42.subti: Well, reaching this point was inevitable. As an advanced tinkerer, you can't make amazing contraptions with just 144 SU. So that's where this new setup comes in. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.42.descr: Let's get straight into the root of the problem. What are these machines and how do you use them? Long story short, these machines will allow you to make an SU generator that uses the power of Steam.
Let's see what each machine does here:
- The Cast Iron Burning Chamber will take items such as Wood/Coal/Kelp Blocks and it will use them as fuel to generate Heat (HU).

- The Cast Iron Boiler will be placed above the Burning Chamber and it has to be provided with Water. It will take the HU generated by the Burning Chamber and it will produce a total amount of 138mb of Steam/tick.
- The Cast Iron Steam Engine will take the Steam produced by the Boiler and it will turn it into SU.
- The Cast Iron Flywheel will take the SU generated by the Steam Engine and it will turn it into Rotational Force which you can use in Create.

This setup will generate 138mb of Steam/t. It will consume 32mb of Steam/t (per Engine+Flywheel). A Flywheel will generate 8,192 SU. This means you'll be able power 4 Engines with 1 Boiler and, eventually, get around 32,000 SU with 4 Steam Engines and 4 Flywheels.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.43.title: PumpJack
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.43.subti: Old mcJack had a PUMP! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.43.descr: The Pumpjack is a multiblock structure that extracts Crude Oil from deposits situated undeground. As always, you'll need the engineers hammer to finalize this structure.
The Structure uses 512 RF/tick to pump oil at the rate of 15 mb/tick. The produced oil is automatically ejected throught the two side ports with orange dots.
Like the other machines, applying a redstone signal to the machine's redstone control panel, you can halt the machine's process. Using a screwdriver, you can invert this behavior.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.44.title: Distillation Tower
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.44.subti: Long, pointy and of course, INDUSTRIAL! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.44.descr: The Distillation Tower is a large multiblock structure that will be used to obtain Bitument and other resourcers through refining Crude Oil.
The tower will produce Gasoline, Sulfurised Diesel and Lubricant.
Power will have to be supplied to the tower in order to work.
To build this structure, use the guide provided in the Engineer's Manual. You can also use a projector to see the structure in the world.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.45.title: Improved Steel Production
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.45.subti: The Man of Steel. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.45.descr: To start producing steel faster, you'll have to build a new multiblock structure, call The Improved Blast Furnace.
A projector can be used to see how the structure should be built, but just in case you don't have one, here's an example of how the structure should look:

After right-clicking it with an Engineer's Hammer, the structure will be finished and you can start producing steel. Additionally, two preheaters can be installed on the furnace's sides to speed up the process. These preheaters will require RF in order to work.
If the preheaters are not installed, the furnace will work just like a default blast furnace. You can install only one preheater, but two will do a better job.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.46.subti: Highly conductive Ghast material. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.46.descr: Carminite will be required in the process of obtaining Redstone Engineering Blocks.
There are two ways of obtaining Carminite. One is by looting the Dark Forest Tower in the Twilight Forest. The other one is by crafting it.

However, to be able to craft Carminite, you'll need a powerful relic which can be obtained only from the twilight's Ur-Ghast. This relic is so powerful that it will NOT be used in the crafting recipes.
So, with that being said, you're heading to Twilight to get the Ghast Blood Tear. Have fun!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.47.subti: Desert Conductivity. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.47.descr: Nebu will be required in the process of obtaining Light Engineering Blocks.

Nebu Ingot is obtained from nebu ore which can be found in Atum. Check the \"OreGen Info\" tab to learn more about the height at which it can spawn. Aditionally, you can make a Scanner to help you find the ore much easier, as it can be quite rare.
Well, great. This means you're heading towards Atum. Good luck!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.48.subti: Fair X-ray. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.48.descr: Throughout the world, there can be some invisible resource deposits in each chunk.
These deposits can either contain liquid fuels, or solid ores.
A Core Sample Drill powered with RF will help you find if, and what type of resource, a chunks has.

Just place the sample drill in a chunk, provide it with power and right-click on it (either with an empty hand, or with an engineers hammer, depending on the info you wanna obtain). After taking a sample from the chunk it is placed in, the drill can be right-clicked again to take the sample out. It can be listed as \"No Fluid Reservoir\", \"No mineral\". It can also be listed with the type of fluid or mineral resource that was found.

If a chunk presents one type of reservoir, you'll need a different machine based on your found resource. If it is a fluid, you'll need a PumpJack to extract it. If it is a mineral, you'll need an Excavator to extract it.
Keep in mind that reservoirs are not infinite. They eventually run out of resources.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.49.title: Advanced Engineering Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.49.subti: These blocks will be used to construct powerful multiblock machines, such as the Excavator or Diesel Generator
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.50.title: Fermenter
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.50.subti: Obtaining Ethanol. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.50.descr: The Fermenter is a multiblock structure that extracts Ethanol from certain vegetables, at the cost of some RF. Ethanol can be later used to produce BioDiesel which can be used as fuel in a Diesel Generator or in tools like the Mining Drill. The Ethanol can also be used to produce Herbicide which can be loaded into a Chemical Thrower to remove the leaves and grass from the word.
To build this structure, use the guide provided in the Engineer's Manual. You can also use a projector to see the structure in the world.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.51.title: Squeezer
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.51.subti: Obtaining Seed Oil. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.51.descr: The Squeezer is a multiblock structure which can be used to extract oil from certain seeds and vegetables. It can also be used to obtain Graphite. The oil will be later used in the proccess of making Biodiesel which is fuild for either a Diesel Generator or tools such as the Mining Drill. The Graphite will be used to obtain Black Iron.
To build this structure, use the guide provided in the Engineer's Manual. You can also use a projector to see the structure in the world.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.52.title: Refinery
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.52.subti: Making Biodiesel. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.52.descr: The Refinery's only purpose is to produce BioDiesel. This liquid fuel can be used to power a Diesel Generator or tools such as the Mining Drill.
To build this structure, use the guide provided in the Engineer's Manual. You can also use a projector to see the structure in the world.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.53.title: Diesel for days!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.53.subti: By feeding Sulfurized Diesel, obtained either from a Distillation Tower or a Coker, in a Sulfur Recovery Unit, you can obtain Diesel which can be used to power the Diesel Generator
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.54.title: Gasoline
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.54.subti: Gasoline is a major milestone and it will be used later to produce Rocket Fuel. It will also be used later as a possible fuel for the Compression Dynamo. For now, it can be used as fuel in the Portable Generator
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.55.title: Arc Furnace
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.55.subti: This powerful furnace will use RF to smelt all of your precious ores and double them. Additionaly, you may be able to alloy some metals in it. Speeding up the Steel making process will also be a thing. A projector is adviced for building this structure. Three Graphite Rods have to be added to the Furnace in order for it to work properly
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.56.title: Metal Press
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.56.subti: Electric pressing. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.56.descr: The Metal Press is a tiny multiblock structure which, at the cost of some RF, to obtain plates, rods, large plates and gears.
Molds will need to be provided in order for the press to work.
To build this structure, use the guide provided in the Engineer's Manual. You can also use a projector to see the structure in the world.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.57.title: Circuits forever
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.57.subti: My company's name will be Melon! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.57.descr: Using an Engineer's Circuit Table you can start producing your own Logical Circuits.
The table must be provided with power, Circuit Backplanes, some Metal Wires and some Vacuum Tubes. Lastly, just choose your pattern, color and your circuit will be ready.
Circuits have plenty of uses, but their main use in this pack, will be for electronics. A great first example for this, will be the Scanner.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.58.subti: The Electrolyzed Alloy is a highly conductive material which can be charged up with electricity. It CANNOT be used as a battery, but when it's Overcharged, it becomes a material used in lots of recipes. It needs 19200 RF in order to become Overcharged. Also, the process takes around 30 seconds. This amount of time CANNOT be reduced by any means
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.59.subti: A turtle can be upgraded with certain tools to create a mini-robot. Turtles can be programmed through the lua language to do lots of things, such as, mob grinders, quarrys and more. You can take a look at the \"Useful Items\" tab to see more about the turtles you can use
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.60.subti: Craft and Upgrade. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.60.descr: The Engineer's Workbench is used both for crafting special items and for modifying IE's unique tools. It takes up two blocks.

The Workbench's GUI is fairly simple. The left slot accepts either an Engineer's Blueprint (for crafting) or a modifiable IE tool. Without a blueprint or a tool to modify, the Workbench doesn't do anything.

With a blueprint in place, 6 slots appear in the center to accept shapeless crafting inputs, and a number of recipe outputs appear on the right. Each blueprint comes with its own set of recipes; for example, with the \"Crafting Components\" blueprint, the player can craft Iron Mechanical Components, Steel Mechanical Components, Vaccuum Tubes, and Circuit Backplanes.

Tool, weapon, and shield modifications can be installed or removed at the Engineer's Workbench. The player sets their upgradable tool in the left slot, then its available slots for modifications appear in the middle. An extra slot appears on the right for installing a Shader, an aesthetic choice.On removing the upgradable tool, the newly added modifications stay with it.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.61.title: Industrial Electrolyzer
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.61.subti: The Industrial Electrolyzer is a multiblock structure that will allow you to start producing Aluminum. The process requires a constant supply of 144 RF/t in order to produce Aluminum, otherwise nothing will happen. Water and Graphite Electrodes will also be required. You'll need a Blueprint for them. It can be obtained from a Master Machinist Villager. These Villagers are using the Vanilla Anvil as a Working Station. Now, if you're not familiar, you have to trade with Villagers in order to get them to the Master Level
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.61.descr: In order for the Electrolyser to work properly, you'll need to supply water to the structure.

In order to avoid any confusion, know that the Elecrolyzer, has two input slots (blue), on each side. However, one of them is for liquids, while the other one, is for items. Same thing goes with the output slots (orange). Before getting confused about \"why can't I add water to this machine?\", make sure you're adding the water through the right input slot.

Now, the water that's extracted from the liquid output slot, can either be voided, or added back into the machine, to create a closed loop system, however, note that there will be some leaks and you'll probably need a constant supply of water for this.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.62.title: Obtaining Aluminum
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.62.subti: Aluminum is the latest advance in the life of an Engineer. Obtain it through the Electrolysis process which requires Graphite Electrodes and an adequate machine
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.63.title: Crucible
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.63.subti: The Process of making Steel just got somehow easier. The Crucible is a multiblock structure which is more efficient when it comes to the production of Steel. While being slower then the Improved Blast Furnace, it is capable of doubling your output. Yes, that's right, this puppy can turn one Iron Ingot into two Steel Ingots. It needs Coal Coke as fuel, a Blast Furnace Preheater connected to the small opening and small amounts of carbon. These can be provided through Mini Coals, or Mini Charcoals. A projector is recommended for building this structure
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.64.subti: The Roze Quartz is a conductive crystal perfect for producing Electron Tubes. These can be later integrated into certain frames to make useful machines. The Rose Quartz has to be polished with Sand Paper in order to fit the frame of a tube
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.65.subti: The Spout is a mechanical machine which is mainly used to pour liquids intro certain items/containers
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.66.subti: The Blaze Cake base will be filled with Blazing Blood using a Spout, to obtain a Blaze Cake
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.67.title: Making Plates
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.67.subti: Iron Plates and Plates, in general, can be obtained by placing ingots below a Mechanical Press, on a solid block, like Dirt/Grass/Stone
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.68.title: The Redstone Engineering Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.68.subti: These blocks will serve as Redstone Control Panels for most of the machines added by Immersive Enginering
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.69.title: The Light Engineering Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.69.subti: These blocks will serve as Energy Access Points for the machines added by Immersive Engineering
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.70.title: Mechanical Components
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.70.subti: Mechanical Components are crafting ingredients which have plenty of uses, from Engineering Blocks, to nifty Gadgets. You'll need a lot of these
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.71.subti: The Rotational Speed Controller is a machine added by Create. When it's place below a Large Cogwheel, it will allow you increase/decrease the Rotational Speed that comes out of it
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.72.title: Compact Circuits
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.72.subti: These utility mechanism can be used to make advanced contraptions using well timed redstone signals. With these, you'll be able to stop the rotation of certain sections, invert it, distribute it and increase it. Use them well
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.73.title: Measuring the Numbers
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.73.subti: The Speedometer and the Stressometer are two information panels added by Create. You'll be able to see the information displayer by then with some Engineer's Goggles. These blocks can also output redstone signals with different intensities, based on the networks they're connected to
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.74.title: Making Elevators
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.74.subti: The Rope Pulley can be used to transport contraptions, vertically. This can be useful for making Elevators and other amazing transportation mechanisms
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.75.title: Making Cable Cars
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.75.subti: The Gantry Carriage can be used to transport contraptions over long distances. If you use this to your advantage, you can make amazing Cable Cars for item transportation, or for your own transportation
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.76.title: Not Enough Glue?
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.76.subti: If you're running low on SlimeBalls, you might wanna look into these two blocks. They're able to create very efficient connections between each other and between other blocks without using tons of Glue
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.77.subti: The Capacitor is a common electrical component. It's recommened you automate their production when you have the chance
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.78.subti: The Pipe Wrench will be used to manage complex storage and transportation systems. Quite simply, it will unlock the Pretty Pipes mod which will give you access to a primitive storage system
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.79.title: The Coke Oven - Mk II
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.79.subti: The Rotary Kiln is a multiblock structure added by Immersive Industry. It can be considered an upgrade to the Coke Oven, as it can produce large amounts of Charcoal and Coal Coke at a high speed. When a process is started, you'll have to wait for the Kiln to warm up. After that happens, it will process the inputs faster, as the Kiln will lose just a tiny amount of heat for every crafted item. Using a Projector is adviced for building this structure
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.80.subti: Because this pack is eXpERt sTyLe. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_2.quests.80.descr: When placed directly above a crop, within a 16 blocks area, this block will allow that said crop to grow year-round.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.title: Gear - 3
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.0.subtit: Steel Casings are used as a base to create powerful machines added by Mekanism
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.1.subtit: Entering Mekanism. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.1.descri: Well, you reached another milestone. Making this machine will officially introduce you to Mekanism. You'll be working a lot of this mod in the future, so get used to it's interface. Speaking of, let's see how it looks:
Don't panic. Might look a little complicated, but in fact, it isn't. Let's take the side buttons first:

- Orage: This is the Side Configuration panel. Here you can choose on which side you want this machine to export or import items. Oh, might be great to know. Mekanism's machines, unlike Thermal's machines, DO NOT have an auto-input feature. You'll have to input items with a pipe or something.
- Aqua: This panel will be used for sorting.
- Yellow: This is the Energy Information panel and it will show info about the energy used and needed by the machine in order to operate.

- Violet: This is the Machine Upgrade panel and it will allow you to see the upgrades which can be received by a machine and the currently installed upgrades. It will also allow you to place upgrades in the machine.
- White: This is the Security Panel. This will be used with a Security Desk to allow only certain individuals to access your machines. Yeah, this might be useful on multiplayer servers.
- Pink: This is the Redstone Control panel where you'll be able to configure the machine's behaviour to redstone signals.
Now that we've covered the side button, let's move to the main interface:
- Red: In Mekanism, Red means Input, so that's the slot where you'll place your main input ingredient.
- Dark Yellow: In Mekanism, Dark Yellow means Extra, so that's where you'll place an extra ingredient in order to make a recipe.
- Blue: In Mekanism, Blue means Output, so that's the slot where you'll get the resulting product of any recipe.

- Neon Green: That's the power slot. So there you'll be able to place items such as energy tablets in order to power your machine if for some reason, you don't want to use a cable and a direct power source.
Now, the Metallurgic Infuser has many uses, including the production of Basic Control Circuits, but until you'll be able to make those, it will serve as a perfect upgrade to your Steel factory.
PS: This machine also has a \"Dump\" button to remove the Extra materials located in its internal tank.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.2.title: Fission Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.2.subtit: The Follout Machine. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.2.descri: Welcome to the world of Nuclear Power. Here, you'll start to generate huge amounts of energy with no risks whatsoever. HAHAHA, jokes aside, this is serious. Making power with a Fission Reactor will be more dangerous then you might think, so we'll walk you through all the steps required to perform this job, as safely as possible.
Before starting, we also suggest you to make your own research on the Fission Reactor if you feel like you want to know more about this subject.
Ok, first of all. Since you have access to teleportation, it might be a good idea to build the whole nuclear plant far away from your base, as a very tiny mistake could ruin everything.

Second of all, let's see how the Fission Reactor works. This thingg will NOT produce power on its own. However, it will produce heat which can be used to either turn water into steam, or sodium into superheated sodium. Yes, there are two ways of producing power with a Fission reactor and we'll walk you through both of them.

Steam - The Reactor has to be constantly fed with water both to keep it cooled down, and to produce steam. The resulting steam can be transfered to a Turbine to produce power. Simple, right? If you want to know more about the Turbine, we have a quest dedicated to it.

Superheated Sodium - The Reactor ahs to be constantly fed with Sodium both to keep it cool and to produce Superheated Sodium. This resulting gas will be taken from the Reactor and will be fed into a water filled Boiler. The Superheated Sodium will heat up the Boiler, which will produce Steam. Of course, after that, the Steam will be used in a Turbine to make power.

Since using Sodium as a coolant, will be a harder thing to achieve, we have to tell you that it is also rewarding. Sodium is better for producing high amounts of heat which will result in higher fuel burning rates.
Ok, we've covered cooling methods. Now, let's see how to build this thing and how to actually use it.

The Fission Reactor is a modular multiblock structure. This means that you can build it however you want (of course, there are some limits, but you get it). The Reactor structure has two components. The External Casing and the Internal Components.

Internal Components - these consist in Fission Control Rods. A Control Rod is formed by a 1x1 block wide column made wof 1 to 15 Fission Fuel Assembly and a Single Control Rod Assembly at the top. These Control Rods must NOT touch each other. Maximum control rod density can be achieved by placing them in a checkerboard pattern.

External Casing - this has to be a cuboid of minimum outside size 3x4x3, up to 18x18x18. The edges of the outer shell must be made of Fission Reactor Casings and the faces of the outer shell can be either Fission Reactor Casing, Reactor Glass, Fission Reactor Port or Fission Reactor Logic Adapter.
Now, let's cover each of these blocks:
Reactor Casing - makes the edges of the external reactor casing.
Reactor Glass - makes the faces of the reactor casing. It allows you to see what's inside the reactor.

Fission Reactor Port - you should have at least 4 of these. You can configure them to input Coolent and Fuel to the Reactor and output Heated Coolent and Nuclear Waste from the Reactor by using a Configurator.

Fission Reactor Logic Adapter - this one is optional. It will allow you to remotely control the Reactor. With one installed, you can use various events or conditions to control the reactor automatically with no manual input. This is useful for prevention of meltdowns. It can be accessed by right-clicking it.
Here's a picture of the absolute smallest Fission Reactor:

Again, the ports have to be configured properly with a Configurator by shift right-clicking them. After that, you should be ready to add the Coolent and the Fuel to the Reactor. Coolent has to constantly be provived in very large quantities, otherwise the unthinkable might happen.
We recommend to always wear a Hazmat Suit while working with the radioactive side of Makenism, so that you don't die randomly. Ok, now let's see how radiation can leak into the environment:

- Fission reactor overheating which leads to a core meltdown (actually blowing up). Just supply your reactor with enough Coolent before starting it. Keep supplying Coolent to the Reactor at all times.

- Fission reactor running with its Waste tank full. The Nuclear Waste and all the other Radioactive materials should be stored only in Radioactive Waste Barrels. When these Barrels are filled with Nuclear Waste, they'll delete their contents at a rate of 1 mB per minute. Keep in mind that these Barrels CANNOT be moved by any means once they store radioactive material.

- Breaking any block containing radioactive materials. Most notably Pressurized Tubes and Radioactive Waste Barrels. This also applies to machines, like a Pressurized Reaction Chamber containing polonium for example. These can still be broken safely if they are somehow drained of their radioactive contents beforehand.

Now, let's talk a bit about what happens if you screw up and irradiate an entire area. If you have your particles turned on in your video settings, you'll be able to spot neon green particles in the air. These will try to indicate the area which has high amounts of radiation. For more accurate measurements of the radiation present in the environment, you can use a Geiger Counter (which is one of the rewards of this quests).
To see what's the amount of radiation you've been exposed to, you can use a Dosimeter (which is the other reward for this quest).

An irradiated area will clear itself over time. There are no options to shorten this amount of time. If you get radiation poisoning, unfortunately, that's a 99% sentence to death. Why 99% and not 100%? Well, you will not die if you can survive the amount of damage you'll receive until your radiation dose lowers. So yeah, that's that.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.3.title: The Industrial Turbine
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.3.subtit: Steam is Power, duh. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.3.descri: We'll be straight. You want RF? You need steam. Unfortunately, the Steam produced by the Create Boilers, won't cut it. You'll need Steam from Mekanism.
There are multiple ways of obtaining Steam:

Each of these ways of obtaining Steam, has its own quest where their functionality is explained more cleary, so check those out if you want to learn more. Now let's get back to the Industrial Turbine and see how to build it.

There are a few rules which have to be followed. The structure must be vertical. Its length and width have to be equal. Maximum size is 17x17x18. Each edge of the cuboid must only consist of Turbine Casings. Let's build this thing:
- Placa a 5x5 base layer of Turbine Casings down.
- Place one Turbine Rotor in the center of this base.
- Form a Rotor layer by placing a 5x5 ring of Turbine Casings and Strucutral Glass untop of the first 5x5 layer.

- Repeat this process 3 more times to achieve a 5 blocks tall structure. Add Turbine Blades to the Turbine Rotor by right-clicking the Rotor with the Blades. For each Rotor block, you'll need 2 Blades.
- On top of the last Turbine Rotor, place a Rotational Complex and surround it with Pressure Dispersers and a ring of Turbine Casings and Structural Glass to create a disparser layer.

- On top of the Rotational Complex place 1 Electromagnetic Coil. Connect another Electromagnetic Coil to the one that's sitting above the Rotational Complex. The way in which you connect the two Electromagnetic Coils, does not matter, but one of them has to be on top of the Rotational Complex. Add another ring of Turbine Casings and Structural Glass. If you're making a bigger Turbine, note that 1 Electromagnetic Coil will be needed for 2 Turbine Rotors.

- The Turbine can turn the Steam it receives, back into water, but for that to happen, you must add Saturating Condensers which are optional. These Condensers can be placed next to the Electromagnetic Coils. You can add just one. The more you have, the higher the steam conversion rate will be (if Water output is above the max Steam Rate, it's useless to add more Saturating Condensers).

- Cap off the Turbine with a layer made out of Turbine Casings (these will go on the edge) and Turbine Vents. Turbine Vents are added to create a good airflow through the Turbine. These Vent can also be added on the sides of the Turbine Structure, but you'll have to place them only above the layer which has the Rotational Complex. If your Turbine has Saturating Condensers, you can get your Water back from the Turbine with a liquid pipe, through the Turbine's Vents.
- Lastly, you can add Turbine Valves at the base of the structure, or anywhere you like. Turbine Valves are used to pump Steam into the Turbine and to also extract the RF/FE generated by it.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.4.subtit: By feeding Polonium and Fluorite Dust into a Pressurized Reaction Chamber, you can make Polonium Pallets which have many uses
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.5.subtit: Gases provide POWAH!!! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.5.descri: Do you hear that? It's time to upgrade your power generation. How's that gonna happen? Through this beauty. This is the Gas-Burning Generator.

Like its name might suggest, this machine will burn certain gases to produce RF/FE. This Generator has a higher RF/tick production then the Stirling and the Compression Dynamos, however, this higher RF/tick rate can be achieved only if the Generator's internal gas tank is full. It can consume just Hydrongen and Ethylene as fuels. Each one of them will produce different quantities of power, so let's see what numbers we're dealing with are.

Just as a spoiler, we DO NOT recommend to use Hydrogen as a fuel due to the fact that it will be ineficient. Basically, the power required to produce the Hydrogen, is higher then the power produced by it, but we'll tell you what the numbers are anyways.

1 bucket of Hydrogen will produce 3kRF. When the internal tank of the Gas-Burning Generator is full (18 buckets), it will output that power at a rate of 900RF/tick. If you manage to create a setup that will produce enough Hydrogen to power this thing, then you might actually find it useful.
Now, let's cover the Ethylene. This one will be a major upgrade to the power production rates provided by the Stirling and the Compression Dynamos, so let's see what the numbers are.

1 bucket of Ethylene will produce 313kRF. When the internal gas tank of the Generator is full (18 buckets), it will output that amount of power at a rate of 2kRF/tick, which is far more then what the previous Dynamos could achieve.

Keep in mind that the Gas-Burning Generator will be more useful for producing more RF/tick, and NOT more RF overall. Using the Compression Dynamo and 1 bucket of Refined Fuel, you can obtain 1.5M RF, while with the Gas-Burning Generator and 1 bucket of Ethylene, you can obtain only 313k RF. The advantage, however, comes with the higher RF/tick production rate. At its best, the Compression Dynamo will make 640RF/tick, while the Gas-Burning Generator, will make 2k RF/tick. See the differance?

Also note that the Gas-Burning Generator will NOT produce 2k RF/tick if its internal gas tank is not full. So you'll need a setup that will produce enough Ethylene to keep that tank full. Don't worry, this will not be hard to achieve.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.6.title: The High Density PolyEhtylene Pellets
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.6.subtit: The HDPE Pellets are used to craft a variety of items that will be useful from here on out
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.7.subtit: Antimatter can be created in a Supercritical Phase Shifter, at the expense of large amounts of 100mB of Polonium and very large amounts of RF/FE. The pellet can simply be obtained in a Chemical Crystallizer
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.8.subtit: But you've got the Celestial Gateway, right? Nope, this one's better. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.8.descri: Until this point you had no issues using the Celestial Gateway from Astral Sorcery. It did the job and it got you to wherever you needed to be. Well, now why would you use this teleporter?
There are multiple reasons to switch to this beauty:
The first one is the fact that it is much more easier to set up. You'll just need the Teleporter and at least 9 frames. It requires less space and it is faster then the Gateway provided by Astral.

The second one is the fact that it also allows you to teleport to a location from anywhere. Yes, that's right. However, you'll a Portable Teleporter in order to achieve this feat adn you'll get that portable version later.

Ok, so we've convinced you to switch to Mekanism's Teleporter. Now, let's teach you how to use it. In order to teleport between two points, just like with the Celestial Gateway, you'll need two locations to teleport from back and forth.

After that, you'll have to build a portal frame with at least 9 Teleporter Frames (and you get 18 by finishing this quest, so yeah, great deal, we know). The Teleporter itself has to be located either at the top, or ar the bottom of your frame. Here's how the thing should look:

After making the structure, you'll need to supply the teleporter with RF/FE. Finally, just set up a frequency at which the Teleporter should run. The frequency can have any name you'd like. To link two, or more Teleporters together, just make sure all of them have the same frequency selected. Easy job, right? :D
PS: It is not recommended to use more then two Portals on the same frequency, as this might result in strange behaviours.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.9.subtit: The actually usefull Trashcan. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.9.descri: Well, it might be a little too late to tell you not to void any useless items you get, because they'll have a use later, but there's no problem, right?
Moving forward, we want to show you the Matter Condenser. This beauty will accomplish two things.
First, it will be a trash can.

Second, when it's provided with at least a 4k Storage Component, this machine will store the items you're trying to delete, will condense them (duh) and then, it will give you either Matter Balls, or Singularities, depending on your choise.
Now, what do you need the two items for? Don't worry, you'll see.
Spoiler: Start automating this thing with cobblestone or whatever you can mass produce. You'll need a lot of those two items.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.10.subti: By dumping 100.000 items into a Matter Condenser, a Singularity can be obtained
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.11.title: Arc Reactor, no Palladium!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.11.subti: A Fusion Reactor can be used to produce immense quantities of FE. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.11.descr: This is another great milestone. The Fusion Reactor is not only much more efficient then the Fission Reactor, but it is also much more safer. Yeah, that's right. This thing WILL NOT explode. There are a lot of reasons to use this thing to produce power and we'll walk you through the steps required to set this thing up.

Unlike previous Mekanism multi-block structures, this one is \"less modular\". By that, we mean it cannot be smaller/larger in size and it has to be a sphere. \"Ok, but then, why it is <less modular>?\". Well, you can still place the Reactor ports where you want and you can also use Reactor Glass for the sides, instead of Fusion Reactor Frames.
With that being said, let's see how this thing looks:
The Reactor Controller has to be placed at the top of the structure. The faces can be exchanged with Reactor Glass to minimize the amount of Fusion Reactor Frames needed.

Now, how do you use this thing? First, as with the Fission Reactor, this Reactor has also two versions, the air cooled one and the water cooled one. The water cooled Fusion Reactor is simply an upgraded version of the regular, air cooled Fusion Reactor.

Before starting the Reactor, let's learn about what it will use as fuel. Through one of the Reactor Ports, you'll pump in Deuterium, and through the other Port, you'll pump in Tritium. To start the Reactor, you'll have to place inside of its inventory, an Antimatter Filled Hohlraum. After that, you'll have to start a reaction to allow for heat to built up, and ultimately, to allow the Reactor to use its fuel and sustain itself.

To start this reaction, you'll have to use at least one Laser and a Laser Amplifier. The Laser has to be fired into the Amplifier. The Amplifier has to be set in a way which would not allow a laser beam to go through it. This way, the Amplifier will store the power coming from the Laser. When around 1.5G RF is reached, you can fire the Amplifier at the reactor through its Laser Focus Matrix. This will make the Reactor reach its Ignition Temperature, which will start the reaction inside. After the reaction starts, the Reactor will start to produce more heat and power, based on the Fuel Injection rate which you can set in one of the menus available in the Reactor.

We suggest you to take the things slow with this Reactor and esspecially, with its Fuel Injection Rate. If not enough fuel is provided to sustain the Injection Rate, all the fuel will be used, resulting in the Reactor to shut down. You don't want a Fusion Reactor to shut down because it takes a lot of time and energy to turn it on. Even if you're using the maximum amount of Lasers (5) to start this thing, it will take a long time to reach the 1.5G RF required for this thing to start running.

Power can be extracted from the Reactor through a 3rd Reactor Port. If you want to get more power out of this thing, you can upgrade it to a water cooled Reactor. Just add two more Fusion Reactor ports to this thing. Through one of them, add water to the Reactor. Through the other one, pump out Steam and send it to a Turbine to make more power. The Port which pumps out Steam has to be configured to \"output Steam\" with a Configurator. We suggest you to use a large Turbine with this thing as it can easily reach a production rate of around 300.000 mB/tick of Steam.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.12.title: Thermal Framing
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.12.subti: These two frames will allow you to officially enter into the Thermal Series
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.13.subti: Phin's Workbench. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.13.descr: The Tinker's Workbench is a block that can charge, fill, and apply augments to tools/blocks.
It has mainly two modes, charge/refill and augment, which you can toggle between, by using the button bellow the item slot in the GUI.

Keep in mind that you'll need this Workbench esspecially if you want to install augments on tools. Blocks such as machines can also accept augments from their inventory. Also, after installing an augment in a tool, you'll need to toggle between the Workbench's mods or take the tool out to update its stats.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.14.subti: Alloy, no Horizon. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.14.descr: Alright, this might not be the best way of processing ores, but it surely it isn't the worst either.

The Induction Smelter's main use is to produce alloys by combining multiple items together, however it can also smelt regular ores into ingots or gems, effectively producing more resources depending on the Catalyst that was used.
Catalysts are optional resources which are used to improve the yield/ production speed of certain recipes. Here's the valid Catalysts for the Induction Smelter:
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.15.title: Pressing Matters, duh
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.15.subti: Making plates just got much more easier. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.15.descr: What do you know? Making plates/gears just got easier. How's that? Well, now you can make the Multiservo Press.
This machine will accept a variety of dies in order to shape a variety of metals into different parts. It can also pack/unpack blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.16.subti: The Fuel Factory. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.16.descr: The Fractionating Still is a machines which refines fluids such as Crude Oil, into Light Oil which can further be used to obtain Refined Fuel.
However, the Still's main use here will be to produce Rosin which will be used to make Signalum.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.17.subti: Well. Easier Coal Coke. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.17.descr: The Pyrolizer is a machine that decomposes substances in a low-oxygen environment using heat.
While you can use it to obtain Coal Coke and Creosote Oil much more easier, its main use here will be to produce Tar. This dense and oily substance will be used to make Enderium.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.18.subti: Will use burnable items to produce RF/FE. Basically a Furnace Generator. It can receive certain Integral Components and Auguments to produce more RF overall
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.19.subti: Will use liquid fuels to produce RF/FE. Basically a Liquid Burning Generator. It can receive certain Integral Components and Auguments to produce more RF overall. We highly recommend you to use JEI to see what fuel options you've got
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.20.subti: Crushing is essential. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.20.descr: The Crusher is somehow similar to the Thermal's Pulverizer, but at the same time, quite different.
Its main use is represented by the production of BioFuel which will later be turned into HDPE Pallets.
It also plays a very important role in the future Ore Tripling/Quadrupling/Quintupling setups.

All you need to know, is that the Crusher will take Clump varients of your ores and will process them into Dirty verions of their dusts which can later be processed into regular versions, that, of course, will turn into ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.21.subti: Clean, clean and enhance. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.21.descr: You thought Mekanism didn't have an ore doubling system? Well, you were wrong. Unlike Thermal, where you need to pulverize your ores in orther to crush them, here you have to enrich them. Let's see how you'll do that.
The Enrichment Chamber can be used by itself or as a part of the Mekanism ore processing system. It is also used as a component to craft other machines, such as The Pressurized Reaction Chamber.
Its main use is to either double an ore, or to bring a Dirty piece of Ore Dust to it's regular form, so it can be later processed into an ingot.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.22.subti: The Biofuel can be turned into Ethylene in a Pressurized Reaction Chamber, producing Substrate as a byproduct
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.23.subti: No PneumaticCraft, here we go. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.23.descr: Doesn't matter if you're here for the Ethylene, the HDPE pellets, the Hydrogen, or anything else. You're building this thing.

The Pressurized Reaction Chamber will be used primarily to create Substrate, HDPE Pellets and Ethylene. It will also make the production of certain substances, such as Hydrogen and Sulfur, much easier.
Note that it has a variable speed and energy usage dependent on the materials/gasses it is creating.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.24.subti: Splitting the coin's two halves. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.24.descr: A true scientist will use lots of elements to synthesize lots of amazing substances. Unfortunately, you'll have to obtain your own elements, as probably there's no place you can buy them from. Since Hydrogen and Oxygen are two essential elements, you'll be starting with them. Probably.
Say \"hello\" to the Electrolytic Separator. This machine will take certain substances and will split them into their base components.

The Electrolytic Separator is used to separate Heavy Water into Deuterium and Oxygen, Brine into Sodium and Chlorine, and Water into Hydrogen and Oxygen. The products will be used in other Mekanism machines/contraptions.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.25.subti: When combined with Oxygen in the Pressurized Reaction Chamber, the Substrate will turn into a very strong product
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.26.subti: The Solar Neutron Activator will turn Lithium into Tritium and Nuclear Waste into Polonium
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.27.subti: Beauty and the Slurry. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.27.descr: Slurries can be quite tricky to handle, especially considering the fact that they're not much of a use to you in their current form. Let's change that, shall we?

Meet the Chemical Crystallizer. This machine will be used in the ore processing system. Each operation requires 200 mB of clean ore slurry gas and produces one crystal. This machine is used in Tier 4 Ore Processing. It produces 5 crystals from 1 ore.
One of its other issues is involved around the production of Lithium dust. When given power and 100mb of Lithium in its gas form, this machine will give you Lithium Dust.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.28.subti: Refined Uranium. A main ingredient in the Uraninite recipe. Required to unlock the 4th Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.29.subti: Cleaning things up. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.29.descr: Dealing with a fair amount of Dirty Slurries? Want to throw them away 'cause they're useless? Have no way of cleaning them? Worry no more. The Chemical Washer is for you.
This machine will be mainly used as part of the ore processing system. It will turn dirty slurries, into clean slurries which will later be processed in a Chemical Crystallizer.
The most important role of this machine, will be played in the production of Uranium Crystals, which will be used to synthesize advanced fuels.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.30.subti: Yes, Mekanism has one, too. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.30.descr: Unlike Industrial Foregoing's Dissolution Chamber, this one will only be used with Sulfuric Acid. It will be used to obtain base chemicals and dirty slurries for the ore quintupling process.
It will use 100 mB of sulfuric acid for every ore dissolved and it will output 1000 mb of dirty slurry. This slurry needs washing in the Chemical Washer.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.31.subti: A chemical situation. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.31.descr: Forward, you'll mainly be interested into two things. These will be Sulfuric Acid and Uranium Hexafluoride. While the Acid will be used for ore quintupling, the Hexafluoride will be used as fuel. You'll need this machine in order to obtain these two gases.
The Chemical Oxidizer accepts incoming materials to produce a variety of gases from them. It uses 80 RF/tick. It is a crucial machine needed for Mekanism's 5x ore production system.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.32.subti: Enhancing that Osmium. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.32.descr: Osmium is a very dense material, which is great, but it would be better if it was a little stronger. Maybe some obsidian could provide that missing strenght. Only if you had a way to combine the two.. Oh.. WAIT!
Yup, that's right, there it is. The Osmium Compressor. It is used to create Refined Obsidian Ingots from Refined Obsidian Dust and Glowstone Ingots from Glowstone Dust.
It fuses liquid Osmium with the originating materials to create their corresponding ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.33.subti: Dense steel keeps you alive in Space. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.33.descr: This will be one of the first quests regaring your journey into Space. Yes, you heard that right, you're going to Space. Since the environment there will constantly try to kill you, a strong, very dense verison of your regular steel will be required there.
Fortunately, this machine is exactly what you need. The Metal Compressor will take certain metals and compress them until they're dense enough to withstand the vacuum of Space.
This machine can accept up to 4 AE2 Acceleration Cards as upgrades.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.34.title: Building Rockets
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.34.subti: To the realms of space. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.34.descr: This will be one of the first quests regaring Space exploration. Why do you need to go into Space, you're asking? That's quite simple. There are a few needed materials which you'll only find on other planets. To reach those planets, you'll need a rocket. How do you get that? Well, that's where the Nasa Workbench comes in.
This machine will take multiple rocket pieces and assemble them into mighty rockets.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.35.title: Making Rocket Fuel
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.35.subti: Kerosene? Neh, doesn't exist in this universe. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.35.descr: The Fuel Assembly Unit will allow you to combine Refined Fuel, Gasoline and Liquid Oxygen into a potent substance which can be used to power Rockets.

After you have the fuel, you'll need to Shift Right-Click the Rocket to open its fuel tank. Place a bucket of fuel and wait for the tank to fill up. When it's full, you can start your journey into space.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.36.subti: Wanna live in Space? Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.36.descr: While some of the planets you'll encounter will be inhabitable, you might find one of them to be just right for colonizing. Yeah, that's right, we're talking about Mars.
While the entire planet is covered with toxic sand and it does not have oxygen in its atmosphere, the temperatures there are just in the right spot for making it a liveable environment.

So.. great. You won't freeze or heat up to death, but what about that oxygen? You're not going to breath toxic sand, right? Well, no. That's where the Oxygen Bubble Distributor comes in. This machine will consume RF/FE and Oxygen to make a breathable area. Inside of its interface you can select the area of effect, but note that larger areas will consume more RF/FE and more Oxygen. The largest area will be 31x31x31.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.37.subti: Towards The Moon! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.37.descr: If you're reading this, it means that you're going to The Moon. There are some things you'll have to prepare first.

Going in outer space is a dangerous task, merely because there's no Oxygen there, so a SpaceSuit charged with Oxygen will be required. Additionally, you can bring with you a setup to produce Oxygen there, but that's your choise.
Lastly, you might wanna bring some rocket fuel with you. The Rocket will require fuel in order to get you back home. Thats if you're not setting up a Celestial Gateway on The Moon, of course.
PS: When you land on The Moon, you'll do that inside of a Landing Pod. Don't worry, that's normal. Your Rocket will be inside of that Pod. Just shift right-click it.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.38.subti: Towards Mars! The Tier 2 Rocket will allow you to reach one more planet, and that's Mars
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.39.subti: Towards Venus and Mercury! The Tier 3 Rocket will be your best spaceship available for traveling space as it will unlock all the destinations available for our Planet
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.40.subti: The Tesseract of the 21st century. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.40.descr: Ever wanted to transport things on long range, even across dimensions? Well, the Entangloporter is for you!

Let's say you want to transport items/liquids/gases/electricity from point A to point B without cables or anything, all wirelessly. Here's what you need to do. Place one of these in point A, one of them in point B, give them the same frequancy, configure their sides and you're good to go.
Not that clear? Ok, let's see how does this thing works:

Public \\& Private - These two will swith between the public and private lists of frequencies. This might be more useful on multiplayer where you'll want to limit the access of other players to your Entangloporter.
The Black Area - that's the list where you'll see all the available frequencies once you'll create them.
Frequency, Owner \\& Security - this field will show you basic information about the currently selected frequency.
Set - finally, this is where you'll create your frequencies. Just give them a name and then, press the check mark to add them to your list.

After setting up a frequency, just make sure that the side configuration of the Entangloporter is adequate to what you want to achieve. The Entangloporter has different panels for each type of resource you're trying to transport, so make sure they're properly configured to suit your needs.
PS: The Entangloporter CANNOT transfer Polonium or Plutonium.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.41.subti: This Machine Frame will be the base for the RF Tools machines. It will also be used to make some MobGrindingUtilities contraptions
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.42.subti: You've reached another milestone. This unstable construct might prove useful into the creation of powerful fuels. Required to unlock the 4th Age
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.43.title: Getting into the 21st century
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.43.subti: The Pity Machine Frame will be the base for your first machines
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.44.title: Latex, not that complex
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.44.subti: The Tree Fluid Extractor will be used to make Latex. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.44.descr: If you read this it mean you're about to enter into The Amazing World of Plastic™. To obtain this material, you'll need a great substance called Latex. Let's learn some things about it.

The Tree Fluid Extractor is a machine added by Industrial Foregoing. When a wood log is placed in front of the black side of the Tree Fluid Extractor, the Tree Fluid Extractor will slowly break the log and generate Latex in its internal tank. For every 5 ticks 1 mB of Latex will be generated and there will be a 0.5% chance of the log's breaking progress being increased by 1.

We recommend you to make more then one of these machines as having just one, can slow you down quite a lot. Keep in mind that the Fluid Extractor does NOT require RF/FE in order to function. However, providing a healthy amount of power to it will make the machine run faster.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.45.subti: Destroying the Environment. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.45.descr: By combining 9 pieaces of Tiny Dry Rubber in a crafting table, you cna obtain a chunk of Dry Rubber.
By smelting this chunk in a furnace, you can obtain Plastic. This material will be used in lots of machines, so you better automate the production of this.

The Reward for finishing this quest, will be a Configurator. This tiny item, can be used as a multi-use Wrench. Just make sure it has power and use Shift Scroll to change its modes. For now, you'll be able to use it to remove/rotate certain machines with ease.
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.46.title: Advanced Machinery are EVIL!
ftbquests.chapter.Gear_3.quests.46.subti: This machine will allow you to make advanced machines, far superior to what you've been using until this point. Left Click for more info
