It looks similar to a chest inventory, but it can be searched, sorted, scrolled through, and shows all items of one type as a single stack, even if there are thousands of them. It also has 3 Crafting Greeds available for you to use as you please. It's basically a Crafting Terminal on steroids. In order to access a drive array, the dashboard must be set to the same frequency as the drive array.
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.16.su: It has 128 item types and 16,000 item slots available
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.17.su: It has 256 item types and 128,000 item slots available. NEVER use the previous tier of QIO Drives to craft the current one if you have items stored on them. You'll loose all of your items!
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.18.su: It has 1,024 item types and 1,048,000 item slots available. NEVER use the previous tier of QIO Drives to craft the current one if you have items stored on them. You'll loose all of your items!
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.19.su: It has 8,192 item types and 16,000,000,000 item slots available. NEVER use the previous tier of QIO Drives to craft the current one if you have items stored on them. You'll loose all of your items!
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.20.su: Yet Another Wireless Terminal. The Portable QIO Dashboard is exactly the same as a regular QIO Dashboard, but it, as the name suggests, portable. It will give you access to the QIO System from any point in space and time. It has to be set to the same frequency as the System in order to work properly
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.21.su: The Started Battery is a capacitor added by Powah and it will be the first Tier, out of 7. It will provide 45M RF capacity and a transfer rate of 100kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.22.su: The Hardened Battery will provide a storage capacity of 100M RF with a transfer rate of 300kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.23.su: The Basic Battery will provide a storage capacity of 75M RF with a transfer rate of 150kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.24.su: The Blazing Battery will provide a storage capacity of 135M RF with a transfer rate of 500kRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.25.su: The Basic Battery will provide a storage capacity of 155M RF with a transfer rate of 1MRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.26.su: The Basic Battery will provide a storage capacity of 225M RF with a transfer rate of 4MRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.storage_4.quests.27.su: The Basic Battery will provide a storage capacity of 185M RF with a transfer rate of 2.5MRF/t
ftbquests.chapter.testing.title: Testing
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.title: The End
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.0.title: The Chaos Prism
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.0.subti: Mastering all the other worlds, by defeating their main Boss, gave you the resources for accessing the final dimension, The End. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.0.descr: To access the End, you'll need the 12 special eyes which can be obtained from the previous boss fights.
Basically, finishing all the dependencies of this quest, will mean that you should have all the eyes.
If you somehow managed to lose one of the eyes, you'll have to rely on the creative mode to get it back.
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.1.title: The End
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.2.title: The Ender Dragon
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.2.subti: Ending Jean's Suffering. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.2.descr: First-off, unlie other packs, this Ender Dragon Boss Fight, won't be like a vanilla experiance, due to the Savage Ender Dragon Mod.
In this pack, the Ender Dragon will be much harder to defeat due to its increased Health, high damage, ability to summon lightning and the ability to summon mobs such as:
- Mutant Enderman
- Mowzie's Mobs Naga
- Bazaltz
- Blizz
- Blitz
- Wildfire
- Minotaur
Additionally, the End Crystals which provide regeneration to the Ender Dragon, may respawn at random.
Here are some items you should prepare for this fight:
- Prepare lots of RF and Mana
- Flugel Tiara
- An Enchanted Flux-Infused Armor set (it has 4 shields which will block up to 500 incomming damage)
- An Echanted Flux-Infused Bow (it will have very accurate shots)
- A Flux-Infused Quiver (will provide infinite ammo, as long as it has power - the arrows will be extremely fast and accurate)
- A Blood Pandant infused with Regeneration
- A Ring of Musphelheim
- Astral Sorcery Skills
- A strong Melee Weapon
Also, a strategy which you can use would be:
- Break all the End Crystals as they reappear
- Do not enter in contact with the Mutant Endermans
- Try do deal as much damage as possible to the Ender Dragon, using ranged attacks
Finally, you should know that NO REGULAR ENDERMANS will spawn on the End's Main Island - ever. Explore the End's other Islands for them.
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.3.subti: Defeat an Enderiophage to get a Capsid. Capsids will be an important part of the Void Worm summoning process
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.4.title: Traveling
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.4.subti: Leave the main island through a Vanilla Gateway
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.5.title: Find an End City
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.5.subti: City? More like a tower: Find an End City and obtain some unique items from it
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.6.title: The Chaos Island
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.6.subti: No risk, no reward. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.6.descr: Even tho you can physically finish this quest while you're in the 3rd Age, you should wait until the 4th one, and you obtain a Chest Piece from Draconic Evolution.
Finding a Chaos Island withtout propper protection, will 100% result into your instant Death.
Now, the Chaos Islands can be found in The End, at every interval of 10000 blocks from the Main Island. It is the home of the Chaos Guardian. The Strongest Boss Modded Minecraft has ever Seen.
While you can go to every combination of 10000 coordonates, for now, go towards X:10000 Y:0.
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.7.title: The Chaos Conduit
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.7.subti: Master The End. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.7.descr: The Chaos Guardian might be the Stongest Boss Modded Minecraft has ever Seen.
The Chaos Guradian is a large Red Dragon, similar to the Ender Dragon, but much more powerful. So powerful, that it will kill a player which has A Meka-Suit with just one hit.

The attacks dealt by the Chaos Guardian will, in fact, cut through most armors, except for the Chast Pieces provided by Draconic Evolution and the Dark Matter, Red Matter and the Gem Armors from ProjectE. Since you probably don't have access to the ProjectE sets, you'll have to obtain a Chest Piece from Draconic. We recommend the Draconic one.
However, know that the Guardian has the ability to rapidly drain any RF powered Armor of its charge so it will quickly render your Chast piece useleff if you don't keep it charged.

Like the Ender Dragon, the Chaos Guardian has several Healing Crystals spread around the Island. However, unlike the regular Ender Crystals, these will keep the Guardian from receive damage entirely. They'll also be very hard to destroy. They each have several hit points. When damaged, they'll protect themselves with a shield for several seconds. You must disable all of them before you can start damaging the Guardian. A highly upgraded Draconium Chest Piece, Draconic Sword and Draconic Bow are adviced for this battle.

After defeating the Guardian, you can claim you reward. Inside of the Chaos Island, there will be an Obsidian Chamber which will be the home of a Chaos Crystal. It can be harvested only after the Guardian was defeated. Breaking the Crystal will drop several Chaos Shards. These Shards will be required to progress further.
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.8.subti: Arkham Gliding: The Elytra will allow you to glide just like Batman would. Rockets can be fired in mid air for a nice boost. It can be upgraded in certain ways
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.9.title: Thallasium
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.9.subti: Thallasium is a pretty regular Metal in the End. Obtain it to progress further into your Adventure
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.10.subt: A little disgusting.. Place a Crimson Mosquito Larva in a Capsid and watch how it turns into a Mysterious Worm
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.11.subt: If you toss that worm in the void..then.. good luck. This action will result into a Boss Fight which you might wanna be prepared for
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.11.task: Just toss the mysterious worm in the void
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.12.subt: Defeat the Void Worm and obtain its drops. With them, craft a Dimensional Carver which is a Pickaxe so powerful that, when it's used by holding Right-Click, will mine a portal through the space-time continuum. Passing through the Portal, will get you to your spawn point
ftbquests.chapter.the_end.quests.13.subt: The Dragon Heart is one of the drops given by the Ender Dragon when it's defeated. It can be used to awaken the potential of the Draconium Ingot and advance further into Draconic Evolution
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.title: The Nether
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.3.su: This Larva might prove to be useful later
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.4.su: Encounter this gross creature in the depths of The Nether
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.5.su: Well, what do you know? You can't open the portal. And even if you could, there's no way you're entering the Nether until this quest is finished. So yeah. Get to work. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.5.de: If you're reading this, it means that you must probably be at the point where you want to enter the Nether, or where you're just wondering \"Hmm, how do I enter the Nether?\". Well, unfortunately for you, things are a little complicated here.
Long story-short, a Nether Portal can be lit only with a Reaper's Scythe from Eidolon. Now we can start going around, trying to add some lore to this whole thing, but you know what? We're lazy.

So, here's what you have to do. If you haven't already, start working with the Eidolon mod. When you get the Reaper's Scythe, come back here and finish this quest. After that you'll receive the ability to go into the Nether, because yeah, right now, even if you manage to find a lit Nether Portal, you'll not be able to go into the Nether cuz yeah, we're mean. So start praying to The Dark Lord and you might get some help from them ☻.
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.5.ta: Use The Reaper's Scythe to light The Nether Portal
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.7.su: Obtain Ancient Debris to start making Netherite which is a very strong material, even better then Diamond
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.9.su: Obtain three Wither Skeleton Skulls to summon the Wither and basically doom yourself. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.9.de: There are many ways in which you can get these Skulls faster.
- For starters, you can use a Wither Bee, but you'll have to obtain one
- You can kill Wither Skeletons with a weapon enchanted with Vorpal (this enchantment can only be found in dungeons)
- You can kill Wither Skeletons with the Axe of Cleaving. This will bost the drop chance, but not a lot
- You can craft them, however, that will be quite expensive
Note that you can summon Wither Skeletons using a ritual from Eidolon.
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.10.s: Is it power, or is it fire?
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.11.s: Mastering The Nether. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.11.d: You've got the Skulls? Great. Now, before summoning the Wither (yeah, of course you have to defeat the Wither, what do you expect from this pack?) we want to take a brief moment to give you some tips on how to defeat this thing easier.

We recommend to get your hands on the Sanguine Praetor Armor from Sanguine Arsenal. This thing was designed with the Wither boss fight in mind. Look in the 'Protection - 1' tab to see more info about it. Apart from this armor, you can also obtain the Sanguine Amulet from Eidolon, which will store some health for you to use later. Apart from this, make sure you have a very strong weapon. This might be obtained either through Tinker's Construct, or the Hexblades mod.
With that being said, good luck! We'll see you on the next Age.
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.12.s: You may use them to find and even light the End Portal. However, these will not help you reach The End. Anyway, this can only be obtained at a runic altar
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.13.s: Magma Cream will be one of the ingredients required for the Nether Grout recipe. It can either be found through the Nether's Dungeons, or it can be crafted with Blaze Powder and some SlimeBalls
ftbquests.chapter.the_nether.quests.14.s: Obtain Soul Sand to make Nether Grout
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.title: Tools - 1
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.0.subti: I like building with Obsidian! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.0.descr: The Pickaxe of Inversion is a pretty amazing tool. As its name says, it will invert the time required to break blocks. This means that blocks such as stone/dirt, which normally take a short time to break, will now be mined extremely slow, while blocks such as obsidian, will be mined almost instantly.
PS: No, you can't use it to break bedrock.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.1.subti: The Axe of Cleaving is a powerful weapon added by Eidolon. Apart from being just a very powerful Axe, it also had the ability to decapitate mobs, such as Wither Skeletons, with relative ease. Out of 10 Wither Skeletons, one should drop a Skull - don't be surprised if you're really unlucky. Make sure the last blow dealt to your enemy, is a critical hit
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.2.subti: The Sword of Sapping is one of Eidolon's most powerful items. As its name suggests, when used on a mob, its life will be drawn from it and transfered to you. Tip: Press \"u\" on an Iron Sword to see the recipe
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.3.title: The Vanilla Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.3.subti: Tinkers Construct is NOT for me! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.3.descr: You want the vanilla tools? You need treated wood.
Keep in mind that this quests is here just to let you know that the vanilla tools are made with treated sticks.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.3.tasks: Vanilla tools are made with treated sticks
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.4.subti: Eidolon's main weapon. It deals lots of damage when you right click with it. Recommended against The Wither
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.5.subti: Similar to the Soulfire Wand, however, you'll quickly find out that it has the ability to truly chill your enemies
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.6.title: Steel Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.6.subti: The Steel tools will be better the the regular, iron tools, but they won't be able to break obsidian, like the diamonds ones would
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.7.title: Neptunium Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.7.subti: These tools will grant certain advantages under water. Ps: the hoe will keep the tilled soil moist
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.8.title: Kama - Carved
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.8.subti: Hoe + Scythe = LOVE. The Kama is a combination between a how and a scythe and it has some interesting abilities. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.8.descr: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a kama using tool parts carved at a Part Builder, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.9.title: Kama - Casted
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.9.subti: This one, too. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.9.descr: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a kama using tool parts casted at a Tinkers Smeltery/Foundry/Melter/Alloyer, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.10.subt: Your regular pickaxe, now custom made from solid materials. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.10.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a pickaxe using tool parts carved at a Part Builder, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.11.subt: Your regular axe, now carved from solid materials. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.11.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made an axe using tool parts carved at a Part Builder, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.12.subt: Your regular Sword, now carved from solid materials. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.12.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a sword using tool parts carved at a Part Builder, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.13.subt: Axe and Shovel, now combined. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.13.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a mattock using tool parts carved at a Part Builder, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.14.subt: A quick, short wapon, capable of dealing damage from both hands. Useful as a secondary weapon. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.14.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a dagger using tool parts carved at a Part Builder, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.15.subt: The Pickaxe was never so modular. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.15.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a pickaxe using tool parts casted at a Tinkers Smeltery/Foundry/Melter/Alloyer, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.16.subt: Lumberjacks would be jaelous. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.16.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made an axe using tool parts casted at a Tinkers Smeltery/Foundry/Melter/Alloyer, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.17.subt: Assasins need strong tools. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.17.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a dagger using tool parts casted at a Tinkers Smeltery/Foundry/Melter/Alloyer, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.18.subt: This one is now made from metal, too. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.18.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here merely to keep track of what you did. If you've made a mattock using tool parts casted at a Tinkers Smeltery/Foundry/Melter/Alloyer, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.19.subt: Vanilla Sword, in the classic tinker style. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.19.desc: Keep in mind that this quests is here just to keep track of what you did. If you've made a sword using tool parts casted at a Tinkers Smeltery/Foundry/Melter/Alloyer, you can consider this quest, complete.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.20.subt: This Katana will serve as the base for the FrostBrand. Left Click for the recipe
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.20.desc: Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
You'll need Shadow Infused Nuggets and Ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.21.subt: This Sword will serve as the base for The Tongue of Asar. Left Click for the recipe
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.21.desc: Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.22.subt: This Saber will serve as the base for the Fang of the Kraken. Left Click for the recipe
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.22.desc: Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.23.subt: This Hammer will serve as the base for the Earth Destroyer. Left Click for the recipes
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.23.desc: Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
You'll need Shadow Infused Nuggets and Blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.24.subt: This Dagger will serve as the base for the Lightning Slasher. Left Click for the recipe
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.24.desc: Recipes won't be visible on Multiplayer, so here you go:
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.25.subt: When you right-click with this weapon in your hand, it will unleash its powers and will inflict slowness on your enemies when you attack them. Keep in mind that the weapon's abilities won't last forever. The time they'll last will be displayed on the weapon's durability bar. Killing enemies will give you more time before the weapon's powers are depleated and the weapon has to recharge
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.26.subt: The FrostBrand is the final form of the Chillrazor and, similarly to it, the FrostBrand will slow down your enemies when you attack them, however, the slowness inflicted by this version of the weapon will be much stronger then the previous one. This version of the weapon also has to recharge after some time
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.27.subt: When you right-click with this weapon in your hand, it will unleash its powers which will set your enemies on fire when you attack them. Additionally, it will give you fire resistance. Keep in mind that the weapon's abilities won't last forever. The time they'll last will be displayed on the weapon's durability bar. Killing enemies will give you more time before the weapon's powers are depleated and the weapon has to recharge
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.28.subt: The Tongue of Asar is the final form of the Nether BroadSword and, similarly to it, the Tongue of Asar will set your enemies on fire when you attack them, however this version of the weapon will make the fire last for a longer period of time. Additionally, this version will give you fire resistance peranenetly. This version of the weapon also has to recharge after some time
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.29.subt: When you right-click with this weapon in your hand, it will unleash its powers which will allow you to breath underwater for a limited amount of time. Keep in mind that the weapon's abilities won't last forever. The time they'll last will be displayed on the weapon's durability bar. Killing enemies will give you more time before the weapon's powers are depleated and the weapon has to recharge
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.30.subt: The Fang of the Kraken is the final form of the Cutlass of Waves and, similarly to it, the Fang of the Kraken will give you water breathing, however this version of the weapon will also give you dolphin's grace, both permanently. Additionally it will also give you conduit power for a limited amount of time. This version of the weapon also has to recharge after some time
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.31.subt: When you right-click with this hammer, it will start dealing more damage and knockback to your enemies. Additionally, if shift right-click it used, the hammer will be switched to mining mode, which will allow you to break blocks like stone more easier. The hammer's abilities are not permanent and the time they'll be available will be displayed on the hammer's durability bar
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.32.subt: The Earth Destroyer is the final form of the Rockbane. It will does more damage and knockback to your enemies. Additionally, it will have a greater mining speed
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.33.subt: Unlike other weapons added by Hexblades, these two will be more special as they'll be made by infusing a Hexium Dagger in a ritual. When one of them is used in the right hand and the other in the left hand, one of them will become a melee weapon, whhile the other will become a ranged weapon. Keep in mind that they'll have to be used together in order to work properly
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.34.subt: The Lightning Slasher and the Lightning Caller are the final versions of the Thunder and Bolt Daggers. These two will deal more damage and will recharge faster then their previous versions
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.35.subt: Infused with a nether star, the Sanguine Witherer can drain more life out of you foes. Additionally, it will give you night vision when you right click with it. Tip: Press \"u\" on the Sword of Sapping to see the recipe
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.36.subt: Sanguine Arsenal's main weapon. An upgraded version of the SoulFire Wand, the Scepter of Blood can be used both as a melee, and as a ranged weapon. It also has more durability. The Sanguine Praetor Armor will be required for the ranged attack to work. Tip: Press \"u\" on the SoulFire Wand to see the Scepter's recipe. 25 Hearts of living creatures will be required to make the Ritual
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.37.subt: Maximum building range of 9. Has infinite durability
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.39.subt: With the Slimesling, you can launch yourself in the distance, at large speeds
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quests.40.subt: The Praetor's Scythe is a very powerful weapon. It has two passive features and an active one. When you land a hit on multiple mobs with it, the damage will be equal to all the targets affected. It's like it has Sweeping Edge 10000. It is also very fast, so if you get cornered in a situation, feel free to land hits as fast as possible to get out. Its active feature is exclusive to a user that's wearing the Sanguine Praetor Armor. When Blood is available on the Blood Bar, you can launch the Scythe with Right-Click. It will target the closest agressive mob to its launch point. After hitting its target, it will return to you, just like a boomerang. Tip: Press \"u\" on the Reaper's Scythe to see the Scythe's recipe. 40 Hearts of living creatures will be required to make the Ritual
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.title: Tools - 2
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.0.title: ManaSteel Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.0.subti: Similar to iron tools, however, these will use mana to repair themselves. Similar to other tools which run on RF, however, these will break if their durability is low enough
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.1.subti: The 13x13 PowerDrill: By default, the Terra Shatterer is simply a powerful pickaxe. However, as you store more and more Mana into it, the radius in which it can mine when you righ-click with it, will increase. Mana will repair it
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.2.title: Crystal tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.2.subti: The Rock Crystal tools can have different stats based on their attributes. The Rock Crystals used in a tool's recipe will directly affect the final tool's stats. Some can have lots for durability points, some have better efficiency and some, can have better damage
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.3.subti: The Terra Truncator can cut down entire trees at once, at the cost of large amounts of Mana. Left click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.3.descr: The Terra Truncator, as previously said, will chop down entire trees in just one swipe.

However, this tool does not make exceptions when it comes to the wood pieces present in your base. You'll need a stone of temperance in your inventory for the Truncator to stop using its amazing abilities. When you have the stone in your inventory, just right-click with it to turn it on.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.4.subti: Terrari-oh..wrong game?: The Terra Blade is a legendary weapon which will launch mana from the user's inventory to create powerful projectiles that will deal lots of damage to their enemies. To launch bursts, just left-click with the TerraBlade in hand. This sword will also repair itself using mana from the player's inventory
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.5.subti: Biodiesel Miner. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.5.descr: The Mining Drill is a tool powered by Biodiesel, and can be filled directly from a Refinery.

When crafted, it does not come with a Drill Head. It needs either an Iron Drill Head or a Steel Drill Head installed. To install a Drill Head, the Mining Drill should be placed in an Engineer's Workbench, and the corresponding Drill Head should be placed in the top of the four \"upgrade slots\" (shift-clicking should work though, too).

The Mining Drill can be used without a Drill Head, however, it is slower and less efficient than a Wooden Pickaxe, and not very well worth it. The Drill Head will determine the mining area, level, speed, attack damage and durability of the Mining Drill. Steel is better than Iron, but both are much better than using no Drill Head whatsoever.

The Mining Drill has a special hitting animation. Although it makes each hit look slower, it is nothing but visual.The Mining Drill does not work underwater- for this, a Pressurized Air Tank upgrade is needed.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.6.subti: 'Not really a chainsaw' - Ciscod. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.6.descr: The Buzzsaw is a tool powered by Biodiesel, and can be filled directly from a Refinery.

When crafted, it does not come with a Saw Blade. It needs either Rockcutter Blade, or a Saw Blade installed. To install a Blade, the Buzzsaw should be placed in an Engineer's Workbench, and the corresponding Blade should be placed in the top of the three \"upgrade slots\" (shift-clicking should work though, too).

The Blade installed will determinate the type of blocks that can be harvested with the Buzzsaw. A Rockcutter blade will allow the Buzzsaw to dig through stone like a Pickaxe enchanted with Silktouch would. On the other way, this blade will NOT allow the Buzzsaw to chop down trees. To start harvesting entire forests, you'll need the Sawblade. With this one, the Buzzsaw will chop trees from one blow, so good luck at deforesting. Haha, just don't forget to replant the trees <3
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.7.subti: The Extendo Grip is a tools for all the minecrafters who feel like their hands are too short. Holding this tool in your left hand, will allow you to have extended reach
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.8.title: Psimetal Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.8.subti: These tools can be infused with custom spells to make them more potent
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.9.subti: The Vitreous Pickaxe is as cheap as it is useful. It will allow you to get back your glass, just like a tool enchanted with Silk Touch would
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.10.subt: Blockhead Cowboy. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.10.desc: The Revolver is a ranged weapon which shoots Cartridges.
To load the gun, shift right-click with the Revolver in hand to open its GUI. Only one Cartridge/item can be put into each of the 8 slots.
Right-clicking with the gun in hand will make it shoot. When a Cartridge is used, the Empty Casing or Empty Shell will remain behind.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.11.subt: Electric Hunter. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.11.desc: The Railgun is a ranged weapon which shoots various items as ammunition:

The Railgun does not need to be loaded; it will automatically grab ammunition from items in the inventory, displayed as being in the \"slot\" in the UI (bottom right corner). This works much like a bow, in terms of ammunition.
A Charging Station, or any other FE/RF Charger will be required to keep the Railgun functional. While in the player's inventory, the player can view the Railgun's charge level.

Holding down right-click with the Railgun in hand will \"charge\" it (not to be confused with FE/RF charging). Once the charge level (the number on the Railgun in-game) is at 99, it can be released. Each use of the Railgun costs 800 RF.

Railgun charging takes time, though; it is not instant, and different materials and shapes incur more required charge time, although when fully charged, it will make various electrical noises. There is no overcharge, nor a limit to how long you may hold a projectile.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.12.subt: Pyro? Is that you?! 0_o Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.12.desc: The Chemical Thrower is a ranged weapon which shoots various fluids:
- Water: Extinguishes fire and hurts Blazes
- Creosote Oil: Gives the Flammable potion effect which will make enemies take more damage from fire
- Biodiesel: Gives the Flammable potion effect which will make enemies take more damage from fire
- Liquid Concrete: Will make Quick Dry Concrete which can be used to suffocate your enemies

To load the Chemical Thrower, the player may fill it with a liquid using a machine such as the Bottling Machine, right-click on a tank or barrel containing a valid liquid, or place it into the orange slot of a machine which outputs liquid (such as the Coke Oven for Creosote Oil).
Right-clicking with the Chemical Thrower in hand will make it spray. It will consume 20 mB a tick while spraying.
By shift right-clicking with the Chemical Thrower in hand will toggle \"pilot light mode\". In this mode it will apply ignition to the liquid if it is flammable.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.13.subt: Sick of making the perfect bow, just to have it break later in the game? The LivingWood Bow will repair itself if its user has mana in their inventory. Similar to an electric bow, however, if no mana is provided to it, it will eventually, break
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.14.subt: Its large. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.14.desc: The Cleaver is a sword-like weapon made with two tough tool rods, a large plate, and a large sword blade. They swing very slowly due to the massive size, giving you Mining Fatigue III, but do more damage than most other weapons. They have the natural ability to sometimes decapitate mobs(beheading) , leaving their heads as an item drop to wear, or to use as a decoration. This works on zombies, creepers, skeletons, wither skeletons and other players.
Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.15.subt: The Sledge Hammer is a broad mining tool. It harvests blocks in a wide range. It is also effective against undead
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.15.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.16.subt: The Vein Hammer is a broad mining tools. It harvests many connected blocks of the same type, perfect for ores
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.16.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.17.subt: The Braod Axe fells small trees in a single swing, and makes quick work of large trees. It makes for a powerful heavy weapon. Timber!
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.17.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.18.subt: The Excavator is braod digging tool. It digs up large areas of soil and snow in a wide range. Terraforming!
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.18.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.19.subt: The Scythe is a broad reaping tool, mowing down plants in a wide area. Right Click will harvest and replant crops
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.19.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.20.subt: The Cleaver is now made of metal
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.20.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.21.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.22.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.23.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.24.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.25.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.26.subt: The Potato Cannon will launch well.. potatoes, to deal massive damage to its targets. Usign poisonous potatos instead of regular potatoes, will inflict poison to the target. The Cannon can be enchanted with Potato Recovery for a better chance as receiving back your potatoes
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.27.subt: The Rapier is a weapon which relies on speed to defeat its enemies. By default, it has the ability to puch you backwards when you right-click with it. Additionally, it will deal more damage to enemies which don't have a Chestplate
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.27.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.28.subt: The Rapier, now made of casted metals
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.28.desc: Keep in mind that this quest is here just to let you know that this tool exists and that you can make it. Finishing this quest doesn't actually mean you did what you had to.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.29.subt: Infinite Water: By consuming Mana from a player-carried Mana Tablet, the Rod of the Seas can create a Water source block in a targeted area. It can also be used to refill a Petal Apothecary. Both of these abilities consume 75 Mana per use
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.30.subt: The Upwards Propeller: By using Mana from a player-carried Mana Tablet, the Rod of the Skies propels the player into the air at a very high velocity. When the Rod is given to a Livingwood Avatar, every time a player jumps in a 13x13 area around the Avatar they will be launched 35 blocks up and given the Feather Feet effect for 5 seconds
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.31.subt: The Fire Circle: By using Mana from a Mana Tablet in the player's inventory, the Rod of the Hells will cast a circle of red fire clouds around the player, and any entity including the caster will burn inside the circle
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.32.subt: Infinite Dirt: The Rod of the Lands will consume Mana from the player's inventory to create a Dirt block in the targeted area, using 75 Mana per block
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.33.subt: Did somebody say Terrafirmacraft? Oh, no? Oh...well. ANYWAY, you can flat large areas with this thing! Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.33.desc: The Rod of the Terra Firma will consume Mana from the player's inventory to flatten and level the ground to where the player is standing by either removing blocks, or placing dirt.

When the right-click is held down, the Rod will attempt to flatten the land in a 33x33x33 area. It will fill the area 17 blocks below the player by placing Dirt on top of any blocks it finds and will remove all natural blocks 16 blocks above the player. When filling, it will try to alter the land as naturally as possible. Blocks that have been removed by the Rod are permanently lost. The cost of removing or creating blocks is 55 Mana per block.
The Rod will not function if the player attempts to use it below the sea level.
Blocks affected by this process are: Dirt, Stone, Gravel, Sand, Grass, Mycelium, Podzol, Snow layers, Sandstone, Hardened Clay, Diorite, Granite and Andesite.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.34.subt: Infinite Cobblestone: The Rod of the Depths will consume Mana from the player's inventory to create a Cobblestone block in the targeted area, using 150 Mana per block
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.35.subt: Limited x-ray. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.35.desc: By consuming Mana from the player's inventory, the Rod of the Plentiful Mantle can show nearby ores.

When used, all ores in a 15 block radius around the player will be highlighted for a short time by colored particles visible through walls. Every color shows a single type of ore, but is different on every use. The Rod consumes 3,000 Mana per use.
When this rod is given to a Livingwood Avatar, ores in an 18 block radius will be revealed, using 3,000 Mana every 10 seconds. The colors will not be changed if the Avatar is not moved.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.36.subt: Instant Block Smelter: By consuming Mana from the player's inventory, the Rod of the Molten Core will smelt targeted blocks at a cost of 300 Mana per block smelted
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.37.subt: Block Swapper: By consuming Mana from the player's inventory, the Rod of the Shifting Crust can replace blocks of one type in its range with a different one from the player's inventory. Shift right-clicking a block with the Rod will set it as the target
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.38.subt: Well.. the title is pretty self explanatory, isn't it? It isn't?! Well... Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.38.desc: The Mana Blaster is portable Mana Spreader that the player can fire to shoot Mana bursts using Mana from a Mana Tablet in the player's inventory.

Compared to a Mana Spreader, Mana bursts fired by the blaster are 5 times faster, but hold 25% less Mana. When the Blaster is fired, the player will be affected by recoil proportional to the burst's velocity.

Mana Lenses can be used with the Blaster to provide it with their effects. To apply them, craft the blaster and the lens together. Lenses are removed by putting the blaster in the crafting grid by itself. The Tripwire and Flare Lenses cannot be applied. The Blaster can only hold a single lens. Applying a Lens Clip will allow the blaster to store 5 more - the active lens is changed by shift-right clicking with the blaster.
The Mana Blaster has a 1.5 second cooldown time before it can be shot again, shown by the durability bar. The cooldown is decreased by 8 ticks for every level of the Haste status effect.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.39.subt: Infinite Torches: When right clicked on a block, it places a light source. If there is already a light source present then it will be removed. When shift-right clicked on a block, it turns it into an unbreakable Translucent Block. Shift-right clicking on a translucent block reverts it to its previous state. The wand can be crafted with any dye to change the color of placed light sources
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.40.subt: Building Wand: It is used to aid block placement. While wielding the wand, sneak right-click on a block in the world to set it as the template block to place down. Aim at any block in the world to build a straight line of that block from the original block to yourself
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.41.subt: Block Exchanger: This wand can be used to replace blocks with other blocks. Shift right-clicking a block with it, will select that specific block, to be used as a replacement for other blocks, of course, if the player has that type of block in their inventory. While looking at the air and using shift right-click, the player can cycle between multiple AOE sizes
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.42.subt: The Arcane Grappeler..?: When the player right clicks with the wand, they are pulled in the direction they are looking
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.43.subt: Corvo's Blink: When the player right clicks with the wand, they'll be pushed in the direction they are looking. By shift right-clicking with it, the player can switch to the \"Blink\" mode. If the \"Blink\" mode is selected, the user will be teleported to a location, rather then pushed. The \"Blink\" mode will require more starlight to be used
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.44.subt: The Terra Harvester is a very powerful shovel. Similarly to the Terra Shatterer, the Harvester has two modes. In the Default mode, it will be a regular shovel, with the ability to make paths and till soil. If it's in your off-hand you can use it on crops as Bonemeal. When its Advanced mode is turned on (Right-Click), the Harvester will work in a 3x3 area. An Overwrowth Seed can be found in the world through loot chests
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.45.subt: The HPS is an upgraded version of the Vanilla Shield. Besides being more durable then the Vanilla Shield, it can also receive some upgrades at the Engineer's Workbench. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_2.quests.45.desc: There are 3 upgrades available for this Shield. However, it has only 2 upgrade slots, so you'll have to choose what you'll use. The upgrades are:
The Flashbulb: When your attack is blocked, the attacked will be blinded by a powerful Flash.
The Shock Emmiters: This upgrade will vaporize the incomming projectiles. It will also shock the attackers.

The Magnetic Glove: When this upgrade is installed on the Shield, you have the ability to double tap on the `S` key to get it in your off-hand as long as it is somehere in you inventory. Pressing the `S` key again, will return the Shield to its initial position.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.title: Tools - 3
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.0.subti: This sword can be infosed with Spells. It will apply a touch Spell before damaging its target. It will also add an Amplify Augment on the last effect included on a Spell
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.1.subti: Can be bound to a Spell at a Scribe's Table. After that, it can shoot arrows that, upon impact, will unleash the Spell bound to the bow. It can shoot with and without arrows in your inventory. If no arrow is present, a Mana Arrow with 0 damage will be shot. If an arrow is present and you have enough mana, that arrow will become a Mana arrow which will damage damage on impact. If you don't have enough mana, a regular arrow will be shot. If a Spell is not applied to the Bow, it will not shoot without regular arrows. This Bow can also use Augment Arrows to achieve unique spell effects
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.2.subti: After blocking a hit, you'll receive Mana Regeneration and spell damage for a short amount of time
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.3.subti: An upgraded version of the TerraShatterer. It will mine blocks on larger areas and it will also allow you to mine multiple blocks in the direction you're looking. This will not work while you're looking downwards
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.4.subti: The Alfblade is an upgraded version of the original Terrablade. It does more damage and it is also capable of faster swings, thus launching mana bursts much faster then before
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.5.subti: In addition to it being able to chop down trees in just one swing, it will also allow you to attract nearby dropped items by just shift right-clicking with it
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.6.subti: These tools have special abilities. Left click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.6.descr: Pickaxe: Will void stone, dirt, netherack, picking only valuable resources, such as ores.
Shovel: Will void blocks such as gravel, sand.
Hoe: Will moisten farmland regardless of proximity to water.
Shears: When holding right click, will shear all nearby sheep.
Sword: Has a chance to spawn pixies. The spawned pixies are much more stronger then the ones spawn by The Elementium Armor.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.7.subti: Electric Drill. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.7.descr: The Fluxbore is an upgradeable electric tool which is mainly used to break dirt and stone-like blocks.
Like with other items added by the Thermal Series, the Fluxbore can also be augmented at a Tinker's Workbench with different augments and integral components to enhance its abilities.

At least a Reinforced Integral Component has to be installed on this tool in order for it to be able to mine Obsidian. Aditionally, you can enchant the Fluxbore with Efficiency to make it mine faster, or with Holding to increase its energy storage capacity.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.8.subti: Electric Not-Chainsaw. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.8.descr: The Flux Saw is an upgradable electric tool which is mainly used to break leaves and wood-like blocks.
Like with other items added by the Thermal Series, the Fluxsaw can also be augmented at a Tinker's Workbench with different augments and integral components to enhance its abilities.
You can enchant the Fluxsaw with Efficiency to make it mine faster, or with Holding to increase its energy storage capacity.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.9.subti: \"Whosoever holds this hammer, if they be worthy, they shall possess the power of Thor.\" Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.9.descr: After obtaining this legendary weapon, you'll quickly find out that, although you have Thor's hammer, you're neither as strong, or as special as him.
Yeah, that's right, you're not worthy, so you can't pick up the hammer.
However, there might be a way of tricking the hammer into thinking that you ARE in fact worthy.

I think you'll be quite happy to hear that, through our experimentations, we've found out that the Absorption effect triggers the hammer's enchant. Wait until Odin hears about this.. 0_o. Anyway, long story short, the Absorption effect will allow you to use Mjöllnir's powers for short amounts of time. Make 'em count!
\"Wait, wait, wait.. what are those <abilities> again?\"

Well, you can hit bad guys with it. Also, you can throw it at your enemies and upon hitting them, Mjöllnir will summon a lightning bolt at them. You can also enchant it to make it deal more damage, return faster at you, or attack faster.
Ps: If you manage to obtain the Ring of Thor, you shall possess the power of Mjöllnir without any restrictions whatsoever.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.10.subt: The Crystal Bow will allow you to use mana as arrows, efficiently working as the Infinity Enchantment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.11.subt: Now that's Pyro! Left Click form more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.11.desc: The Flamethrower is a ranged weapon which uses Hydrogen gas as its fuel. It is fairly effective against mobs as it deals damage when they are directly hit with the stream and sets them on fire. It is most effective on large groups of mobs, where the user can hose down the entire group with fuel at a short distance.
The Flamethrower has multiple modes. You can switch between them by using shift scrol. The modes are:
- Combat: Damages mobs and sets them on fire. Destroys any items on the ground. Does not set fire to blocks nor damage them.

- Heat: Same as combat, but blocks/items that have a smelter recipe will be instantly converted into it. For example you can fire a short burst at iron ore block and a single ingot of iron will be dropped.
- Inferno: Same as combat, but blocks that the stream hits will be hit with blast damage and will usually be destroyed. Nearby blocks will be set on fire.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.12.subt: The Atomic Disassembler is a powerful mining tool, capable of Veinmining just about anything. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.12.desc: The Atomic Disassembler is Mekanism's an all-in-one tool, essentially the ultimate, electronic version of a paxel.  The Disassembler will replace your Pickaxe, Axe, Sword and Shovel. It will not replace your Shears.
This tool has more operating modes:
- Normal: Works as a diamond tool with efficiency II.
- Slow: Works as a diamond tool.
- Fast: Works as a diamond tool with effciency V.
- Vein: Mines an entire vein of ores, or can chop down a tree with a single swing.
- Off: Will not interact with the nearby blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.13.subt: By default, the Meka-Tool will be almost useless. However, it can receive a variety of modules to enable a wide range of functions. Like with the MekaSuit, you can configure the Meka-Tool's modules from the Configuration Menu which can be accessed with the \"\\\" key
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.14.subt: Electrum +++ Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.14.desc: Like with the other tools you've been using until this point, these ones will have special abilities too. Note that some of them have special abilities only when their Empowered Mode is enabled, while some of them also have some special abilities when they're not Empowered. So. Let's see what these beauties can do:

- Sword: When it's not Empowered will be just a regular, very powerful sword. When it is Empowered however, it will be able to launch piercing projectiles made of RedstoneFlux. Similar to how the Terrablade can launch mana projectiles when swung.

- Pickaxe: When it's not Empowered it will be able to place down light sources by just right-clicking with it. When it is Empowered, those light sources will be placed automatically when you're in a dark environment.

- Axe: When it's not Empowered it will be just a regular, very powerful axe. When it is Empowered however, it will receive a double critical damage which will be dealt as armor-piercing damage to your enemies. It can be extremely useful against armored enemies.

- Shovel: When it's not Empowered it will allow you to revert farmland or grass path, back into dirt. When it is Empowered will allow you to turn grass blocks into flux-infused path blocks which are faster to walk on.

- Shield: When it is not Empowered, will mainly be just a regular Shield which has the added ability to block incomming flux damage. When it is Empowered however, will release, upon blocking damage, a dispersion shield that will knock back all the nearby mobs.

- Fishing Rod: When it's not Empowered, it will be just a regular electric Fishing Rod, but when it is Empowered, it can be used to reel in hooked mobs with much greater control. The mob is unhooked if you attack it, or use the Rod again, while crouching.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.15.subt: Electric Bow? Never heard of it. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.15.desc: You're dealing with Redstone Arsenal. Of course there is a Bow in here. Ok, let's not waste any more time. What does this thing do?

When it is not Empowered, it will be just be a regular, very powerful bow, but when it is Empowered, it will shoot arrows at speeds soo high that, often, the arrows will reach their destination almost instantly.
Finishing the quest, will give you a Flux-Infused Quiver which will work perfectly with the Flux-Infused Bow. Let's see what it does exactly.

When it's not Empowered, it will produce flux arrows that will deal armor piercing damage. This essentially means that you're literally shooting RF/FE. When it is Empowered, it will produce flux arrows that defy gravity. This means that these arrows will not interract with any type of friction. For example, you'll be able to shoot them underwater without having to worry about them loosing their velocity.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.16.subt: Will allow the Meka-Tool to make grass paths and farm lands
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.17.subt: Allows the Meka-Tool to assemble your atoms at different points in spacetime. Yeah, this is just a fancy way of saying that this module will allow you to teleport around with ease
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.18.subt: Will increase the mining speed of the Meke-Tool on each type of block
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.19.subt: Will increase the attack damage of the Meka-Tool
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.20.subt: Will allow the Meka-Tool to use SilkTouch on all the mined blocks
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.21.subt: Will allow the Meka-Tool to easily harvest ore veins and chop down trees
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.22.subt: Will allow the Meka-Tool to cut leaves and harvest wool from sheeps
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.23.subt: Angel Dirt Block: The Rod of the Highlands is very similar to the Rod of the Lands, however, this one will allow you to place dirt blocks anywhere without requiring any block as a base
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.24.subt: Magic Gravity Gun: The Rod of the Shaded Mesa will allow you to pickup mobs and move them as you please. Just hold right-click on a mob to pick it up. By pressing left-click, you can throw the mobs in a distance
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.25.subt: Precision Missile Launcher: The Rod of the Unstable Reservoir will launch mana missiles at all the nearby hostile mobs at the cost of some mana
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.26.subt: The Starfury?: The Starcaller is a legendary sword that has a random chance to summon a rain of star particles at the location where a mob was hit
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.27.subt: Sherpened Lightning Rod: The Thundercaller is a powerful sword which will attack multiple mobs at once using a bolt of electricity
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.28.subt: Unlike a regular Crossbow, the Flux-Infused Crossbow can be charged up to three times. Left Click has to be used in order to fire. When it's Empowered, the Crossbow will fire all of its projectile at once in a vertical line
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.29.subt: The Flux-Infused Trident is basically just a regular Trident which works on electricity. However, when it is Empowered, it will allow you to execute a strong ground pound when you're falling and using the Left Click. Upon landing, the kinetic energy is used to deal armor piercing damage to nearby mobs. Synergizes with the riptide enchantment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.30.subt: Both of these tools will be able to dig stone/dirt in a 3x3 area, but the similarities kinda ender here. First, the Hammer can also be used as a weapon. When it's Empowered, its attack speed will be increased along with its damage. Now, the Excavator will always allow you to place matching earth-type blocks in its area of effect. However, when it's Empowered, its area of effect will be increased to 5x5
ftbquests.chapter.tools_3.quests.31.subt: The Terra Bow is an upgraded version of the Crystal Bow. It will consume mana to shoot arrows. It has an increased drawing speed. Finally, it will shoot 9 arrows at a time
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.title: Tools - 4
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.0.title: Dark Matter Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.0.subti: The Dark Matter Tools have no Durability. They can be charged with the 'Charge' key (bind it in the Controls menu) to increase their performance/area of effect. Finishing this Quest will give you a Dark Matter Hoe, a set of Dark Matter Shears and a Dark Matter Hammer. The Shears and the Hammer CANNOT be crafted, so think of them as Legendary Items
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.1.title: Red Matter Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.1.subti: The Red Matter Tools are they older brothers of the Dark Matter ones. They share most of the abilities of the Dark Matter Tools, but they're definitely more powerful/potent. Finishing this quest will give you a Red Matter Hoe, a set of Red Matter Shears and a Red Matter Hammer. The Shears and the Hammer CANNOT be crafter, so think of them as Legendary Items
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.2.title: Wyvern Tier Equipment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.2.subti: Draconic Modular Tools I. Left Click for more info
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.2.descr: Unlike previous incarnations of Draconic Evolution, in 1.16, the Tools are not as useful as they used to be. Not on their own. By default they'll be just like regular Diamond tools, maybe a little better. Don't worry, all of them can be upgraded with modules.

Using the 'Tool Modules' key on your keyboard (bind it in the Controls menu), you can access a tool's Modules Menu. Here' multiple Modules can be installed to increase their mining speed, attack damage and AOE.
This is the Wyvern set and it will provide 16 Module Slots. Be aware that some modules may take more then 1 Slot.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.3.subti: The Bows added by Draconic Evolution can be equipped with lots of Modules to alter their Projectile Velocity, Accuracy, Penetration, and more. These might be very useful in your battle with the Chaos Guardian. The Wyvern Tier Bow will provide 16 Module Slots
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.4.title: Draconic Tier Equipment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.4.subti: Draconic Modular Tools II: The Draconic Tools set will provide 30 Module Slots
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.5.subti: The Draconic Bow will provide 30 Module Slots. It will also allow you to use Draconic Tier Modules
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.6.subti: Think of the Draconic Staff of Power as a multi-tool. It combines the main Draconic Tier Tools to create a nice Moduler Item which can be used in pretty much any situation. It will provide 48 Module Slots
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.7.subti: The Infinity Drill is part of the Infinity Tools added by Industrial Foregoing. This is a Tier Based item. It gets upgraded to higher tiers as more and more energy is put into it. Use an Infinity Charger to put power into this things as fast as possible (given that you have enough power). Left Click with the drill in hand to drill blocks, consuming power. The Infinity Drill can use Biofuel much more efficiently than power so you can fill it with Biofuel to try and reserve power while using it. Shift Right Click with the Infinity Drill in hand to change the drill area. The Infinity Drill can be enchanted. Lastly, due to how much power the Drill can take in, you can also diable its charge capabilities, to lock it to a certain tier
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.8.subti: The Infinity Saw is part of the Infinity Tools added by Industrial Foregoing. This is a Tier Based item. It gets upgraded to higher tiers as more and more energy is put into it. Use an Infinity Charger to put power into this things as fast as possible (given that you have enough power). Left Click with the Saw in hand to Saw blocks, consuming power. The Infinity Saw can use Biofuel much more efficiently than power so you can fill it with Biofuel to try and reserve power while using it. Shift Right Click with the Infinity Saw in hand to change the Saw area. The Infinity Saw can be enchanted. Lastly, due to how much power the Saw can take in, you can also diable its charge capabilities, to lock it to a certain tier
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.9.subti: The Infinity Hammer is part of the Infinity Tools added by Industrial Foregoing. Like the Infinity Drill, the Hammer also has multiple Tiers indicated by the amount of Power stored in it. When Right Clicking with the hammer, a set of Vindicator Claws will merge from the ground dealing lots of damage. Biofuel Can also be inserted into the Hammer to consume it more efficiently then energy itself. Shift Right Click will allow you to change the Hammer's AOE, wheather its charging abilities are on/of and its ability to Decapitate mobs
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.10.subt: The Supremium Tools are modular tools added by Mystical Agriculture. While they don't have as many possibilities as other modular items, they have infinity durability, and besides they possibility of receiving one module at a time, they can also be Enchanted! Finishing this quest, will give you a Supremium Paxel, which is a Legendary Multi-Tool which cannot be crafted, or obtained in other ways
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.11.subt: Draconic Modular Tools III: The Chaotic Tools Tier will provide 48 Module Slots
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.12.subt: The Chaotic Staff of Power may be Draconic Evolution's most powerful tool yet. It will provide 80 Module Slots. Do your worst with it!
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.13.subt: Finally, the Chaotic Bow wil provide 48 Module Slots. It will also give you access to Chaotic Tier Modules
ftbquests.chapter.tools_4.quests.14.subt: The Katar and The Morningstar are part of the most powerful tools known to men, thus giving them the 'World Shapers' nickname
ftbquests.chapter.twilight_forest.title: Twilight Forest
ftbquests.chapter.twilight_forest.quests: Attempt at life II
Alternate totem of undying
Attempt at life
Can be found in loot chests in the forest
Strange \"torch\" launcher. Can be found in loot chests in Hollow Hills
This magnet can bring ores to the surface. This can be found in Hollow Hills
This item can be used as an elytra booster or just for achieving some distance between you and other mobs. Can be found in loot chests in the forest
Fiery Tools
While the sword will act like an enchanted sword with fire aspect, the pickaxe will melt mined blocks
Shiny
Fiery Armor
Molten Man: Will light attackers on fire while providing Diamond level of protection
With this focus, you can clearly see the maze
This charm will attempt to preserve your inventory
This Charm will attempt to preverse your armor and your hotbar
The Charm of Keeping will try to preserve your armor and the currently held item. It can be found in Hollow Hills or Labyrinths
Naga Armor
The Naga Armor has only two pieces. Wierd, right? However, these two pieces come enchanted, so that should compensate, right?
Naga! - Twilight
The Snake. Left Click for more info

It can be found in the Naga Courtyard. The Naga is a large snake-like creature, and deals 9 (Heart.svgHeart.svgHeart.svgHeart.svgHalf Heart.svg) points of damage when attacking and has 250 (Heart.svg × 125) health points. As the Naga sustains damage it will lose its large segments and move faster. If it is not attacked for a while it will begin to heal itself. The Naga is bound to its Courtyard and will lose interest if its targets move out of it.
Defeat The Naga
Questing Ram
Give the ram all the vanilla colored wool types
16 colored wools
The Boots Are Mine!
Defeat a RedCap Goblin in a small Hollow Hill
Defeat that Goblin
It was a RedCap Sapper
Defeat a RedCap Sapper in a medium Hallow Hill
What was that noise?
This will be a reward for helping the Questing Ram
Navigating the forest
A magic map will show you every location of the nearby bosses/creatures/dungeons
Give it to me
The Twilight Forest
Where all is magic
Reach the Twilight Forest and start searching for the main bosses found in there. You're main objective will be to defeat the Ur-Ghast, but for now, you'll have to look for the Naga.
Visit The Twilight Forest
Understanding The Fear
Aquiring a Looking Glass might open your vision towards the bright stars of The Twilight Forest. Left Click for more info
Look who's entering the Twilight Forest! Congrats! That's only.. if you're actually entering Twilight Forest.. if you're not, then.. yeah, we cheered you for nothing. But we DON'T REGRET IT!

Now, considering the fact that you're ready for the Twilight Forest, let's see how to build the portal, of course, if you're not familiar with it. Just a 2x2 pool of water surrounded by flowers. Throw a Sanguine Crystal in it and voilà! You've got a very strange and expensive soup. Well, not really.
After throwing that Sanguine Crystal into the Pool, a lighting should strike and the Portal to Twilight should be ready.
Star Observer
Bug Stomper
Defeat a spider in a hedge maze
Scepters of Power

These scepters are dropped by the Twilight Lich. These have special abilities and one is tronger then the other, but they have a random chance to be dropped by the Lich King after you defeat him, so to obtain all of them, you'll need to defeat multiple Lich Kings
The Twilight Lich
He's like...a wizard? Left Click for more info

The Twilight Lich can be found at the top of the Lich Tower, and will spawn as soon as the player reaches the top floor. During the first stage the Lich is surrounded by damage-immune shields and wields a Scepter of Twilight and will shoot Ender Pearl projectiles, as well as Fireball projectiles. The Ender Pearl projectiles can be reflected back at the Lich, removing a shield for every pearl the Lich is hit. In the second stage the Lich wields a Zombie Scepter and will summon Lich Minions or Zombies until there is no charge remaining in the Scepter. Once this stage begins both of the Twilight Lich Shadows will disappear for the rest of the fight. At this stage the Lich becomes vulnerable to attacks, but it is not recommended due to the Lich Minions that are constantly spawning. Once the Zombie Scepter is depleted, the fight progresses to its third or final stage and the Lich will wield a Golden Sword, fighting the player in hand-to-hand combat.
Defeat The Lich
MinoShroom's Maze
To finish this quest, you'll have to defeat the MinoShroom in his maze and then, eat the Meef Stroganoff dropped by him
Meal for a worthy warrior
With this legendary pickaxe, you are allowed to cheat through the Maze
Hydra gives upgrades
Hydra's drops include Fiery Blood and Hydra Chops. While the blood can be used to upgrade regular iron, thus creating a powerful ingot, the Chop will fill your stomach like no other food ever did
Alpha Yeti
But he's adorable :( Left Click for more info
The Alpha Yeti appears like a large Yeti but with six blue horns and red eyes. It has 200 health and is represented by a white boss bar. The Alpha Yeti resides in the Yeti Lair in the Snowy Forest.
Defeating the Yeti will reward you with alpha fur and, also, with the possibility of further progressing towards the Aurora Palace.
Defeat The Alpha Yeti
Yeti
It's an Yeti, duh
Defeat 1 Yeti
Arctic Clothes
Eskimo
Yeti Clothes
Yeti coating: Attackers will be chilled
Infrared homing. Left Click for more info
Arrows shot with this bow will scan their surrounding areas for potential entities to target, and home in on them.
It has a 50% chance to drop when the Snow Queen is slain, otherwise, the Tri-bow will be dropped.
Snow Queen
She's gorgeous. Left Click for more info

The Snow Queen spawns at the top of one of the towers in the Aurora Palace. The tower she inhabits has ice over rooms. She has two battle phases. In her first phase, she summons Ice Crystals. These mobs distract the player and allow her to regenerate her health. When her health drops to 125 health points, she will enter her second phase. In this phase, she extends her arms and shoots snow from her hands. She can also fly to the top of the chamber, then quickly fall to the ground, potentially crushing the player with her ice cloud.
Where did the other two come from? Left Click for more info

The Tri-bow is a weapon added by Twilight Forest. It functions similarly to a Bow, except that when fired, it will shoot 3 arrows while consuming 1 Arrow from the player's inventory. The three arrows it shoots are vertically aligned. When using modded or tipped arrows, only one of the arrows shot will hold the effect.
It has a 50% chance to drop when the Snow Queen is slain, otherwise, the Seeker Bow will be dropped.
Hydra - Hail Hydra

The Hydra is an immobile boss monster added by Twilight Forest. The Hydra is a serpent-dragon that spawns with 3 heads. Hydras can be found in a Hydra Lair, which are only found in Twilight Swamps, and Fire Swamps. The main body has 360 health points
Slay the Hydra
The Highlands
To reach the HighLands, you'll have to defeat The Ur Ghast, The Hydra and The Snow Queen
Defeat Twilight's 3 main bosses
The 'little' pick
Obtain the giant pickaxe from a giant located in the clouds. With the piackaxe, go to the troll caves
Defeat a Giant Miner in the clouds
The Lamp of Cinders
With the giant pickaxe, break the Giant obsidian Vault in the Mushroom Vault of a Troll Cave. With the lamp acquired, you can now move towards the Castle
Obtain the lamp
The Castle

Reaching the Castle will give you a nice reward. While holding the Earth Talisman in your inventory, it will give you the Geomancy effect, which will allow you to basically become Toph Beifong. If you have no idea who that is, too bad. Well, not really. It will allow you to throw and manipulate dirt blocks in a very cool way. Right-click to pick up blocks and shift right-click to pick up entire boulders. Left-click to push them forward
Go past the thorns
Open the Castle's door
Healing That Fear
Mastering The Twilight Forest. Left Click for more info
The Ur-Ghast is a boss monster added by Twilight Forest. It can be found at the top of a Dark Tower, and appears as a gigantic Ghast with many tentacles.
The Ur-Ghast has 250 health points. It can attack in three different ways:
- Fireball which does 16 damage
- Ghast Tear which does 3 damage
- Carminite Ghastlings which are minions that will assist the boss

There are multiple ways to damage the Ur-Ghast. One option is to use Ghast Traps scattered in the rooms connecting to the top of the Dark Tower. You can charge these traps by killing Ghastlings. After fully charging a trap, you can activate it with a redstone signal to critically damage the Ur-Ghast with a red beam.
Ranged weapons can also be used to damage the Ur-Ghast. A Twilight Scepter with a couple of Ender Pearls to recharge can destroy the Ur-Ghast quickly.
When the Ur-Ghast is defeated, a chest will appear where the boss originally spawned. This chest contains an Ur-Ghast Trophy, some Fiery Blood, and some Carminite.
Ok, assuming that you haven't defeated a Pharaoh yet, we'll see you in Atum next.
Defeat the Ur-Ghast and obtain its Fiery Tears
Knight's Tomb
Wait, it was just one all this time? Left Click for more info

The Knight Phantom is a floating boss monster added by Twilight Forest. This boss is found in a large room inside of the Goblin Knight Stronghold in groups of 6. They have 35 health points apiece. Each wears Phantom Helms, and Phantom Plates. They all move in the exact same way, dancing around the room and spinning in circles to confuse the player. Only one of these dancing figures is the real Knight Phantom: the real Knight Phantom can be determined by which one has a physical body—that is, more opaque than the others.
Slay at least one Knight Phantom
Open The Stronghold
To advance further, you'll have to defeat the Knight Phantoms in The Goblin Knight Stronghold. To open this structure you'll have to place a thropy previously acquired from The Naga or The Lich King
Successfully unlock the Goblin Knight Stronghold
Knightmetal arsenal
This strong arsenal might prove useful through Twilight
Phantom Armor
Ghostlike
Knightmetal Armor
Its armor, take it
ftbquests.chapter.unlocking_ages.title: Unlocking Ages
Focused around exploration and general resource gathering: To finish this Age, you'll have to make Steel, and a Reaper's Scythe. Also you'll have to defeat The Wither
Focused on initial automation: To finish this Age, you'll have to make Petcoke and Terrasteel. Also, you'll have to defeat The Ur-Ghast and a Pharaoh

Focused on advanced automation, exploration and expressiveness: To finish this Age, you'll have to make a Shattered Singularity and learn how to perform Botania Rune Rituals. Also, you'll have to defeat The Ender Dragon
Focused on hight tier resource manipulation and grinding: To finish this Age, you'll have to make an Infinity Ingot and a piece of Red Matter. Also, you'll have to defeat The Chaos Guardian
Focused on the production of creative items: Obtain every single creative item listed here to finish the pack. Good luck!
ftbquests.chapter.useful_items_1.title: Useful Items - 1
Adrenaline for later. Left Click for more info
The Sanguine Amulet will store hearts in its inventory for you to use later, when you take damage.

Although, not like the 'real thing', having this amulet will be, somehow, like having a total of 60 health points (default is 20). So what this amulet is actually doing is that, when your health is not full, it will try to fill your missing health points using what it has in its inventory, as fast as possible.

Keep in mind that, if the rate at which you take damage is faster then the rate at which the amulet gives you health, you WILL die. So it will not save you from being insta killed. Also, the amulet will stop from healing you, if it runs out of hearts.
The gravity belt will reduce overworld's gravity effects on you, thus allowing you to jump 2.5 blocks. It will also greatly reduce fall damage
Grants knockback resistance, and reflects the knockback inflicted by attackers
The Void Amulet will, somethimes absorb projectiles fired at you
Will double the damage delt by you, BUT any damage you're taking is quintupled. Usage of heavy armour is adviced
Arcane damage is neglected, meaning that you will be safe from damage sources which normally would pass through armor
While wearing this curios item, you'll be immune to the Nausea Effect. That will be, *cough*, extremely useful. Note that this item will NOT save your Xp levels due to a bug in the Eidolon mod
The cage will allow you to capture small mobs, such as chickens
Bamboo Spikes
No. No mob farms yet: The Bamboo Spikes will be usefull for defending your base. Useless in mob farms as their kill does NOT count as a player kill
The 'Robinet'. Left Click for more info
Faucets can transfer creosote oil from a Coke Oven to a barrel.
Bellows can push entities, that's considering they're provided with a redstone signal
No sleep during the day! Left Click for more info
The sleeping bag can allow you to pass the night time without setting your spawnpoint.
Also, if you're experienced with modded minecraft, well - unfortunately, comforts is installed but the hammocks are disabled.
If you wanna make it night time, you should check out Eidolon's Ritual of Moonlight.
Planters might prove to be a nice, also slightly different, way of planting crops
A crank can be used to give a redstone signal with a specific strenght
Cog blocks will act like a line of redstone, but in a block form
What time is it? The Clock Block is a nice, decorative clock
The spring launcher will launch entities in the air when given a redstone signal. It will also act as a trampoline while its active
Pedestals can display items as a trophy. It can also be used as decorative pillars. Just place them on top of eachother
This tiny curio will increase your reach

The Bat in a bucket can help you see all the nearby mobs for a moment. To obtain the bat, simply right click it with a bucket. To see the neaarby mobs, just release the bat from the bucket with right click
