Note that this functionality can essentially be used to move blocks as a substitute for Silk Touch. However, it will not be able to pickup certain blocks, such as Radioactive Waste Barrels.
Lastly, boxes cannot be unwrapped in any inventory—only when placed in the world.

It is an upgraded version of the Mana Spreader and allows for Mana bursts to travel longer without losing Mana. It can fire Mana bursts up to 20 blocks before suffering Mana loss compared to the 12-block distance of the standard Mana Spreader. The Elven Mana Spreader also fires Mana at a faster rate
My perfect machine settings

The Configuration card can be used to copy side configurations from one machine to another machine of the same type. You will be able to copy settings from, for example, a Crusher to a Crusher, but not from a Crusher to a Metallurgic Infuser
The key for the power. Literally. Left Click for more info

The Laser is a block primarily used in the ignition of a Fusion Reactor, but also digs through blocks, allowing it to be used in mining or farming setups, usually in combination with the Laser Tractor Beam. It does fire damage to mobs in the laser beam.
Additionally, Lasers can be used in combination with Laser Amplifiers to obtain a wireless energy transfer system.

Simply point a Laser at a Laser Amplifier and make sure that the Amplifier is set to be active only with a redstone signal. After that, the Amplifier should receive power in its internal buffer. You can use any universal cable to extract the power from the Amplifier, and send it to any place you need it. By using this system, you'll not loose any power, but keep in mind that the laser beam can and WILL hurt any mobs that pass through it.
However, if the Amplifier's internal energy buffer is filled up, you'll end up loosing power due to the fact that you Laser won't stop sending power to the Amplifier.
Finally, a Laser's beam will stop after 64 blocks from its starting point, which of course, is the Laser.
It will collect the energy received from other Lasers and will unleash it whenever you need it. It is an essencial component for starting the Fusion Reactor
When placed in front of a Laser, it will collect the blocks destroyed by the Laser in its internal inventory, so you cna easily collect them
The Certus Quartz Charger
Making Charged Certus Quartz more easier. Left Click for more info

Mining for Certus Quartz might be an easy thing, but mining for Charged Certus Quartz, it's not. So. What can you do? Fortunately, these two types of Quartz are not that different and all it takes to turn a piece of regular Certus Quartz into a Charged one, is well.. power.
That's where this nifty device comes in. The Certus Quartz Charger can turn a regular Certus Quartz, into a Charged Certus Quartz by using a healthy amount of power.
This machine can accept up to 4 AE2 Acceleration Cards as speed upgrades.
Making Factories II
This Tier Installer will turn any Basic Factory, into an Advanced one which will be able to perform five operations at a time
Making Factories III
This Tier Installer will turn any Advanced Factory, into an Elite one which will be able to perform seven operations at a time
Making Factories IV
This Tier Installer will turn any Elite Factory, into an Ultimate one which will be able to perform nine operations at a time
Banning the unworthy. Left Click for more info

The Security Desk can be used to manage the security settings of all the machines added by Mekanism. To do this you'll have to enable the Override feature of the desk. After that, you'll be able to select any of the security options present at the bottom of the Security Desk interface.

This Desk is also used to add any players to your Trusted list. The Desk has field where you'll type in the name of the player you want to trust. After that, you'll have to hit the checkmark to place that player on the list. If your machines are set to the \"Trusted\" mode, the players on your trusted list will be able to access them.

This machine can be used to exchange any ores into similar ores from other mods. For example, the Iron Chunks from Emendatus Enigmatica can be turned into Vanilla Iron using the \"forge:ores/iron\" tag. Left Click for more info
Finishing this quest, will give you the Dictionary. This tiny gadget can be used on any block to see what game tags it is associated with.

The FluxoMagnet is an electric alternative to the Ring of Magnetization from Botania. If you're having bad time obtaining mana, you should consider upgrading to this nifty gadget. It can be upgraded in a Tinker's Workbench to work on a larger area, or to hold more power. When has a filter installed, shift right-click with it to see the filter menu

The Alchemical Quiver can hold and infuse 80 arrows with 4.000 mB of any potion. To insert arrows into the Quiver, just right click with it in your hand. To take the arrows aout, just shift right-click with the Quiver. You can enchant the Quiver to make it hold a maximum amount of 280 arrows and 14.000 mB of potion

The Potion Infuser can be used to either apply potion effects on other mobs, or to apply them to yourself. Additionally, the Infuser has an \"Auto-Infuse\" mode available which can be used to apply small doses of potion to yourself
The Redprint can be used to copy and paste the side configuration of any machinne added by the Thermal Series
The Signalum Security Lock can be applied to any machine added by the Thermal Series to unlock its security panel and effectively select which players should/should not be able to access you machines

This augment will allow your machines to store the xp comming from their operations, or the world. When applied to a machine, an icon resembling an Insightful Crystal will appear on the machine's interface
This augment will scale the RF/FE storage and transfer rate by 4x
This augment will scale the RF/FE storage by 2x and the RF/FE transfer rate by 6x
This augment will scale the RF/FE storage by 6x and the RF/FE transfer rate by 2x
This augment will scale the liquid storage capacity of any tank from the Thermal Series by 4x. This includes machines, fluid cells, dynamos and items
This filter will be used in machines such as the Vacuumulator to indicate which items it should/should not pick up. It can also be applied on items such as the FluxoMagnet
Will make your machines run faster. This augment will increase the maximum RF/FE usage rate by 100%, but will scale the RF/FE used per operation by 1.1x

Will make your machines use less RF/FE. This augment will reduce the RF/FE required per operation, scaling it by 0.9x, but will also decrease the maximum RF/FE usage rate by 10%. This means that your machine will run slower, but will use less power

Will increase the change of a secondary output item to be produced. This augment will increase the chance of a machine such as the Induction Smelter to make a secondary output item, but will scale the energy usage by 1.25x
For machines such as the Induction Chamber, will reduce the chance of a catalyst to be used. This augment will scale the catalyst usage by 0.8x, but will also scale the energy usage by 1.25x
This augment will increase the area of effect of your tool/machine. Each augment added will increase the area of effect by one block in every direction
This augment will allow your machines to delete any excess non-primary item outputs
Will allow a Digital Miner to produce blocks as a replacement for the ores it gathers
Will reduce the amount of energy required by a machine in order to run
Will increase the processing speed of a machine, at the cost of more power being used
It will allow an Electric Pump to produce Heavy Water, instead of regular Water
Will silence the machine that has this upgrade applied
When installed on a machine, it will keep the chunk that the machine's in, loaded
Can be used in machines that use gases. This includes the Purification Chamber or the Chemical Injection Chamber
Can be used to turn Liquid XP/EssenceOfKnowledge/Essence into Xp orbs which you can collect. It is useful when combined with a tank holding large amounts of liquid xp

This augment can be used in the Phytogenic Insolator to instantly insert the valid outputs into the input slot. For example, if you're growing Wheat in the Insolator, this augment will make the Wheat Seed to be instantly added back to the input slot of the machine
Let's cast spells easier then before. Left Click for more info

The Spell Book is a powerful artifact added by Ars Nouveau. It allows its user to create and cast spells with ease. Since you've reached the point where you can get your hands on this amazing instrument, we'll tell you what it can do and how you can make your own spells.
When right-clicking with the Spell Book in hand for the first time, an interface will appear:
Let's see what each thing does in here:

Green - Here you'll fing the Notebook menu, the Color Picker Menu and the Familiars menu. The Notebook menu will open the Worn Notebook which is Ars Nouveau's guide book. The Color Picker menu is where you'll be able to choose the color of the spells you'll cast. The Familiar menu is where you'll be able to summon your current Familiars (find more about familiars in the 'Tablet of Binding' quest).

Yellow - Here you'll find your Glyphs. Think of them as spell components. There are 3 types of Glyphs: Form, Augment and Effect. The Form is the way a spell will be casted. The Effect is the outcome of a spell being casted and the Augment is bonuses/modifications of the previously mentioned Forms and Effects. When you open the Spell Book for the first time, some Glyphs will be available to you, but not all of them. To obtain more, you'll have to craft them and right-click them. Note that Glyphs are organized in 3 Tiers. For each Tier, you'll need the proper Spell Book. This Novice Spell Book will allow you to access only Tier 1 Glyphs. So. You want better Spells? Make a better Spell Book. Higher Tier Spell Books will also allow you to use lower Tier Glyps.

Aqua - Here's the Spell crafting field. Here you'll desing your Spells. To create a spell, you'll have to add Glyphs available above by left-clicking them. Each Spell must start with a Form Glyph. After that, you can add either an Effect Glyph, or combinations of Augment and Effect Glyphs. Each Spell can have a maximum amount of 10 Glyphs.
Light Blue - Here you can name your Spell, save your Spell and clear the Spell crafting field.
Magenta - Here you can seach through your available Glyphs.
Red - Here you can select your saved Spells. Each Spell Book can have a maximum amount of 10 saved Spells.
After creating a Spell, you can cast it by simply right-clicking the Spell Book.

Now, since Ars Nouveau has the ability to create very powerful Spells, there has to be a catch in using them. While holding the Spell Book in your hand, you might've noticed that a fancy magenta bar appears on your screen. That's you mana bar. Things are simple. The more potent your Spells are, the more mana will be consumed. Mana does regenerate on its own and there will be various means to increase the amount of mana you have and its regen rate, but for now, get used to what you have.
Lastly note that after creating your first Spell, you'll have to use the Open Spell Book key (bind it in your controls menu) to open the Spell Book again.
The Mage's Spell Book will allow you to use Tier 2 Spells
The Archmage Spell Book will allow you to use Tier 3 Spells
The Electric Pump has to be placed above a water source. It will slowly produce water. Additionaly, it can be used to obtain Heavy Water which has planty of uses through Mekanism.

It is the highest tier of Mana Spreader available and allows for Mana bursts to travel longer without losing Mana. The Gaia Mana Spreader can fire Mana bursts up to 48 blocks before suffering Mana loss, compared to the 20-block distance of the Elven Mana Spreader and the 12-block distance of the standard Mana Spreader
Will consume Source to provide Creative Flight to the nearby players. Unlike Astral Sorcery's Rituals, this one will be much more easier to set up
Will set the time to Day. This will skip to the next MC day and NOT rewind the time or anything

This Ritual will apply the bonemeal effect on the nearby blocks while Source is available for consumption. If a Bone Block is thrown into this Ritual, it will instead try to force the nearby baby animals to grow
Will set the time to Night. This will, of course, move to the next MC day
Will cause all the nearby animals to occasionally breed. This Ritual will use Source in order to work and will not have any effects if more the twenty animals are present nearby
Will convert nearby eligible entities into Bound Scripts, used for summoning a Familiar.  Learn more about the available familiars in their respective quest

Will allow you to essencially obtain X-ray for a limited amount of time. Just throw the block of your choice into the Ritual, start it and you'll be able to see your selected block with ease once you get close to it. If a Glyph of Extend Time is applied to the Ritual before starting it, you'll be able to see through blocks for 15 minutes
Will transform the nearby Archwood Trees into Weald Walker which, essentially, are nice guards with 60 health. With a Dominion Wand you can select an area for them to protect
Will dig 4 holes to bedrock bellow the Ritual Brazier, dropping all the mined blocks
When performed in a Village, it will start an Illager Raid. Additionally, by throwing an Emerald into the Ritual, you can start a Raid on its maximum difficulty

When performed, it will attempt to clear the weather. By throwing a Gunpowder into the Ritual, you can make it Rain and by throwing a Lapis Block into the Ritual, you can make it Storm. This Ritual can be used in combination with certain Botania Generating Floras to achieve cheap Mana production systems
This Ritual will destroy all the nearby mobs, giving you Experience Gems in the process. Note that the mobs will NOT give any of their regular drops
This Ritual requires an inscribed Warp Scroll. When activated, it will try to teleport all the nearby entities to the inscribed location on the Warp Scroll

This Ritual will try to heal all the nearby entities if Source is provided. It will damage all the nearby undead mobs. The Zombie Villagers present nearby will be instantly cured. If a player is present nearby, the cured Villager will also have trading discounts
Bookwyrm
This Script will allow you to summon a BookWyrm from your Spellbook to assist you in your adventures. Left Click for more info
The Bookwyrm is a familiar that will reduce the cost of all spells cast, and increase any spell damage by 1.
This Glyph can be obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a wield Bookwyrm. Can be unssumoned by using Dispel on it.
Sylph
This Script will allow you to summon a Sylph from your Spellbook to assist you in your adventures. Left Click for more info
Sylphs will reduce the cost of Elemental Earth glyphs by half, and grants bonus saturation when consuming food.
This Glyph can be obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a wield Sylph. Can be unssumoned by using Dispel on it.
Carbuncle
This Script will allow you to summon a Carbuncle from your Spellbook to assist you in your adventures. Left Click for more info

The Curbuncle is a familiar which will grant you Speed 2. Additionally, using a Golden Nugget on the Curbuncle will allow it to give you a short duration of the Scrying effect, which will allow you to see all the Gold Ores nearby.
This Glyph can be obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a wield Carbuncle. Can be unssumoned by using Dispel on it.
Drygmy
This Script will allow you to summon a Drygmy from your Spellbook to assist you in your adventures. Left Click for more info
The Drygmy is a familiar that will increase the damage of Earth spells by 2, and has a chance to increase the amount of looting when slaying enemies.
This Glyph cna be obtained by using the Ritual of Binding of a wield Drygmy. Can be unssumoned by using Dispel on it.
Wixie
This Script will allow you to summon a Wixie from your Spellbook to assist you in your adventures. Left Click for more info
The Wixie will increase the duration of potions that you consume. Additionally, the Wixie will apply harmful potions to enemies during combat.
This Glyph can be obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a wield Wixie. Can be unssumoned by using Dispel on it.
Fight Starter, no regrets: The Heisei Dream will, at the cost of some mana, force the nearby mobs to fight each other
Dungeon Loot Spawner: This flower will consume mana to summon powerful mobs which, when killed, will drop random dungeon loot items

Short Range Item Teleporter: The Spectranthemum will use mana to teleport any dropped item to a destination in a 11x11 area around it. A Wand of the Forest can be used to connect the flower to one block in this 11x11 area

The Flowers of Poseidon: The Bubbell is a flower which will clear all the water blocks in its vecinity to create 12x12x12 domes of air underwater when it's constantly supplied with mana. The Petite version of this flower will have a smaller radius
Nether Void Miner: Nether version of the Orechid. It will turn Netherrack into Nether like ores. Additionally it will work only in the Nether
Vagetal Tag Gun: The Labellia will use mana and Name Tags dropped into it to name all the items/mobs present in a nearby 5x5 radius
Slime-Chunk Detector
Wanna find slime chunks faster? When you're in a slime chunk, the slimeball present in this tiny jar will start to dance :D
The Extrapolated Bucket will void all the liquids it will pick up
This item will allow you to move Spawner around. Keep in mind it has only one use
Auto Ritual Flora: When placed near Master Rune Holder and provided with Mana, the Petrunia will be able to start Rune Rituals automatically
External Brewing Stand Heater: The Exoblaze will use Mana to heat up all the nearby Brewing Stands, thus removing the need of Blaze Powder
Effect: Will ignite blocks/entities for a short amount of time
Form: Will apply effects directly beneath your feet
Effect: Will give the Bouncy effect to the targeted entity. This will make it bounce just like if it was standing on a Slime Block

Effect: This one is kinda unique as it acts more like a Form Gliph. When cast upon a block, it will create a Rune which will act like a land mine. When a mob passes over the Rune, all the other effects specified in the Spell will be given to that mob
Effect: Will stop entities from moving/jumping
Effect: Will freeze the water and lava in a small area. It will also slow down entities for a short amount of time
Effect: Will summon a tamed horse with a saddle at the targeted location
Form: Will apply effects on the blocks you directly right-click on
Augment: Will allow certain Forms to target blocks they usually wouldn't target, such as air and water
Effect: Will place an item from the caster's inventory to a location

Effect: This is also quite an unique one. Even though it is an effect, you can consider it to be more of an Augment. All the Effect placed on the right side of this Effect will have a small delay before being casted
Effect: If cast upon a block, will create a light source. If cast upon yourself, you'll get Night Vision. If cast upon other entities, they'll get Glowing and Night Vision
Effect: Will place blocks from the caster's inventory. It will start with the hotbar
Effect: Will summon two wolves which will assist you in combat for a limited amount of time
Effect: Wil simulate shearing on different blocks and entities
Effect: Will damage a targeted entity. If used in combination with the Extend Time Augment, it will inflict the Poison Effect
Effect: Will allow you to active buttons/levers and basically just interact with everything from a distance
Augment: Will amplify the Effect Glyphs
Effect: Will create a temporary block at the targeted location
Effect: Will delete all the liquid in the targeted area
Effect: Will launch the target in the direction they're looking at
Effect: Will harvest a fully grown crop without breaking it
Effect: Will break the targeted block. Can be amplified to break blocks such as Obsidian
Effect: Will pick up all the items present in a small area near the targeted location
Effect: Will launch the targeted entity into the air
Effect: Will reove all the potion effects owned by an Entity. Can be used on a Witch with low health to obtain a Wixie Shard. Can be used on Familiars to unsummon them
Effect: Will give a speed boost to the targeted entity
Effect: Will pull the target closer to the caster
Form: Will apply effect on the one who casts the spell
Effect: Wil laplly the Wather Breathing Effect on the targeted entity
Form: Will launch a projectile that, on impact, will apply effects
Effect: Will push the targer away from the caster
Effect: When applied to an entity that's on fire, it will create a burst of damage and fire particles that will set the nearby entities on fire
Effect: Very similar to the Glyph of Flare, but it will apply to the entities that are wet, or affected by slowness
Effect: Will apply the Slow Fall effect on the targeted entities
Effect: Will turn stone into gravel and gravel into sand. Can also be used to damage mobs, especially underwater where the damage will be greater
Effect: Will smelt blocks and items in the world
Augment: Will make the projectile spells travel with greater speeds
Effect: Will cause the plants to accelerate in growth
Augment: Will decrease the power of a spell and also, its mana cost
Effect: Will make the targets invisible for a short amount of time
Effect: Will create a Firework at a targeted location
Augment: Will apply the Silk-Touch effect on any mined blocks. If included in a Explosion Spell, it will make the explosion drop all the blocks
Augment: Will reduce the time of of any given effects
Effect: Will switch the targeted block with the once present on your hotbar as if you had silk touch. Can be augmented to exchange blocks of higher harnesses
Effect: Will apply a flat amount of protection against physical and magical damage to the targeted entities
Effect: Will place water on a targeted location
Effect: Will harvest trees/mushrooms/cactuses from one 'blow'
Augment: Will extend the time of of any given effects
Effect: Will restore small amounts of health. When combined with Extended Time, it will apply Regeneration. It will damage undead mobs
Augment: When used in combination with a Projectile Spell, it will allow the projectile to pass through multiple mobs and blocks
Augment: Will increase the drop chance for any killed mobs and will also increase the drop chance for any mined ores
Effect: Will apply a devastating swipe of damage to the entities that are airborne. The higher the height they're at, the greater the damage. It all maxes out at a height of 10
Effect: Will allow you to acess your ender storage from anywhere
Effect: Will create an explosion at the targeted location
Augment: Will increase the working area of certain effects
Effect: Will force all the airborne entities to drop straight down, this includes gliding/flying/levitating
Effect: Will make the targeted blocks turn into air for a limited amount of time
Effect: Applies the Strenght Effect on the targeted entity
Augment: Will cause multiple projectiles to be launched at once
Effect: Will summon a decoy of yourself which will hold/wear the items your own. This decoy will attract all the nearby hostile mobs
Effect: Will increase the damage taken from poison, wither or fire. It will also reduce the mana regen rate
Effect: Will summon 3 Vexxes that will assist you in combat for a limited amount of time
Form: Will summon three projectiles that will orbit armound you and unleash effects when they hit any entity. This can be useful for defensive Spells
Effect: Upon being casted on an entity, it will unlesh lightning. It will also give the Shocked Effect that will increase the damage given by a lightning bolt

Effect: Will allow the caster to teleport to a location. When used on self, it will teleport you forward. When used on an entity while you're holding a Warp Scroll in your offhand, that entitiy will be teleported to the location saved on the Warp Scroll
Effect: This one is kinda special in the sense that it will act like an Augment. Upon teaching its target, it will create an area that will release Effects on the entities located in that said area
Effect: Will summon Evoker Fangs in the direction that this effect was casted
Effect: Will allow a targeted entity to glide just like if they had an elytra
Effect: Will apply the Wither Effect on any targeted entity
The Bookwyrm Charm will allow you to turn a vanilla Lectern into a Bookwyrm Lectern which will summon a wield Bookwyrm to assist you with certain tasks. Left Click for more info

To summon a Bookwyrm, you'll have to use the Bookwyrm Charm on a Vanilla Lectern. This action will turn the Lectern into a Bookwyrm Lectern which will also summon a Bookwyrm which will help your with certain tasks.
A Bookwyrm can receive Spell Parchments to cast Spells in the area surrounding their Lectern.
If they die, or are dispelled, they will drop their charm, so you can summon them again.

Bookwyrms can cast spells that start with the Touch, or Projectile forms. Bookwyrms will only cast a spell if every spell effect will do something. For example, Harvest, will only be cast on a tree or fully grown crop. Grow will only be cast on crops that are not fully grown. You can change this behaviour by using a Dominion Wand.

You can also use Bookwyrms to pickup items. Just make sure there's a chest next to their Lectern. Bookwyrms can also be used to place blocks and interact with the world with certain items. You may give an item or block to a Bookwyrm, and it will use the item directly from the chests adjacent to the lectern. The range of the Bookwyrm can be extended by using a Dominion Wand on the Bookwyrm's Lectern while sneaking.
Bookwyrms can be dyed using white, black, blue, green, red, or purple dye.
The Carbuncle Charm will allow you to summon a Carbuncle at a Summoning Crystal to assist you with certain tasks. Left Click for more info
To summon a Carbuncle, you need to use a Carbuncle Charm on a Summoning Crystal.
Carbuncles can be used to transfer items between inventories. They will also harvest fully grown Source Berries. They can be dyed with purple, red, yellow, orange, blue, or green dye.
To bind a Curbuncle to place items into a chest, use a Dominion Wand on the Carbuncle, and then, on that chest.
To bind a Carbuncle to take items from a chest, use the Dominion Wand on the chest, and then, on your Carbuncle.

While looking at your Curbuncle, you'll be able to see from how many chests items are taken and to how many chests, items are delivered. You can reset your Carbuncle by shif right-clicking them with the Dominion Wand.

Carbuncles can also accept filters. By placing Item Frames with items in them on a Chest, a Carbuncle will try to place only that item on the Chest. Now, what happens if you want more advanced filters? You can use Item Scrolls. There are 3 types of scrolls:
Allow - Will allow only the items listed on it to be placed. If used directly on a Carbuncle, it will interact only with those items.
Deny - Will not allow the items listed on it to be placed in a chest. If used on a Carbuncle, it will pickup any items, but not the ones listed on that scroll.
Mimic - Will allow only the items that are already present in a chest to be stored.
To add items to Scrolls, you'll have to place them on a Scribe's Table and then, shift right-click with the items you want on that Scroll.
Finally, you can tell your Carbuncles to use only certain paths. If you use a block on a Carbuncle, it will try to reach certain destinations only by walking on the delected block.
The Wixie Charm will allow you to turn a vanilla Cauldron into a Wixie Cauldron that will summon a wield Wixie to assist you with certain tasks. Left Click for more info
To obtain the Wixie Charm, you'll need a Wixie Shard which will be obtained by performing Dispel on a Witch that has less and half of its health.
Now, to summon a Wixie, just use the Charm on a vanilla Cauldron. This action will turn the Cauldron into a Wixie Cauldron that will also spawn a Wixie which can help you with automation.

Wixies can automatically craft items for you at the cost of some Source. To select an item for crafting, use that item on the Wixie Cauldron. The Wixie will automatically select the recipe for crafting based on the inventories nearby. You don't have to specify the exact materials for the recipe. You cna stop the crafting process by applying a redstone signal to the Cauldron.

Wixies can also automatically craft potions using nearby Potin Jars and items. Potions that require water will be supplied by the Wixie. Potions that require another potion as a base will be taken fron nearby Potion Jars. A Wixie will output 3 doses of a Potion into a nearby Potion Jar when the crafting process is complete. To begin, place down an empty Potion Jar, right-click the Cauldron with an Awkward Potion, and supply Nether Wart from a nearby chest.
The Sylph Charm will allow you to summon a Sylph at a Summoning Crystal to assist you with certain tasks. Left Click for more info
You can summon a Sylph by using a Sylph Charm on a Summoning Crystal.
Sylphs can be used to produce materials such as wood, crops, seeds and flowers from the plants around them.
A chest and a Source Jar have to be placed next to the Summoning Crystal to allow the Sylph to work properly. The amount of resourced produced by the Sylph will depend on its happiness.

To make a Syplh happy, a variety of blocks has to be present around its home. You can right click a Sylph with a block to see if it would like that block to be a part of its home. If you right click a Sylph with an empty hand, you'll receive some info about its happiness.
You can also give a Sylph an Item Scroll: Deny to stop it from producing certain resources.
The Drygmy Charm will allow you to turn a vanilla Mossy Cobblestone into a Drygmy Henge that will summon a Drygmy which will assist you with certain tasks. Left Click for more info

The Drygmy can be summoned by using a Drygmy Charm on a vanilla Mossy Cobblestone. This action will turn the Cobblestone into a Drygmy Henge which will also summon a Drygmy that can perform certain tasks.

Drygmys can produce Experiance Gems. It can also produce items from all the nearby mobs as if they were slain, however, this process relies on your Drygmy's happiness. To make a Drygmy happy, you need to have a decent amount of entities near the Drygmy's home point. You receive a happiness bonus for each unique type of entity.

To start working with Drygmys, you need to have a chest and a Source Jar placed next to the Drygmy Henge. You can summon more Dygmys by using more Charms on the Henge. Each Drygmy working around will contribute to a faster process. Once maximum process has been reached, the Henge will generate items and experience gems and will deposit them into the nearby inventories. Source will be used each time this process is finished. The number of resulting items and experience gems is equal to the Drygmy's happiness.

Spell Turrets work similar to a vanilla Dispancer. They can take spells from an inscribed piece of Spell Parchment. The spells can only have a Touch or a Projectile form. Upon receiving a redstone signal, the Turret will perform the spell at the cost of some Source from a nearby Source Jar. These can also be used to collect items if they have a chest next to them
This Turret will cast spells at half of theyr usual Source cost
The Potion Flask will be made using an Alfglass Flask. While it is NOT a direct upgrade to the Alfglass Flask, it will allow you to store 8 vanilla potions, so you can use them later
A modified version of the Potion Flask. The potions stored in it will have + 50% more duration
A modified version of the Potion Flask. The potions stored in it will have an increased level, but also a decreased duration
Occasionally, this Belt will grant a random positive effect for a short duration
This Ring will reduce the amount of mana used to cast a Spell. It will also provide a small bonus in maximum mana and mana regen
An upgraded version of Ring of Lesser Discount. This one will provide a slightly larger discount over its predecessor
This Amulet will increase the mana regeneration of the wearer by a moderate amount

Secondary Mana Generator: The Jar of Voiding can delete items on pickup to give you some mana in return. Shift right-click the jar to turn in on and right-click the jar with an item in your off-hand to select that item to be deleted by the jar
The Mana Fireflies: After right-clikcing with it, it will summon a light source that will follow you as long as you have the Jar in your inventory

The Potion Jar can be used to store up to 100 potions. You can take out potion from the Jar, using an Empty Bottle or a Potion Flask. These Jars can be locked using a Dominion Wand. Locked Jars can receive only the potion they're locked to

Ever wanter multiple potion effects in just one Bottle? Then, the Potion Melder is for you. This contraption can be used to create potions with mixed effects. The Potion Melder needs Source in order to operate and 3 Potion Jars attached to it, 2 on its sides and 1 bellow it. The resulting potions will be located in the Potion Jar placed beneath the Melder
Transfering Spells. Left Click for more info
The Scribe's Table is usedmainly to copy your spells to a new book, wither as a backup, or as a way to share with your friends.
To copy your spells, simply place a Spell Book on the Table, then, while sneaking, use another Spell Book on the Table.

The Scribe's Table can also be used to copy specific Spells to Spell Parchments which will be used to teach your servents how to cast them. To write a Spell on the Parchment, place the Parchment on the Table, select your Spell fron your Spell Book and then, while sneaking, right-click the Table.
Relays
Like Mana Spreads, but different. Left Click for more info
Enables the transport of source between Source Jars and other Relays. Source can be pulled from a Jar by using the Dominion Wand on the Jar, and then, on the Relay.
The Dominion Wand can then be used on the Relay, then on other targets to send the Source wherever it is needed.
Shift Right-Click on the Relay to clear all connections.
Relays have a range of 30 blocks.
The Default Relay has 3 alternate versions. These include the Splitter Relay, the Warper Relay and the Depositor Relay.
The Splitter Relay will support taking and transferring to multiple Jars at once. It has a larger through-put then the default Relay and it will split this through-put to multiple Jars.
The Warper Relay is a long range Relay. It can teleport Source to distances larger then 30 blocks, but there might be a slight Source loss for this.
Lastly, the Depositor Relay will place the Source sent to it, into the Jars located in the 5 blocks area next to it.

Wanna summon animals/shulkers/villagers? The Cocoon of Caprice will turn into a baby animal after two minutes since it was placed. 95% of the time it will  into a farm animal. 5% of the time it will become a Horse, a Wolf or an Ocelot. Up to 20 Chorus Fruit can be given to the cocoon to give it a chance to spawn a Shulker instead of an animal. Emeralds will cause it to spawn a baby Villager instead. Each item will increase the chance by 5%
Ever wanted a Sky Island, but were too lazy to make one? Left Click for more info
The Shard of Laputa has to be used on a block. It will start lifting the nearby ground 42 blocks up, slowly creating a floating island.
There are 20 varieties of the shard, each with higher Shard Power, up to Shard Power XX.
An island created by the level I shard has a radius of 14 blocks. Each additional level of Shard Power increases the radius by 1 block, up to a maximum of a radius of 33 blocks.
In terms of the dimensions the lifted island would take up, a level I shard will lift a sphere of dimensions 27x27x27 blocks, while a level XX shard will produce a sphere of dimensions 65x65x65.
Craft the Shard with Gaia Spirits to bring them to the next level.
The Material StoneWork Factory can be used to produce different types of building materials out of lava and water. It can also be used to obtained some compressed versions of some blocks
Place that liquid in my bucket. Left Click for more info
The Fluid Encapsulator is a machine that can infuse certain items/blocks with various liquids. It can also be used to fill containers, such as buckets with various liquids.
This machine will be essential in the production process of Flux-Infused materials, XP bottles and, of course, Fluix Pearls.
This machine can receive augments for better processing speeds, less RF/FE consumption and more.
Just like regular Glass, however, it will not allow light to pass through it. Can be very useful in mob farms to view what's happening inside
The Xp Drain

The Xp Drain is a block that can suck all the xp you currently have on you. Just place it down, and step on it. If you have any experience levels, they'll be stored in the drain's internal tank. From here, you can extract it with pipes, buckets, bottles, anything you like
The Resolute Ivy
The Resolute Ivy can be combined with any item to add one use of the SoulBound effect to it. On short, if you die with that item in your inventory, you'll keep it when you respawn
Can be added to any Tool/Armor from Tinker's Construct for an additional Ability Slot. These, unlike other modifiers can be stacked forever
Can be added to any Armor from Tinker's Construct for an additional Defense Slot. These, unlike other modifiers can be stacked forever
Can be added to any Tool/Armor from Tinker's Construct for an additional Upgrade Slot. These, unlike other modifiers can be stacked forever
Why does a block have only 6 sides? :/ Left Click for more info

The Entangled Block can be used to extend the functionality of other blocks further. Usually, a block/machine has only 6 sides, but by connecting that block/machine to this masterpiece, you can add 6 more sides to your machine, and even move it to other locations. They have infinite range. Less cables; more wireless!
Be aware! The Entangled Block does NOT work between dimensions!
ftbquests.chapter.useful_items_4.title: 实用物品 - 4
The Dark Matter Pedestal is a utility device added by ProjectE. It can hold a ProjectE utility item, such as the Repair Talisman, and asymmetrically project the effect in a 10x10x10 area centered around the pedestal's upper southeast corner. An item can be placed on the pedestal by Right Clicking it. Right Clicking it with an empty hand toggles the effects on or off. When the pedestal is active, small flames appear around the base. Items placed on the Dark Matter Pedestal can be removed by Left Clicking on the Pedestal
The Interdiction Torch is an item added by ProjectE. It will protect an area of 8x8 blocks around it from hostile mobs. However, Arrows and Potions may still pass through this protective area

The Repair Talisman is an item added by ProjectE. Like its name might suggest, it has the ability to repair items while it is being held in your inventory. You can also place it in an Alchemical Chest to use its repairing properties, but regular Chests won't work. Finally, the Talisman can also be placed on a Dark Matter Pedestal and it will repair the items from the inventory of the player that's nearby
A useful, powerful Magnet. Left Click for more info
The Black Hole Band is a powerful Magnet added by ProjectE.

By Right Clicking with it, all the dropped items nearby will be attracted to you. If it is placed inside of an Alchemical Chest, or an Alchemical Bag, all the dropped items nearby will be attracted to that Alchemical Chest, or Alchemical Bag.
Right Clicking a Liquid with it, will void the Liquid.
While it is on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will suck all the nearby dropped items and it will drop them into any adjent inventories.
The Arrow Machine Gun. Left Click for more info
The Archangel's Smite is an alchemical power item that consumes Redstone/Glowstone to produce massive quantities of arrows.

Unlike an ordinary bow, these arrows have the power to pass through the localized time field produced by a Watch of Flowing Time. In addition to this, these arrows are created rapidly and they should target the mob which is closest to them (given that they're fired very close to that mob).
While it's on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will constantly start to shoot arrows at the mobs nearby.
Praying to Ceres. Left Click for more info
The Harvest Goddess Band is a tool from ProjectE. It is related to accelerated plant growth and other fertility utilities.

While holding plants/seeds in your inventory, Right Clicking with this Ring, will plant them nearby. For example, Sugar Cane will be planted on the nearest position available. Seeds will be planted on the neaby farmland .
The 'Change Mode' key will make the Ring harvest all the nearby crops/grass/leaves.
It will consume EMC from Redstone/Glowstone or a Klein Star to accelerate the growth of all the nearby crops.
When it is placed on a Dark Matter Pedestal, the growth of the Nearby Plants, will be accelerated. It will also harvest the Grown Crops.
Let the Flames out. Left Click for more info
The Ring of Ignition is a tool from ProjectE. It can be used to launch fireballs, using the 'Fire Projectile' key, which will light a 3x3x3 area on fire.
The Ring can be activated using the 'Change Mode' key. It will light up all the blocks near your position.
It also has 2 passive abilities. While walking through Fire, it will extinguish the fire sources in front of you. It will also make you immune to fire damage and it will extinguish you instantly.
While it's on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will ignite the mobs nearby.
Sub Zero. Left Click for more info

The Zero Ring is a tool from ProjectE. It is related to cold, icy things. When Right Clicking with it, the Ring will place snow near your position and it will also freeze Water and Lava, turning it into Obsidian.
The Ring can be charged using the 'Charge' key. Using the 'Charge' key while sneaking, will discharge the Ring. Certain levels of Charge, will make the Ring's Right Click feature be more powerful.
By pressing the 'Change Mode' key, the Ring will start to freeze the entire area around your position.
When placed on a Dark Matter Pedetal, the Ring will extinguish entities and will freeze the area nearby.
The Creative Flight Ring. Left Click for more info

The Swiftwolf's Rending Gale is a power ring from ProjectE. The Swiftwolf's Rending Gale allows the player the ability to fly without Creative Mode, create repulsive force fields, or shoot projectiles while consuming EMC from items in the inventory or from a charged Klein Star.

Pressing the 'Fire Projectile' key, will fire a projectile which will launch mobs into the air, if you have Redstone in your inventory. If you have Glowstone, you'll launch projectiles with will summon a lightning bolt. While holding Redstone/Glowstone in your inventory, you should be able to fly like you're in Creative mode.

Pressing 'Spacebar' twice will allow you to fall down. Right Click abilities are still available. If you open your inventory and remove the Swiftwolf's Rending Gale while flying, you will fall. It will consume 64 EMC from a Klein Star every 6 seconds while flying.

Passive Effect: With Swiftwolf's Rending Gale in the hotbar, the player is immune to fall damage. Also, the player will not be able to \"trample\" tilled soil with the Rending Gale in the hotbar unless a Crop has been placed. These effects also work from the Curios slot.
Passive Effect: If you press Right Click, a mob repulsive field will be created around you. This will keep all the mobs away from you.

The Body Stone can be used to keep your hunger bar full at all times. The 'Change Mode' key can be used to activate the stone. It will fill your hunger bar by consuming 2 redstone from your inventory for each 2 hunger points. When placed on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will fill the nearby players's hunger bars

The Soul Stone can be used to give yourself health in tight situations. The 'Change Mode' key can be used to activate the stone. It will heal you by consuming 2 redstone from your inventory for each 2 health points. When placed on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will heal the nearby players

The Mind Stone is a essencially a limitless Storage for XP. It can be activated using the 'Change Mode' key. Once activated, it will rapidely suck all of your XP levels. The XP levels can be retrived by Right Clicking with the Stone. When it's placed on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will suck all the nearby XP orbs

The Life Stone is a combination of the Body Stone and the Soul Stone. It will both heal you and keep your hunger bar filled, as long as you have redstone in your inventory to keep it running. When placed on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will heal the nearby players and will also keep their hunger bars filled
Infinite Lava Bucket. Left Click for more info

The Volcanite Amulet is a powerful tool that can easily cause much destruction if not used carefully. Similar to the Evertide Amulet, the Volcanite Amulet is a more costly tool. It is multi-use items, and has many possible applications.
The Volcanite Amulet has four pertinent powers:

- Pressing the 'Fire Projectile' key, will launch a volcanite projectile, a slow-moving lava bolt. If it comes near any water block, it will evaporate that block instantly. This function is free. If it comes in contact with the sky while raining, however, it will halt precipitation, and consume 1 redstone dust. Upon striking the ground, naturally, the Volcanite projectile will use 1 redstone dust and produce lava.

- Upon striking a foe or creature, it will set that creature on fire, doing a strong hit of fire damage and burning for an extended duration at the cost of 2 redstone dust. If the alchemist has no reagents, however, the Volcanite will do a meager single point of damage, and the fire will flicker only briefly.

- When right clicking any block face, the amulet will consume 1 redstone dust and create a block of lava. The Volcanite can also be charged to a max of 4 levels and produce a large row or column of lava, each block consuming redstone depending on how many lava blocks were created. This is useful for laying out large sections of obsidian-fodder or collecting it for geothermal generators.

- Similar to the Evertide, the Volcanite has the power to \"walk on lava\", and as long as it is equipped, it grants lava and fire immunity (see notes below if using Aether mod) - To go down in lava press \"shift\" to go up simply press \"space\" . It also protects you from lightning, however being struck is still a very rare occurrence.
While it's on a Dark Matter Pedestal, it will prevent rain and snow storms.
Infinite Water Bucket. Left Click for more info
The Evertide Amulet is similar to the Volcanite Amulet. It is a powerful tool that can easily make a mess if not used cautiously. The Evertide Amulet has three pertinent powers:

- Pressing the 'Fire Projectile' key will shoot projectiles spawns water remotely at whatever block it collides with, for free. If the projectile passes near lava blocks of any kind, it will cool them as though struck by water. If fired at the sky, however, the Evertide will cause it to start raining.

- Right Clicking will place a single block of water at your target. Right clicking while charged, instead, will place a very large quantity of water at your target. Aiming straight down while doing so will create a square pool. Aiming up, instead, produces a towering ground-fountain from the earth.
- While the Evertide is equipped you won't be able to drown in water. You'll also be able to walk on water.
While it's on a Dark Matter Pedestal, the Amulet will create rain and snow storms.
Time Dilation in your POCKET! Left Click for more info
The Watch of Flowing Time is an alchemical power item added by ProjectE.
It can speed up machines around you at a set rate and slow down mobs at the same time. In addition to that, it grants you the ability to speed up or to reverse the speed of the sun and the moon.
Note that, same as with other ProjectE items, this one can be charged too. The Watch's ability to affect the sun and the moon is determined by the amount of charge pressent in the Watch.
Shaping the World III. Left Click for more info

The Mercurial Eye, powered by a Klein Star, turns raw EMC into your choice of block and places nicely stacked walls of the target block or smooth walls. If you choose, the Mercurial Eye can transmute the target block into a block of your choice using the existing block's EMC to defray the cost of replacing.

The Mercurial Eye has the power to build walls straight from the energy source of a Klein Star. To change the area covered by the Eye, press the 'Charge' key. To open its GUI, press the 'Extra Function' key. Modes can be changed by pressing the 'Change Mode' key. The Eye can be discharged by pressing the 'Charge' key while holding 'Shift'.

Upon opening the GUI, you will see a target slot, used to select the block of choice, and a Klein Star slot, which you are required to give a source of power. It's possible to place non-block place-able items in the Target slot, such as Ladders or torches, but the item will not be placed correctly, and will drop once the block is updated. The Mercurial Eye has 4 modes:
Creation Mode: This mode acts as if you were holding the target block; useful for precision work. Be careful - the Eye does not care for your location when placing the block down.

Extension Mode: The wall you are building extends from existing structures. This is extremely useful for things such as aiming down and creating bridges. Your position relative to the aimed face determines how the extension is oriented. Requires charge, which lays down blocks in a square around the aimed block.

Pillar-Extension Mode: This mode creates a huge pillar which extends in the opposite direction of the aimed face, i.e. away from you. Requires charge. Do not fire upwards. At full charge it creates a 3x3x15 pillar in the direction you are aiming.

Transmutation Mode: Whatever your target block is, it will transmute the blocks you target to, similar to extension mode. If the EMC of the changed block was greater than your target, you absorb the EMC. If it was less, you spend EMC. If it is the same, the power costs nothing! This function can be very helpful for building in a material that is particularly difficult to remove, such as obsidian. Rather than building with obsidian, simply build in dirt or another easily cleaned up block, then convert it into obsidian when the structure is done. At full charge it transmutates a 9x9x1 area.
Shaping the World II. Left Click for more info
The Hyperkinetic Lens is a tool that launches a sphere of energy which explodes on impact. The size of the explosion depends on the charge of the Hyperkinetic Lens.
Charge lvl 0 - Radius: 1, very small, 1 glowstone dust
Charge lvl 1 - Radius: 1.66, still small, 2 glowstone dust
Charge lvl 2 - Radius: 2.33, average, 4 glowstone dust
Charge lvl 3 - Radius: 3, rather large, 6 glowstone dust
The lens does fairly potent damage to mobs AND players, including the player using it. Be mindful when using it at close range.

After you've selected a location, just close the GUI, and Right Click the Dislocator to teleport to that selected location. This action will consume one Fuel.
The Dislocator also has a Blink mode which will basically turn you into an Enderman. You'll be able to teleport forwand on a short range with this mode.

The Energy Tranfuser is a very powerul charger with 4 slots and it's added by Draconic Evolution.

It can charge multiple items, either from Left to Right, or in a Balanced Mode which will fill all slots at the same time if all of them have items to fill up with power.

The Ender Cell is an Energy storage option added by Powah. It is part of the Ender Network. The Ender Network is a Wireless - Channel Based energy storage option. It is player locked. Besides this, each Ender Cell has (kinda) the same Energy Storage Capacity, which is, in fact, configurable. The Ender Cells can receive regular Energy Cells to increase their Energy Storage Capacities. Draconic Reactor
*The Safest and Most Basic Power Source Ever Made*. Left Click for more info

This is last and, most probably, the best power option available in this pack. Now, if you're familiar with the Draconic Evolution mod, you'll know that the DE Reactor, if not maintained properly, will explode.
Well, you cna rest easy knowing that, in this pack, the DE Reactor will NOT explode. Or.. at least it will not make this big of a blast:
Yeah, see that? That will never happen here. However, if it's not maintained properly, a small explosion will still take place. In it's aftermath, some lava sources will also appear.
Now, considering the fact that this thing can output 50M RF/T, we think that a tiny explosion will not stop you from building it.
Let's see how to start.

First, you place the Draconic Reactor Core where you want the center of your reactor to be. This is where the actual reaction will take place, and it will grow depending on the temperature and fuel you put in it. Next, you take 4 Reactor Stabilizers and place them in a ring around the core, the recommended distance being 5 blocks. They can be placed up to 6 blocks away, but must be in the same setup. They can also be placed vertically around the core. They must have a direct line-of-sight to the core when placed, otherwise they will not register.
Once you have the ring built, right click on any of the Stabilizers to bring up the Reactor GUI. If there is no GUI, you probably did something wrong.

If the GUI shows up, then, you can place the Energy Injector on one of the sides of the core that doesn't have a Reactor Stabilizer. This block is important, because it feeds RF back into the Reactor. Yes, the Reactor needs some RF to work properly and generate proper power amounts. Same as with the Stabilizers, the Injector can be placed at a maximum distance of 6 blocks between the Reactor Core and the Injector.
If the things are good, you should have something like this:
Now, assuming that you have fuel (Awakened Draconium), nothing should stop you from starting this Reactor, but we'd advice you to wait and prepare some safety measures.

Let's talk about some technical safety measures. The Reactor doesn't have a concept of \"limits\", and will give or take as much RF as it can. This will create an unstable reactor, and eventually an explosion. It's a good idea to use a couple of Flux Gates, which limits how much RF/t can flow through it. It is also adjustable with a redstone signal, therefore it may be a good idea to place a Supplementaries Crank on each one. The Flux Gate is directional, with the side with the Blue Square being the input, and the side with the Orange Square being the output. Place one Flux Gate with its Blue side on the back of one of the Stabilizers, then place a second Flux Gate with its Orange side facing the bottom of the Energy Injector. This allows you to control how much RF/t is going out of and into the reactor, respectively.
Now, let's talk about the GUI of the Reactor:
Temperature: This is the Temperature of the Core. Keep this bellow 8000 and you should be ok.

Shield Strenght: This is the strenght of the shield preventing the reactor from exploding! You will want to find a nice balance for this. Too high and the Shield will consume more power then the Reactor can produce and it won't be able to self sustain its reaction. Too low and you risk an explosion.
Saturation: This is the energy stored in the Reactor's Core.

Fuel Conversion: This shows how much you have burned through your fuel. The higher the Core Temperature, the faster the Reactor will burn fuel. The fusion of Draconium will result into the Chaos Element. As the Level of Chaos within the Core increases, so does the reactivity of the Draconium. The higher the reactivity, the more energy will the Reactor produce. This means that, a reactor which was started with 8 Awakened Draconium Blocks, will initially produce small amounts of power, but as time passes and the Draconium is turned into Chaos, you'll produce much more power (and higher temperatures also). A quick tip is that, if you want to start producing more power from the beginning, you can start your reactor with 4 Awakened Draconium Blocks and 4 Chaos Shards in it. This will make the amount of Chaos even with the amount of Draconium and it will result in a hotter Reactor Core and in more RF outputs.

Now, a warning about Fuel in general. You CAN'T run a Reactor just with Chaos in it. Chaos needs Draconium in order to regulate itself. Without it, well.. you can imagine. Now, to refuel the Reactor, you MUST SHUT IT DOWN. Before doing this, make sure you have a significant backlog of power to supply the containment field while it shuts down. When you hit the 'Shutdown' button, the Reactor will immediately stop outputing power, and it will start the Shutdown process. This requires near 100% Saturation, thus allowing the generation rate to drop, which in term, allows the Temperature to drop. Once the Saturation passes around 99%, the Temperature will drop bellow 2000 degrees, fusion will cease and the Core will enter in the 'Cool Down' mode.
Other elements of that GUI we were talkb about before, would be:
Core Volume: The size of the Reactor. This will be visible only after the Reaction was started and the value whown here will be based on how much Fuel you gave the Reactor at the beginning.
Generation Rate: This is the rate at which the Reactor will produce power.
Field Input Rate: The energy input required to maintain the current Shield Strength.
Fuel Conversion: This is how much Fuel the Reactor is currently consuming. It is measured in nano buckets (1/1000th is a mb) per tick.
Now let's cover the Reactor's operation modes:
Offline: The Reactor is turned off. It is the ONLY state in which you can dismantle it.

Warming Up: The Phase where the Reactor will require power in order to charge iteself. Power will be provided to the Energy Injector which will, then, charge the Reactor. Initially, the Shield will be charged to 50%, then the Saturation to 50%, and finally, the Temperature will reach 2000 degrees. After this point, you can start up the Reactor.

Online: This is the state in which the Reactor will produce the most amounts of power. You must maintain a balance between the amount of energy you supply the containment field and the amount of energy you extract. The more power you pull from the Reactor, the more the Reactor's Saturation will drop. The Reactor will compensate for this by incresing its generation rate to match the rate at which you're extracting power.

Cooling Down: This is the state where the Fusion was stopped and the reactor is Cooling Down.  At this point the containment field can shut down. Once the core cools sufficiently, you'll be able to refuel or dissmantle the Reactor. Even tho the Reactor is cooling down, it is still not safe break the Reactor unit. You should wait until the temperature is below 300 degrees. If you break the Reactor ar this point, there will be no explosion, but the result will also not be ideal.

Explosion Imminent: Usually, we'd tell you that, if you're seeing this, you should run. However, that will not be the case here. If your reactor gets into this mode, well.. you should just prepare some buckets and some construction blocks to repair the small damage that's gonna be caused. Know that, once the Reactor is in this state, there's nothing you can do to stop it. The GUI will show the ETA of the upcomming explosion.

Finally know that you can regulate the Reactor using just vanilla Redstone. Other advanced regulation and monitorization systems can be poerformed using ComputerCraft and the Lua programming language to keep track of your Reactor's stats.

Stabilized Mob Spawner
Grinding Forever! Left Click for more info

Now that you've officially entered in Draconic Evolution, certain benefits (such as this one) will become available to you. Ever wanted to have your own mob spawner powerful enough that it can summon up to 12 mobs every 5 seconds? Say \"hello\" to the Stabilized Mob Spawner.

This beauty is obtained by right-clicking a vanilla mob spawner with a Draconic Core, Wyvern Core, Awakened Core or Chaotic Core. When the Core is applied, the spawner will drop as an item and can be picked up by the player. When the spawner initially drops, it retains the information about the type of mob to spawn, so if you convert a Zombie Spawner to a Stabilized Mob Spawner, you'll get a Stabilized Zombie Spawner.

Now, let's say you want to change the type of spawner you have. You can turn your spawner, into another type of spawner, using a Mob Soul. Mob Souls are a rare drop when killing a mob using a Draconic Evolution weapon. The percentage chance of a Mob Soul drop can be increased with the Reaper enchantment.

Note that, when breaking a Stabilized Mob Spawner, its contents will be lost. However, you can use a tool that preserves metadata such as a Cardboard Box from Mekanism can relocate the spawner without losing its mob soul.

Now, let's talk about tiers, because unlike a vanilla Spawner, this one is more potent. The tier of a Stabilized Mob Spawner is determined by the Core used. Right-clicking a Stabilized Mob Spawner with a different kind of core will apply the new Core and release the old Core.
- Draconic Core: Spawns up to 4 mobs every 10-40 seconds. A player must be in range and all normal spawning requirements must be met.
- Wyvern Core: Spawns up to 6 mobs every 5-20 seconds. Player is not required but all normal spawning requirements must be met.
- Awakened Core: Spawns up to 8 mobs every 2.5-10 seconds. No other requirements.
- Chaotic Core: Spawns up to 12 mobs every 1.25-5 seconds. No other requirements.

Item exchanger! Left Click for more info
The Transmutation Table is a working station added by ProjectE. It functions as a battery for EMC energy, a charger for EMC storage items, as a library of blueprints and as a fabricator of items.

Before it can create an item, the Transmutation Table must \"learn\" the item. This is performed by placing an item with an EMC value into the \"flames\" slot on the GUI. The item is then destroyed, the recipe learned and the EMC value stored in the table.
Creating an item from EMC is performed by clicking on an item displayed on the right side. Shift-clicking will create an entire stack (if the table holds sufficient EMC).
The icon with the crossed-out book is to unlearn unwanted items. Any item placed in this slot will be \"forgotten\" by the table until it is learned again.
The table will only display items for which there is enough stored EMC to create.
The information held in the table is linked to the individual player:
- The table can be picked up and moved without losing any recipes or stored energy.
- Other players accessing the table will only be able to see their own data.
- Personal EMC data can by accessed by using another player's table.
Klein Stars can be charged by placing a star in one of the slots on the left side of the GUI and it can be discharged by putting it in the slots on the right.
The Transmutation Tablet is a very expensive item. It is essencially the Portable version of the Transmutation Table
Shaping the World I. Left Click for more info
The Catalytic Lens is an item added by ProjectE. Its purpose is to help you shape the world as you please.
When pressing the 'Fire Projectile' key (bind it in your Controls menu) with the Catalytic Lens equipped the Lens fires an explosive projectile which destroys a large area upon contact with a block.
Pressing Right Click with the Catalytic Lens, functions like the Destruction Catalyst, destroying a 3x3 panel where you clicked.

When you press the 'Charge Item' key, the Right Click function of the Catalytic Lens becomes more powerful, digging out long 3x3 tunnels. At max charge, the Catalytic Lens breaks through as many as 64 layers.
All Block Breaking tools use 16EMC/Block Broken.

The Hydroponic Bed is a machine designed to boost the spedd growth of crops. It will use water (and lava for nether crops) to boost the growing speed of crops. If Ether Gas is used, the crops will be boosted even more. They'll also be harvested automatically. The Crop has to be planted directly on the Hydroponic Bed. Ether Gas can be obtained in an Alchemical Imbuer with some Industrial Foregoing Fertilizer and some Liquid Hydrongen Chloride

The Plant Gatherer is a machine designed to harvest trees and crops. If a tree is bigger then the working area of the Gatherer, the tree will still be harvested entirely. The Gatherer will also produce small amounts of Sludge for each operation. Sludge can later be refined into new items

The Plant Sower is a machine designed to automatically plant crops with ease. Seeds have to be provided in the Right side. The Left side of the GUI is where you'll tell the machine in which regions of its working area should it plant the crops (given that you've upgraded the machine to plant crops on an area larger then 1x1)

The Plant Fertilizer is a machine that will ocnstantly apply Bone Meal/Industrial Forgoing Fertilizer to the Crops located in its working area. The Plant Fertilizer will attempt to apply Bone Meal to each plant, one by one and it will NOT move to the next one until the current one is not fully grown. This might be an advantage, or a disadvantage for you, depending on your needs
The Animal Feeder will give food to you animals and it will allow them to reproduce, as long as it has animals in its working area and proper food items in its internal storage

The Mob Crusher is an alternative for the Mob Slaughet Factory. However, unlike the latter mentioned one, the Crusher will produce Essence (liquid XP) from the mobs killed, instead of Liquid Meat and Pink Slime

When providing power and a Mob filled Mob Emprisonment Tool to this machine, it will allow you to basically have your own custom spawner for very specific entities you might require. It will also require Essence (liquid XP) to work properly, so a large XP famr with a Mob Crusher might be good to have

The Wither Builder will use Power, Wither Skeleton Skulls and Soul Sand Blocks to build the the Wither Structure in the Working Area. This machine can accept Redstone interactions and different Augments from Industrial Foregoing
When Animals such as Cows are positioned in the working area of the Sewer, it will start to collect Sewage from them. This liquid can later be turned into Fertilizer unsing a Sewage Composter
This Machine can turn Sewage into Fertilizer. This can be later used exactly like Bone Meal
The Animal Baby Separator will take all the baby mobs it detects and it will attempt to teleport them to its back, efficiently separating the babies from the adults

This machine will take an item, some Essence (liquid XP) and it will attempt to enchant that item with a lvl 30 enchantment. We presume that you can imagine how much potential this thing has. No? Fine. Combine it with an Enchantment Extractor and you'll probably get OP in no time
The Infinity Charger might be the fastest charger you're ever gonna get. Unfortunately, it has only one slot, but if you're in a rush for getting an item full with power, this might be your best bet

Having too much enchanted items? Too much trash items? Are you having a bad time organizing yourself? Fear not. The Enchantment Sorter is for you. This machine will separate all the enchanted items from the regular ones with no problem. It also has more useful setting regarding NBT data and more, but you'll figure it out. Combine it with other Enchantment related machines from Industrial Foregoing and watch as you obtain an amazing Factory
The Enchantment Applicator will take a series of regular items, some Enchanted Books and it will attempt to combine them. Think of this machine as an Auto-Anvil

The Stasis Chamber is pretty much a machine coming from the year 2099. It will freeze and heal the entities located in its working area. Now, if that's not some advanced techniques of medicine, then it might be straight up, dark magic

Ever wanted a Machine that would take thousands of Enchanted Items and would just - take the enchantments off of them? Well, your dream just got real. The Enchantment Extractor will take items such as Swords, Bows and more and will take their Enchantments off of them for you to use them later as you wish

The Mob Detector can be very useful in very advanced mob farms. It will try to detect all the entities located in front of it. It will also emit a Redstone Signal with a strength based on the number of entities detected. Make good use of this device

The Mechanical Dirt is an organic machine which will use 1000 RF and 20mb of Liquid Meat to summon a mob. Apart from this, a light level of 7, or lower has to be provided for the Block to work properly
The Block Breaer, as its name might suggest, will simply, break any block that's in front of it, excluding Bedrock

The Marine Fisher is a pretty nifty device. When it's placed above a water source, or when its working area is located in water, it will start to constantly obtain fishing loot, such as Fish, Treasure Items (Enchanted Books), Trash Items (Leather Boots) and more
The Fluid Placer, as its name might suggest, will place liquids down. This might be helpful for certain types of automation
The Block Placer, unlike its cousin, the Block Breaker, will place blocks, instead of breaking them. Can be useful in automatization to minimize the amount of space necessary for certain tasks

The Ore Laser Base is a Void Miner added by Industrial Foregoing. By itself, it is not of much use, but combined with Laser Drills, it might prove to be useful. You can use as many Laser Drills as you want, as long as they can interract with the Laser Base itself. Once the Drills are powered, the Base will start to produce Ores. The Dimension/Biome that this structure will be located, will affect the types of Ores you'll obtain. Use JEI to find more. You can also select the Depth at which you wish the Base will search for ores. Lastly, you can craft Colored Lenses which will affect the Type of Ore you'll obtain. Left Click to see an example setup
In the Example below, Creative Energy Cubes were used to power the Laser Drills. You'll probably have to use something else, of course.
The Fluid Collector, like its name might suggest, will pick up any liquid that comes in contact with its working area
When water (and lava, for nether fungi) is provided to this Machine, it can star to duplicate Mushrooms

If you're not a fan of Ars Nouveau's brewing system, then perhaps, this machine might be for you. The Potion Brewer is basically an Auto-Brewing Stand. Water, Blaze Powder, and other potion ingredients have to be proivded, in order for it to work properly
The Sludge Refiner will take Sludge Liquid from other machines, and it will process the Sludge to turn in into Dirst, Gravel, Sand, Clay and other blocks

The Dye Mixer might help you with the task of obtaining all the 16 MC dyes. It will require only Red, Green and Blue dyes and with a little bit of power, it will be able to produce all the other dyes from vanilla MC

These Laser can be positioned close to the Laser Drill Base. If they can interract with the Base, some white particles will appear, confirming the connection exists. Each one of the Lasers will require power in order to operate

The Mob Enprinsoment Tool is an item added by Industrial Foregoing. It can be used to capture any mob you want (except boss mobs). It can also be used in a Mob Duplicator to basically create a Mob Farm of your Choise
Draconic Energy Network. Left Click for more info
The Draconic Evolution Ebergy Network is unlike any other. Both visually and functionally, it is unique.
You'll need a Crystal Binder to properly work with this system.

The Network is comprised of Energy Cystals. Each one of them will have an internal energy buffer and they can be linked to one another using the Crystal Binder. When 2 or more of them are linked, they'll attempt to balance their stored energy so they are both at the same Charge Level. Each Crystal can only support a limited numer of connections and the number is limited by the Type and Tier of the Crystal.

In order to link two Crystals together, or to a machine, simply Shift Right Click on one of the Crystals with the Binder. After that, simply Right Click the target block to create a link. The Binder will remember the block it is bound to until you bind it to another block or Shift Right Click the air.
Now, about the Crystals. There are 3 types of Crystals. Energy I/O, Energy Relay and Wireless Energy.

The Energy IO is a Crystal you'll need to insert/extract power from your crystal network. To use this Crystal, simply place it on the side of your energy source/consumer and connect it to your Crystal Network. This Crystal has 2 I/O modes which you can cycle between by Shift Right Clicking them with an empty hand.
Input will make the Crystal accept energy from the attached block.
Output will attempt to power the block that's attached to the Crystal.

The Energy Relay is a Crystal mean to act as a hub to which you can connect other Crystals. Therefore it supports a lot more connections then the I/O one. This Crystal can only link to other Crystals and cannot be connected to machines, or other blocks.

Wireless Energy is a Crystal similar to the energy realy, except that it supports fewer Crystal Links. It can Wirelessly connect to a number of receivers. This connection can supply or receive power from devices depending on the Crystals I/O mode. The max energy flow is lower then that of the I/O Crystal. The Advantage of it, however, will be that fact that it supports a large number of connections , meaning that you cna place one in the middle of your base and have it power most, if not all, of your machines. Or place it in the middle of your power plant and have it pull power from all of your generators.
The Energy Meter

At first sight, this block doesn't look like much, but don't be fooled by its appearance. This thing, besides being an RF transfer monitor, is also a very potent energy conductor. So potent, that it can transfer almost infinite amounts of RF. You might find a use for it while working with Draconic Reactors. Be aware, if you're gonna use this machine with any mundane cables or another energy transport options, you're gonna run into energy limitations emposed by those transport options
